loans.name: Yasmeen's Group

texts.en:
Yasmeen baji is the wife of Ifitkhar A.. (Baji is an Urdu term meaning "eldest sister".) The couple lives in a two-room brick house with their three sons in Arifwala, Pakistan. Her eldest son, Sultan Haider, is in kindergarten.

Yasmeen successfully repaid her first loan from a microfinance institute of Pakistan. She used the money to purchase a vehicle made by Mazda. She is a housewife and runs an academy where she teaches young girls the skill of stitching clothes. Her daily income is approximately five dollars.. She is requesting a loan to buy an electric sewing machine.

She has one other member named Nasreen baji who wants loan to buy donkey cart. The loan will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase an electric sewing machine to teach young girls how to sew

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Asasah, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. D. Thi Pham, 46 years old, has two children living with her. The children are attending school, while her husband is working abroad in Russia. Every household duty, including taking care of the children, is done by her own two hands. Even with the heavy load of family duties, she also runs a general store. The retail sales with daily revenues is a very good fit with borrowing money and repaying it on a weekly basis. She joined the Fund from its very beginning, the loans from the Fund were always put towards buying more goods to sell. The general store brings an average daily income of 100,000 VND a day. In this round of funding she is requesting 7,000,000 VND to buy more stock goods.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva volunteer

Chị Phạm Thị Đoan 46 tuổi, chị có 2 con đang sống cùng chị các con của chị đang đi học, chồng chị đi xuất khẩu lao động tại nước nga. Mọi công việc gia đình, chăm sóc con cái đều do đôi bàn tay của chị. Với nhiều công việc gia đình như vậy xong chị vẫn mở một của hàng tạp hóa, việc kinh doanh bán hàng tạp hóa cho thu nhập hàng ngày là rất phù hợp cho việc vay vốn trả tuần, chị tham gia vào Quỹ ngay từ những ngày đầu, vốn vay của Quỹ đều đựoc chị đầu tư vào mua các mặt hàng. Từ việc kinh doanh hàng tạp hóa này thu nhập bình quân gia đình chị 100.000đ/ ngày. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 7.000.000 để mua thêm hàng hóa.

loans.use: Buy more stock for general store

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for TYM Fund - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Toshbolta

texts.ru:
Toshbolta H. lives in Abdurahmon Jomi. He is married and has 6 children. He is 45 years old and has been working in animal husbandry for 10 years. He has a small farm. Now it has become necessary to build a shed, but he does not have any money for building materials. Therefore, he has decided to take out a loan to make the renovations. It will help to improve conditions and to increase space. Toshbolta will be able to pay off the loan in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa, Kiva volunteer.

Хасанов Тошболта проживает в районе Абдурахмони Джоми. Женат и имеет 6 детей. Ему 45 лет и 10 лет он занимается животноводством. Имеет небольшое хозяйство , но теперь необходимо пристроить сарай, но на стройматериалы денег нет. Поэтому он решил получить кредит и сделать ремонт. Это поможет улучшить условия ухода и увеличить пространство. Погасить кредит Тошболта сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Building a shed

loans.name: Luu Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Luu Thi G., 26 years old, has been with TYM since joining the group in 2006. After marriage, she work with her husband parent in their home mechanical services. In her first loan cycle, the money she borrowed was solely used to upgrade the store. Their daily routine is creating the products in the morning and selling it to customers during the rest of the day. Aside from the main job, her husband also earns money by carrying things for people. To be able to increase production and profit, she would like to borrow 9 more million VND in this loan cycle from TYM. Currently, her family monthly income is about 3 million vnd.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh H. Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Lưu Thị Gái năm nay 26 tuổi. Sau khi kết hôn chị sống cùng bố mẹ chồng, hai vợ chồng chị đều tham gia sản xuất tại cơ sở sản xuất cơ khí riêng của gia đình nhà chồng. Chị Gái tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2006.Vòng vốn đầu chị vay để đầu tư vào xưởng cơ khí của gia đình. Hàng ngày chồng chị cùng gia đình sản xuất hàng hóa sau đó chị đem bán tại các chợ cho người tiêu dùng vì thế thu nhập của gia đình chị rất ổn định. Ngoài thời gian sản xuất hàng cơ khí cho vợ bán, chồng chị còn đi chở hàng thuê cho người dân địa phương khi họ có nhu cầu vì thế kinh tế gia đình chị ngày càng phát triển. . Để có vốn mở rộng sản xuất kinh doanh và đầu tư máy móc, vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay thêm 9.000.000đ từ nguồn vốn của Quỹ. Hiện nay thu nhập của gia đình chị đạt 3.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Services

loans.name: Doan Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Doan Thi T. first joined TYM in 2001 in order to have more capital to raise cattle. In the first loan, she borrow 1 million VND to buy breeding pigs and by the third loan cycle, her family has been able to buy a cow and start raising them as well. Hard work and careful preparation paid off as her family standard of living has dramatically changed. All her children now are grown up and have their own families. In this cyclem, she would like to borrow 15 million VND to invest in raising cattle. Her family monthly income is 3 million VND.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh H. Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Đoàn Thị Tuyên 56 Tuổi, năm 2001 chị tham gia vào Quỹ vay vốn để chăn nuôi, thấy rằng nếu chỉ làm ruộng thì kinh tế gia đình khó phát triển, nên anh chị đã cố gắng chăn nuôi để tăng thu nhập cho gia đình, vòng vốn đầu tiên gia đình chị xin vay 1.000.000đ đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn, sau 2 vòng vay vốn gia đình chị đã mua thêm được 1 con bò vừa phục vụ nhà nông và lại sinh sản, các vòng vốn tiếp theo gia đình chị vẫn đầu tư vào chăn nuôi bò và lợn thịt, chăn nuôi hiệu quả gia đình chị đã mua sắm được nhiều tiện nghi cần thiết cho gia đình, 3 con chị đã lớn đều xây dựng gia đình. Vòng vốn này chị xịn vay 15.000.000đ đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Thu nhập bình quân 3.000.000đ/ tháng .

loans.use: Raise cattle

loans.name: Luu Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Luu Thi L., 47 years old, has joined TYM since 2006. Before joining TYM, she was working in small services. She bought agricultural products daily and resell them to agency in her area. In order to achieve higher success, she need to have more resource to invest in her services so she came to TYM to borrow 3 million VND. Her first experience has been great which has boost her confident. Apart from her services, her husband work as a motorbike taxi driver which really help her in with the repayments of the loans. Due to recent success, her family has been able to live better. In this next loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9 million VND to buy more agricultural products and also get better transportation to get to her seller. Her monthly income is 4 million VND.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh H. Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Lưu Thị Lộc tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2006. Chị năm nay 47 tuổi, gia đình chị có hai con đang trong độ tuổi đi học. Trước khi tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương chị làm nghề buôn bán nhỏ. Hàng ngày chị đi mua nông sản từ các bãi về bán lại cho các đại lý. Công việc ngày càng phát triển và đòi hỏi nhu cầu về vốn ngày càng cao vì thế chị đã xin vay vốn của Quỹ Tình Thương để đầu tư cho công việc buôn bán của mình. Để làm quen với cách hoàn trả dần của Quỹ vòng vốn đầu chị vay 3.000.000đ và sử dụng vào thu mua nông sản cho thu nhập rất ổn định. Ngoài thu nhập từ công việc buôn bán của chị, chồng chị cũng đi làm thêm nghề lái xe vì thế kinh tế gia đình chị ngày càng phát triển, các con của chị nhờ đó cũng được chăm sóc tốt hơn. Vòng vốn tiếp theo chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư vốn cho việc thu mua nông sản, đầu tư phương tiện vận chuyển để có thể đi thu mua và bán ở các vùng lân cận. Thu nhập bình quân 4.000.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: Services

loans.name: Jalal

texts.en: Jalal K. is 27 years old. He owns a small dairy farm and sells milk to the local milk factory in the Internally Displaced People's Settlement of the Bilasuvar region. He started this business in 1999. Jalal lives with his parents, and his revenue from the milk sales and the US$70-large support from the government  are the family's only sources of income. To expand his business, Jalal has applied for a loan of US$1,200 which he will use to purchase two milk cows.

loans.use: Purchase of two cows

loans.name: Safiatou

texts.fr:
Mrs. Safiatou D. is a 48 year old married woman with 6 children and lives with her husband and their children in a monogamous family in the Sanoubougou I district of the city of Sikasso.

Not having had the chance to proceed with her education due to social reasons, this good woman decided to produce and sell attiéké (a food made from fermented cassava) to the people of Sikasso. With 15 years of experience, she enjoys much fame in this business. She learned the craft with a neighbour. To meet the increasingly significant demand, she decided to take part in the loan program of the Siri Yiriwaso micro-finance institution (with whom she has been working for 2 years) in order to have more financial resources at her disposal. She is on her first individual loan, after having taken advantage of one group loan.

She supplies herself at the market in Sikasso and in Bouaké (a city in the Republic of the Ivory Coast in West Africa) by order 4 times each month. Then she sends the merchandise to her home in Sanoubougou, where she makes her attiéké, using the standard means of transportation. She needs this loan to buy more cassava from which to make lots of attiéké in order to satisfy her clientele, which continues to grow.

She runs this business throughout the year without major difficulties. The turnover of her business is very high, and she realizes a monthly profit of 100,000 FCFA. Thanks to this profit, Mrs. Safiatou D. helps her husband especially by paying for certain family expenses.

She finds that the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso helps the poor in getting out of their desperate situation.

The sum being requested is reasonable given the need. Given the profitability of the business, the meeting of previous obligations in her association, and the good standing of the client, the repayment of this loan should not a priori pose any problems.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Madame Safiatou D. est une femme mariée de 48 ans et mère de 6 enfants et vit avec son époux et leurs enfants dans une famille monogame au quartier Sanoubougou I de la ville de Sikasso.

N’ayant pas eu la chance de progresser dans les études pour des raisons sociales, cette brave femme décida de produire et de vendre de l’Attiéké à la population de Sikasso. Avec une expérience de 15 ans, elle jouit d’une grande notoriété danns cette activité. Elle a appris ce métier avec une voisine . Pour faire face à la demande de plus en plus importante, elle décida d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso( avec elle travaille depuis 2 ans ) afin de disposer de plus de ressources financières. Elle est à son premier pret individuel après avoir passé par le crédit solidaire

Elle s’approvisionne sur le marché de Sikasso et à Bouaké (une ville de la République de Côte d’Ivoire en Afrique de l’Ouest), par commande et cela 4 fois par mois. Ensuite elle achemine les marchandises à son domicile à Sanoubougou I où elle fabrique son Attièguè avec les moyens de transport classiques. Elle a besoin de ce prêt pour acheter plus de manioc et en faire beaucoup d’Attièguè afin de satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter.

Elle mène cette activité durant toute l’année sans difficultés majeures. La rotation de son activité est très élévée et elle réalise un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA. Grâce à ce bénéfice Madame Safiatou D. assure certaines dépenses de la famille en aidant surtout son mari.

Elle trouve que l’intitution de microfinanace Soro Yiriwaso aide beaucoup les pauvres à sortir de leur situation de précarité.

Le montant demandé est raisonnable par rapport au besoin. Compte de la rentabilité de l’activité, du respect des engagements précédents au sein de son Association et de la moralité de la cliente, le remboursement ne doit pas à priori poser de problème.

loans.use: To buy cassava

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Tran Thi L., 37 years old, currently live with her husband, Mr Nguyen Anh Tuan and her two small children. Her family main source of income is retailing mobile phone. As the standard of living increase and the demand for technology rise, she realize that mobile phone is becoming a norm in the society. In 2005, her family decided to open up a small mobile phone retail store at home. As mobile phone is currently in high demand, they were achieving many success. With these confident, and the appearance of TYM in the later year, they took out many loans and were able to diversify their products and achieving even more success. During this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 7 million VND to invest more in her store. Her family income is 5 million VND per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh H. Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Trần Thị L. 37 tuổi cùng chồng là anh Nguyễn Tuấn Anh, Nghề nghiệp chính của gia đình anh chị là buôn bán điện thoại di động. Nhận thấy xã hội phát triển, nhu cầu thông tin liên lạc đang là một trong những mặt hàng không thể thiếu của mỗi gia đình. Năm 2005 gia đình anh chị đã bàn bạc và mở 1 của hàng buôn bán điện thoại di động ngay tại nhà, đúng như nhận định ban đầu việc làm ăn của gia đinh chị không gặp khó khăn. Khách hàng có nhu cầu sử dụng điện thoại di động ngày càng đông ở mọi tầng lớp, khi Quỹ về hoạt động tại địa bàn anh đã động viên chị tham gia vào quỹ để vay vốn, với việc vay vốn của Quỹ các mặt hàng của gia đình anh chị nhiều và phong phú hơn từ đó cửa hàng của anh chị đã đáp ứng được nhu cầu của khách hàng, 2 con anh chị đang còn trong độ tuổi ăn học. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 7.000.000đ đầu tư vào cửa hàng điện thoại. Thu nhập bình quân 5.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Hold Tight Group

texts.en: Marie B. produces tye-dye materials and sells them in Makeni town of Sierra Leone.  She learned the skill soon after the war and has been in business for more than 5 years.  With her previous loans, she developed her business from retailing to wholesaling and has customers from Freetown.  She can produce 8 rolls of material a month and earns $50 in profit weekly.  Her business is the main source of family income. Marie is 32 years old and a group leader.  She is married with 2 children and her husband does help her in managing the business.  Other group members run various business activities for family income. Mohamed buys and sells goats and sheep, and Memuna and Isatu sell palm oil in the market. The group is requesting a loan of Le.2400,000 to expand the businesses.

loans.use: Purchase dyes, caustic soda, starch and cotton materials, palm oil, sheep and goats

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua D. sells smoked fish in Kumasi. She is single, and her income must fully support her and her 2 children. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits. She is asking for $400 of additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Christian Rural Aid Network (CRAN) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Toshbolta.

texts.ru: Хасанов  Тошболта проживает в районе Абдурахмони Джоми. Женат и имеет 6 детей. Ему 45 лет и 10 лет он занимается животноводством. Имеет небольшое хозяйство , но теперь необходимо пристроить сарай, но на стройматериалы денег нет. Поэтому он решил получить кредит и сделать  ремонт.  Это поможет улучшить условия ухода  и увеличить пространство. Погасить кредит Тошболта сможет в течении 12 месяцев

loans.use: Пристройка сарая..

loans.name: Oumou

texts.fr:
Mrs. Oumou K. is a 49 year old married woman with 8 children, currently living in a monogamous family with her children in Odjoumabougou in the district of Ouelessebougou, Kati area, in the Koulikoro region.

She has been involved with the micro-finance institution SORO YIRIWASO for 4 years, and is on her fourth individual loan after 3 group loans (solidarity loans). All of her previous loans have been repaid properly.

With this loan, she intends to buy 25 containers of Aloevera products from the ALOE VERA sales representation in Bamako and sell them in Ouelessebougou. She has been running this business for 4 years and sells her merchandise generally to men. With 300,000 CFA, she intends to realize a profit of 65,000, and will be able to contribute to the family expenses and invest the rest in her business.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Madame Oumou K. est une femme mariée de 49 ans,mère de 8 enfants et vivant dans une famille monogame avec ses enfants à Odjoumabougou dans la commune de Ouelessebougou cercle de Kati région de Koulikoro.

Elle est en relation avec l’institution de micro finance SORO YIRIWASO dépuis 4 ans et est à son quatrième prêt individuel après 3 prêts de groupe (pret solidaire).Tous ces prets précèdents ont été bien remboursés correctement

Avec ce pret, elle compte acheter 25 bidons de produits Aloevera auprès de la répresentation ALOE VERA à Bamako et les vendre à Ouelessebougou. Elle mène cette activité dépuis 4 ans et vend généralement sa marchandise aux hommes. Avec 300.000CFA, elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 65.000 CFA et pourra contribuer aux dépenses familiales et investir le reste dans ses activités.

loans.use: To buy ALOE VERA products

loans.name: Asia's Group

texts.en:
Asia baji is the wife of F. M.. (Baji is an Urdu term meaning "eldest sister".) The couple lives in a two-room brick house with their two children in Burewala, Pakistan. Their son, Rehan, is five-years-old and daughter. Sahrish, is three-years-old. Asia baji is a beautician by profession. She is requesting a loan to start her own beauty salon business.

She has four other women in her loan group. Manzooran baji wants a loan for her welding business; Jamila baji wants a loan for her furniture shop; Sughran baji wants to buy a rickshaw and Nasreen baji wants to expand the products in her grocery store.

The loan will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To open a beauty salon business

loans.name: Jamila's Group

texts.en:
Jamila is the wife of I. M.. They live in a two-room brick house in the small city of Burewala, Pakistan. The couple has five children; three daughters and two sons. Her oldest son, Zafar I., is in the 3rd level at school. The next child, Qamar I., is in the 1st level. Her husband is a mason and has been in this profession for the last 20 years. Jamila is requesting a loan for her daughter who wants to learn parlor work.

She has four other women in her loan group. Jamila baji and Kubran baji want a loan to buy fruit. (Baji is an Urdu term meaning "eldest sister".) Salamat baji wants a loan to buy an ice-cream maker and Bushra baji wants to buy a rickshaw.

The loan will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To start a parlor business

loans.name: Ritha

texts.en: Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 36-year-old Ritha Mwema.  She is married, and has four children aged between 2 and 11. In 2007, Ritha  established her cosmetics business. Working 6 days a week, and 12 hours a day, she earns about US $170 every month from this business. Ritha requests a loan to purchase additional stock of  cosmetics so she can improve her sales. In the future, Ritha  plans to open another business to increase her income even more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of cosmetics.

loans.name: Martha's Group

texts.en:
Martha baji is the wife of Y. M. and lives in a small city named Burewala in Pakistan. (Baji is an Urdu term meaning "eldest sister".) The couple lives in a two-room brick house with their two daughters and two sons. Her oldest daughter, Arifa, is ten-years-old and in the 2nd level at school. Martha is a housewife and also does embroidery. She is lacking stock to fulfill the orders of her customers. Therefore she is requesting a loan to purchase threads and cloth for her embroidery work.

Martha has five other women in her loan group. Parveen baji wants loan for her barber saloon; Khursheed baji wants to use the finds for her cycle business; Musarat baji wants to buy electric items for her shop; Parveen baji wantsa loan for her embroidery business and Shama baji wants a loan for her shutter business.

The loan will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase additional embroidery threads and cloth to fill order requests

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Asasah, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Oymoma

texts.ru:
Oymoma A. lives in Khuroson. She is married and has five children. She has a vocational education. She is a pharmacist. Oymoma has opened a drugstore for the residents of her village. She now wants to increase the variety of medicines she offers. To do this, she must take out a loan. She will be able to pay it off in 10 months. She brings medicines in from the city of Dushanbe and sells them at a small clinic. This helps the population and brings in an income which helps to provide for her family.

Translated from Russian by Melissa, Kiva volunteer.

Абиерова Оймома проживает в районе Хуросон . Замужем и имеет пятерых детей. Имеет средне-специальное образование. По специальности фармацефт. Для населения своего кишлака Оймома открыла аптеку. Сейчас хочет увеличить ассортимент лекарств. Но для этого ей необходимо получить кредит. Погасить его она сможет в течении 10 месяцев. Привозит лекарства из города Душанбе и продает у себя в медпункте. Это помогает населению . а так же ей самой приносит доход , который помогает обеспечивать семью

loans.use: Increase product variety

loans.name: Azra's Group

texts.en:
Azra baji is the wife of M. Y. and lives in a small city named Burewala in Pakistan. ( Baji is an Urdu term meaning 'elder sister'.) They have a two-room brick house. Her husband is a driver and drives a three wheel vehicle called auto-rickshaw. She is requesting a loan for her husband so that he can purchase another rickshaw and expand his business.

She has four other women in her loan group. Naeem baji wants loan for her Pan shop; Shahnaz baji has a need to funds for her video center; Seema baji wants a loan for her embroidery business and Saima baji wants funding to expand her furniture business.

The loan will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase an additional auto-rickshaw for business expansion

loans.name: Maxa's Group

texts.en:
Maxa baji is the wife of H. M.. (Baji is an Urdu term meaning "eldest sister".) They have lived in the small city of Burewala in Pakistan for the last seven years. The family lives in a two-room brick house. There are four children; one daughter and three sons.

Her husband runs a grocery store. Maxa is requesting a loan for her husband so that he is able to diversify the products he offers in his store and increase the profits.

She has four other women in her loan group.Fozia baji wants a loan for embroidery business; Rubina baji would like a loan for her crockery store; Nasreen baji wants to buy an auto-rickshaw and Sughran baji is requesting a loan for her vegetable business.

The loan will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To diversify the products offered in a grocery store and increase profits

loans.name: Hakimali

texts.ru:
Hakimali Y. lives in Shahrinav. He works as a private taxi driver. He has his own car. He lives with his family. He is married and has 5 children. He is 28 years old, and it is not easy to support such a big family. Therefore, he must work very much so that his family does not want for anything. Recently, his car had a serious breakdown, and now major repairs are necessary. Therefore, he has decided to take out a loan to be paid off in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa, Kiva volunteer.

Якубов Хакимали проживает в районе Шахринау. Работает частным таксистом. Имеет свой автомобиль. Живет вместе со своей семьей. Женат и имеет 5 детей. Ему 28 лет и прокормить большую семью не так уж просто. Поэтому ему приходится много работать , чтобы семья ни в чем не нуждалась. Недавно произошла серьезная поломка автомобиля и теперь необходим капитальный ремонт. Поэтому он запланировал получить кредит , со сроком на 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Automobile repair

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 26-year-old Mariam M..  She is married, and has two children aged 1 and 12. She has two dependents, who live with her because they are orphans. In 2007, Mariam established her phone accessories business. She opens her business 6 days a week, and 8 hours a day. Despite being a ‘developing’ country (forgive the label, there remains no consensus on an acceptable definition), it is amazing how many people have mobile phones in Tanzania and in Africa in general. Not just professionals, but grandmas in villages, school kids, street sellers. It can probably be attributed to a number of factors, led by the fact that it is the only form of phone communication available to most people, because there are few landlines, and mobile phones are relatively cheap  here.  The mobile phone business is a very good business. Mariam requests a loan to purchase additional stock, such as batteries, cases, and chargers. In the future, Mariam plans to increase the quantity and range of her stock. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of phone accessories ( batteries, cases and chargers)

loans.name: Djèdouman (Entente). Group

texts.fr:
The women of the group Djèdouman live in the Koulou district of Ouelessebougou, Kati Prefecture, in the region of Koulikoro. They are all married and live in polygamous households with at least 4 children.

The group Djèdouman is on its first loan with Soro Yiriwaso. With this loan, they intend to increase the scope of their business to better respond to the local demand. They supply themselves in general in Bamako, where there buy various items (secondhand clothing, condiments, beauty products, etc). In addition, they transform local products according to the season. They sell their goods at the market in Ouelessebougou either at home or in mobile fashion. Their clientele is composed mainly of women who frequent the market in Ouelessebougou. With this loan of 50,000 FCFA, each member of the group hopes to realize a profit of at least 24,000 FCFA per month.

The women of the group Djèdouman want to make their business prosper, thanks to this loan.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Les femmes du groupe Djèdouman résident dans le quartier koulou de Ouelessebougou préfecture de Kati région de Koulikoro. Elles sont toutes mariées et vivent dans des foyers polygames avec en moyenne 4 enfants.

Le groupe Djèdouman est à son premier prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso. Avec ce prêt elles comptent augmenter la taille de leurs activités pour mieux répondre à la demande locale. Elles s’approvisionnent en général à Bamako ou elles achètent divers articles (friperie, condiments, produits de beauté, etc. …). En plus elles font de transformation de produits locaux selon la saison. Elles vendent au marché de Ouelessebougou à la maison ou de façon ambulante. La clientèle est composée essentiellement de femmes fréquentant le marché de Ouelessebougou. Avec ce prêt de 50.000 FCFA chaque membre du groupe compte réaliser en moyenne un bénéfice de 24 000 F CFA. par mois.

Les femmes du groupe Djèdouman désirent faire prospérer leurs activités grâce à ce prêt.

loans.use: To buy various items for a small business

loans.name: Ajik

texts.ru:
Ajik K. lives in the Vahsh region. He is 47 years old, married, and has 4 children. He has secondary education. Ajik has been in the business of growing watermelons for the past 10 years. This year, he collected good amount of crops, but he is having a hard time selling it because of heavy competition. For this reason, he would like to obtain a loan so he could purchase GSM and rent a truck. This will enable him to distribute the watermelons in other regions.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Каюмов Ажик Нурович житель района Вахш . Возраст 47 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Образование среднее.Ажик вот уже более 10 лет занимается выращиванием арбузов. Ажик в этом году собрал хороший урожай,но не может его реализовать.Так как очень большая конкуренция.Поэтому клиент хочет получить кредит для покупки ГСМ и взять в аренду грузовую машину.После этого Ажик свой товар развезет по другим районам для реализации.

loans.use: Purchase of GSM and rent of truck

loans.name: Ghulam Batool's Group

texts.en:
Ghulam Batool is the wife of M. Zulfiqar and has lived in a city named Arifwala in Pakistan for the last 50 years. They have a two-room brick house and are the parents of ten children; eight sons and two daughters. The two eldest sons have a vegetable business. The younger three have a paint shop. Another son is a tailor and has been in this profession for the last eight years. Their oldest daughter is in the 10th level of school and the next oldest daughter is in 8th level.

The daily income is $10 to $13. Ghulam Batool successfully repaid her loan from a microfinance institute of Pakistan. She is requesting a second loan for the son who is tailor and wants to start a garment business.

She has four other women in her loan group. Naseem baji (Baji is an Urdu term meaning "eldest sister".) wants a loan to expand her cement business; Latifan baji wants to expand her grocery shop; Najma baji wants to buy a sewing machine and Razia baji needs funding for her paint shop.

The loan will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To start a garment business

loans.name: Kurbongul

texts.ru:
Kurbongul A. lives in the Vahsh region. She is 29 years old and has a bachelor's degree in accounting. Since her salary is very small, Kurbongul buys and sells dining sets and dishes. She has been in this business for the past 6 years. At this moment, she would like to purchase additional inventory from wholesellers. The more inventory she has, the better are her sales. Since she doesn't have enough funds to realize her plan, Kurbongul decided to take out a loan for 3 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Абдуллоева Курбонгул жительница района Вахш. Возраст 29 лет, образование высшее. По специальности бухгалтер. Так как заработная плата очень маленькая Курбонгул занимается куплей продажей посуды.Имеет опыт в бизнесе более 6 лет. В данный момент клиентка хочет закупить посуду у оптовых поставщиков.Если у нее будет большой выбор товара ,торговля будет лучше .Так как своих денежных средств у нее нет ,Курбонул решила взять кредит сроком на 3 месяца.

loans.use: To increase inventory assortment

loans.name: Kadidia

texts.fr:
Mrs. Kadidia T. is a 64 year old widow with 9 children living with her in the home of her late husband in the Pelengana Nord district of the city of Ségou.

She began working in income-generating activities in her youth with her mother. After a long period of inactivity due to the refusal of her husband, she started producing and selling peanut paste after her husband's death a year ago.

To obtain financial rersources, she decided to turn to the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with whom she is on her first individual loan.

She supplies herself in the villages surrounding Ségou during village fair days. She intends to buy 8 sacks of peanuts of different qualities and transportation costs for 12 trips by truck of firewood, which she will dispatch to Ségou. She roasts these nuts herself and converts them into peanut paste using specailized presses. Afterwards, the paste is put into jars for sale at the commercial level or in bulk at the market or at home.

With this new loan, she hopes to realize a monthly profit of 48,000 CFA, which she intends to use to feed her fatherless children.

In the future, she hopes to raise cattle, sheep, and goats, as well as poultry, with the profits she obtains.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Madame Kadidia T. est une veuve, âgée de 64 ans, mère de 9 enfants vivant avec ses enfants dans le domicile de son feu mari à Pelengana Nord quartier de la ville de Ségou.

Elle a commencé a faire des activités génératrices de revenus dés son jeune âge à côté de sa mère. Après une longue période d’inactivité pour refus de son mari, elle entama la fabrication et la vente de patte d’arachide après le décès de ce dernier il y a une année.

Pour obtenir des ressources financières elle décida de faire recourt à l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est à son premier prêt individuel.

Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants de Ségou pendant les jours de foire. Elle compte acheter 8 sacs d’arachide graine de différentes qualités et 12 voyages de camion en bois chauffe qu’elle fera acheminer à Ségou. Ces graines sont grillées par elle même et transformées en patte d’arachide par des mouliniers spécialisés. Ensuite les pattes sont mises dans des pots pour la vente au niveau des entreprises ou en vrac au marché ou à la maison.

Avec ce nouveau prêt elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel 48 000 CFA qu’elle compte utiliser pour nourrir ses enfants orphelins.

Dans l’avenir elle espère faire de l’élevage des bovins, ovins et caprins ainsi que de l’aviculture avec les bénéfices réalisés.

loans.use: To buy sacks of peanuts

loans.name: Rubina's Group

texts.en:
Rubina baji is the wife of M. R.. (Baji is an Urdu term meaning 'eldest sister'.) She is a mother of two sons, ages four and seven. Rubina baji is a housewife and her husband is a salesman who sells ready-made T-shirts. She is applying for a loan a loan for her husband who would like to sew children's garments. He needs cloth and a sewing machine to expand into this business venture.

Rubina has two other women in her group. Anwar baji wants a loan to buy animal food and Mumtaz baji would like to use the money to buy school furniture.

The loan will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase cloth and a sewing machine to make children's clothes

loans.name: Meena's Group

texts.en:
Meena baji is the wife of A. S.. ( Baji is an Urdu term meaning "eldest sister".) The couple has nine children; five daughters and four sons. Her oldest two sons have a paint and sewing machine shop. The third eldest son is in the 8th level of school. The two eldest daughters are in the 9th level at school. The next child is in the 6th level and the younger is in the 3rd level in school.

Meena baji successfully completed her first loan from a microfinance institute of Pakistan and is now requesting a second loan for her son so he may expand his paint shop.

She has four other women in her loan group. Kaneezan baji wants loan for her sweatmeat business; Mumtaz baji is requesting a loan to expand her vegetable business; Akbaran baji wants to purchase a sewing machine and Manzooran baji wants to buy an auto-rickshaw.

The loan will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand the inventory of a paint shop

loans.name: Alimata

texts.fr:
Mrs. Keïta Alimata B. is a married woman with 7 children who lives with her husband (who is retired) and some of her children in the Bougoufié district in Ségou. Coming from an ethnically Sarakolé family known for its big entrepreneurs, she decided to manage some income-generating businesses, specifically the sale of local drinks and clothing.

After 4 group loans (solidarity loans) and 1 individual loan all repaid properly, she would like to obtain her second individual loan. She intends to use this future loan to buy raw materials (used in the production of local drinks) comprising 5 bags of sugar, 10 boxes of powdered juice, and 10 packs of bags, and to buy wax-printed pagnes (a type of clothing highly prized in Mali). She supplies herself on the spot at the grand market in Ségou.

She sells local drinks and wax-printed pagnes daily at her house to a clientele composed of men and women from her district. She intends to realize a monthly profit of 75,000 CFA.

Her biggest desire is to repay her loan properly and to educate at least one of her children.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer


Madame Keïta Alimata B. est une femme mariée, mère de 7 enfants et vivant avec son mari (à la retraite) et certains de leurs enfants au quartier Bougoufié de ségou. Issue d’une famille Sarakolé  ethnie réputée pour être  des grands entrepreneurs, elle décida de mener des activités génératrices de revenus notamment la vente de boissons locales et d’habits. 

Apres 4 prêts de groupe (Prêts solidaires) et 1 prêt individuel correctement remboursés, elle veut obtenir son second prêt individuel. Elle compte utiliser  ce futur  prêt pour l’achat des matières premières (entrant dans la fabrication des boissons locales) à savoir : 5 sacs de sucre, 10 cartons de jus en poudre ,10 paquets de sachets et pour l’achat de pagnes wax (habits très prisés au Mali) Elle s’approvisionne sur place  au grand marché de  Ségou .

Elle vend les boissons locales et les pagnes Wax quotidiennement chez elle à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes de son quartier. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de75 000 CFA.

Son souhait le plus ardent est de rembourser correctement son prêt et d’initier au moins un de ses enfant.

loans.use: To buy raw materials to make juice and to buy clothing for resale

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Parveen baji is the wife of M. A.. ( Baji is an Urdu term meaning 'elder sister'.) They have been married for the last 30 years. The couple has five children; two sons and three daughters. She is a housewife and prefers to stay at home. Her husband is a salesman and sells sewing machines in various locations. Parveen is applying for a loan so her husband can expand his business.

She has three women in her loan group. Ramazan baji wants a loan to buy vehicle tires; Razia baji would like money to expand her paint shop and Asia baji wants a loan to increase the amount of clothes she can sell.

The loan will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand a sewing machine sales business

loans.name: Kosar's Group

texts.en:
Kosar baji is the wife of M. Iqbal and lives in a city named Arifwala in Pakistan. (Baji is an Urdu term meaning "elder sister".) They have eight children; six daughters and two sons. Her husband owns a sweatmeat business and their eldest son works with her husband. Kosar baji is requesting a loan so her husband can expand his business.

She has four other women in her loan group. Naseem baji wants a loan for her cosmetic business; Amina baji would like a loan for her wood business; Shahnaz baji wants a loan to buy masonry tools and Shamim baji wants to expand her food business.

The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand a sweatmeat business

loans.name: Ayeshetu

texts.en:
Ayeshetu I. is a thirty-five-year old widow with four children, all of whom are currently in school. She lost her husband to an illness six years ago.

She is a local manufacturer of palm kernel oil, which is produced from palm kernel and is used to prepare many local dishes like “banku” and “waakye.” So, she produces and supplies her oils to food vendors so that they can prepare their meals. Indeed, producing palm kernel oil is one of the most common occupations among local women in the town of Obuasi. Even so, she has experienced a decline in her production of palm kernel oil as of late because she has little in the way of working capital to afford a machine to process her oils. Therefore, she is seeking a loan to buy seventy bags of palm kernel and an electric milling machine, which ought to both reduce the need for manual effort in the production process and produce oil in larger quantities. In turn, she feels that this loan will enable her to generate greater income in order to provide food her family and to finance her children’s education.

She belongs to the community group called “Megyefo Tease” (My Redeemer Lives) Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee one another as social collateral in order to access loans and apply peer pressure to ensure that the group members' loans are promptly repaid.

loans.use: To increase her business' production and efficiency by purchasing additional raw materials (i.e., bags of palm kernel) and an electric milling machine.

loans.name: Shahida's Group

texts.en:
Shahida baji is the wife of M. S. and lives in a city named Arifwala in Pakistan. ( Baji is an Urdu term meaning 'elder sister'.) She is the mother of seven children; five sons and two daughters. Her eldest son completed education through what would equate to the tenth grade. The next oldest son left school earlier and drives a donkey cart. Her youngest son and daughter are in kindergarten.

Her husband runs an electric shop. Shahida baji successfully repaid her first loan from a microfinance institute of Pakistan and is applying for another loan for her husband’s electric shop.

She has four other members of her loan group. Kalsoom baji wants a loan for her tea shop; Kosar baji would like a loan for her beauty parlor; Mumtaz baji wants a loan for her decorative embroidery business and Hajra baji wants loan to buy a donkey cart.

The funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To upgrade an electric shop

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Salamatu A. is forty years old. She is married and is the mother of six children. Two of her children have completed senior high school, while the rest are currently in junior and primary schools.

She is a local manufacturer of palm kernel oil, which is produced from palm kernel and is used to prepare many local dishes like fried fish and pastries. Indeed, she produces and supplies her oil to food vendors so that they can prepare their meals. Although palm kernel oil production is one of the most common occupations among local women in the town of Obuasi, it is nonetheless a lucrative business to be in. However, her oil production has been on the decline in recent months by virtue of the fact that she has very little working capital in order to afford a machine to process the oil. Therefore, she is seeking a loan to buy seventy bags of palm kernel and an electric milling machine to both reduce the need for manual labor in the production process and to produce oil in larger quantities. Ultimately, she feels that this loan will enable her to generate more income to thereby provide food her family and finance her children’s education.

Salamatu belongs to the community group called “Megyefo Tease” (My Redeemer Lives) Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee one another as social collateral in order to access loans and apply peer pressure to ensure that the group members' loans are promptly repaid.

loans.use: To increase production and to make the business more efficient by purchasing additional raw materials (i.e., bags of palm kernel) and an electric milling machine.

loans.name: Maryam's Group

texts.en:
Maryam baji is a wife of M. T. and lives in a city named Arifwala located in Pakistan. (Baji is an Urdu term meaning 'elder sister'.) She is a mother of six children; five sons and one daughter. The family lives in a two-room brick house.

Her husband is a tailor and has been in this profession for the last five years. The eldest son has a shop where he presses clothes and the daughter makes clothes to order. Maryam baji has a wish to give her remaining children a good education. She is applying for this loan to help expand her husband and her son’s businesses.

There are three other members in her loan group. Both members named Sakina baji want a loan to buy a donkey cart. Azizan baji wants a loan to start a Pan Shop (drink corner).

The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her particular business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To facilitate the people through their skills

loans.name: Alima

texts.en:
Alima A. is fifty years old. She is married and has three children, all of whom are currently in school. For twenty years now (and counting), she has been a local manufacturer of palm oil and palm kernel oil, which are used to prepare many local dishes. For clarity, she notes that palm oil is produced from palm nuts whereas palm kernel oil is produced from palm kernel and that palm kernel oil is a by-product of palm oil. Normally, she alternates production between the two products: that is, after producing palm oil, she automatically obtains the raw materials to produce palm kernel oil, and so on. In this way, she produces and supplies her oils to food vendors so that they can prepare their meals.

She is now seeking a loan to buy more bags of palm nuts and an electric milling machine in order to increase her efficiency and to thereby produce her oils in larger quantities. In turn, she is confident that this loan will help her to expand the business so that she can generate more income to support her husband, to provide food her family, and to finance her children’s education.

Alima belongs to the community group called “Megyefo Tease” (My Redeemer lives) Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee one another as social collateral in order to access loans and apply peer pressure to ensure that the group members promptly repay their loans.

loans.use: To expand her business and increase her business' efficiency by purchasing additional raw materials (e.g., bags of palm nuts) as well as an electric milling machine.

loans.name: Rani's Group

texts.en:
Rani baji is the wife of A. S. and lives in a city named Arifwala in Pakistan. ( Baji is an Urdu term meaning "elder sister.) They have a two-room brick house. She is a housewife while her husband runs a grocery store. Rani baji is applying for a loan so her husband can diversify his grocery line of products.

She has three other members in her loan group. Mumtaz baji and Sugran baji want to use the loan to buy donkey carts. Sakina baji wants a loan for her grocery store.

The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase additional products for a grocery store and purchase donkey carts

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret A. is fifty years old. She is married and has five children, all of whom are currently in school. She is a petty trader who trades in rice, vegetable oil, canned tomatoes, yams, onions, beans, maize, dried fish, and other such foods on top of a table in the local market.

Through hard work, she has managed to support two of her children as they finished senior high school (and who are now preparing to enter university this year), yet her other children are still in junior high school. Despite the relative success of her business, she is convinced that her business can thrive even more with an increase in capital. As such, she is requesting a loan to buy more tubers of yams, baskets of tomatoes, onions, bags of maize, and beans to increase her stock and to generate greater income. Eventually, she hopes that the expected increase in income from this particular loan will allow her to put up a decent shelter for her and her family.

Margaret belongs to the community group called God is Able Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee one another as social collateral in order to access loans and apply peer pressure to ensure that the group members' loans are promptly repaid.

loans.use: To expand her business by increasing the stock of goods (i.e., more tubers of yams, baskets of tomatoes, onions, bags of maize, and beans).

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose M. is forty seven years old. She is married and is the mother of three children. At the moment, one of her children has completed junior high school and is ready to enter senior high school, while the other two children are in primary school. She is a petty trader who trades in rice, vegetable oil, canned tomatoes, yams, onions, beans, maize, dried fish, and other such foods at a table in the local market.

Despite her business' relative success, she is convinced that the business can thrive even more with an increase in capital. Therefore, she is seeking a loan to buy more tubers of yams, baskets of tomatoes, onions, bags of maize, and beans in order to increase her stock and to generate greater income. Ultimately, she hopes that the expected increase in income from this particular loan will allow her to construct a decent shelter for her and her family.

Rose belongs to the community group called The Lord Is My Shepherd Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee one another as social collateral in order to access loans and apply peer pressure on one another to ensure that the group members' loans are promptly repaid.

loans.use: To expand her business by increasing the stock of food (e.g., more tubers of yams, baskets of tomatoes, onions, bags of maize, and beans).

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria H. is a fifty-year-old widow with three children, all of whom are still in school. She is a food vendor and, more specifically, she sells fufu. Fufu is prepared from cassava and plantain, which are cooked and pounded together, and is eaten with different kinds of soup. In fact, fufu is a very popular, traditional food among the Ashanti tribe of the Ghanaian society, and it is enjoyed either as breakfast, lunch, or supper.

She is seeking a loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood. By applying the loan proceeds to her business operation, she hopes to generate increased income in order to support her children’s education.

She belongs to the community group called Good Shepherd Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee one another as social collateral in order to access loans and apply peer pressure so that the group members properly repay their respective loans.

loans.use: To purchase additional raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood in order to generate greater income.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice A. is fifty six years old. She is married and is the mother of three children. Of her three children, two have completed polytechnique and the third is in senior high school. She is a petty trader, and she firmly believes in hard work and dedication to her craft which, according to her, is the secret to her business' success.

More specifically, for the past twenty years, she has been a retailer of eggs and soft drinks and has generated a nice stream of income for her family. She is requesting a loan to buy a larger supply of maize and eggs in order to better serve her customers throughout the season, especially in the face of increasing prices due to the current food crisis in her country.

She is a member of the trust group called God is Able. In this group, members provide guarantees for one another as social collateral in order to access loans and apply peer pressure so that the group members properly repay their respective loans.

loans.use: To better serve her customers' needs and to meet their demands by purchasing maize and eggs in bulk.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret K. is forty two years old. She is a widow who lost her husband ten years ago. She has three children who are currently in school. For the past nine years, she has been working as a local manufacturer of palm kernel oil, which she produces and supplies to food vendors so that they can use her palm kernel oil to prepare their meals.

She is seeking a loan in order to buy more bags of palm nuts and an electric milling machine, which would increase her efficiency and enable her to produce palm kernel oil in larger quantities. In this way, she believes that a loan will help expand her business and thereby generate more income to support her family and finance her children’s education.

She belongs to the community group known as “So mu yie” (or "handle with care") Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee one another as social collateral to access loans and apply peer pressure so that each group member properly repays their respective loans.

loans.use: To expand her business and to make the business more efficient by purchasing additional bags of palm nuts and an electric milling machine.

loans.name: Magreth

texts.en: Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 48-year-old Magreth K..  She is married, and has no children. In 2003, Magreth established her garden farming business. Magreth requests a loan to purchase a water pump to irrigate her crops. This will help her achieve a healthier and larger yield. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump for irrigating crops.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 35-year-old Mary M.. She is married and has three children aged between 5 and 11. She has two dependents who live with her because they are in school in the area. In 2004, Mary established her poultry business. She opens her business 6 days a week, 12 hours a day. She is assisted by her one employee. Mary has already received and successfully repaid two loans from SELFINA, and now requests a new loan to purchase additional chicks and feed. This will help her increase her monthly income. In the future, Mary plans to open another business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional chicks and feed.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi G. sells rice, a local dish called gari, and smoked fish. She is married, but her husband's income from fishing is not sufficient for Esi and her 6 children. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits. She is asking for $400 of additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Christian Rural Aid Network (CRAN) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
Gabriela is a recently married 22-year-old woman. Her first loan was obtained while she was still single, and she is now in her third relationship with the institution. Currently, she is expecting her first child and she lives together with her husband in a rented home. From a young age, Gabriela has worked as a secretary and her husband has worked for over six years as an electrician specializing in the repair of Kenwood products. They don’t have competition since they both can count on regular work. The current loan is to help pay for their baby’s delivery costs and also to purchase clothing, a crib, stroller and other products that a new baby will require. Gabriela has demonstrated that she is a responsible person with regard to her loan payments, and she has a good credit history. It should be noted that because Gabriela was not available when the picture was taken, it is instead a photo of her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Gabriela es una señora de 22 años de edad, recientemente se casó. Su primer crédito lo sacó cuando era soltera ahora es su tercera frecuencia con la institución. Actualmente está esperando a su primer hijo y vive junto a su esposo en alquiler. Gabriela trabaja como secretaria desde muy joven y su esposo ya trabaja desde hace más de seis años como técnico electrónoico especializado en artículos de la marca Kenwood. No tienen competencia ya que abos cuentan con un trabajo fijo. El presente préstamo es para los gastos que se necesiten en el parto y también para comprar ropita, cuna, coche y otras cosas que vaya a necesitar su bebe. Gabriela demostró ser una persona muy responsable en el pago de sus cuotas a nuestra institución, tiene un buen historial crediticio. Se hace notar que como Gabriela no estaba para la foto se la tomó a su esposo.

loans.use: To pay for furniture and medical expenses.

loans.name: Demecio

texts.es:
Demecio’s family is comprised of his wife and three children, ages 20, 19 and 11, and they own the home in which they reside. Demecio dedicates himself to transporting passengers in his vehicle, and is an active member of the Warnes transportation cooperative. His wife runs a neighborhood general store from their home, where they also want to be able to offer telephone services to customers. They do have some competition given that other people provide services similar to theirs, but Demecio stands out for his punctuality as well as his membership in the cooperative which offers him some competitive advantages. The current loan is so they can develop and provide VIVA communications. Their prior loans are in good standing, given that they always paid their installments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Demecio tiene una familia que está compuesta por su esposa y sus tres hijos de 20, 19 y 11 años de edad, todos viven en domicilio propio. Demecio se dedica al transporte de pasajeros en su vehículo, es socio activo de la Cooperativa de transportes Warnes. Su esposa cuenta con una tienda de barrio ubicada en el mismo domicilio y donde implementará un punto de llamadas. La competencia es media ya que existen personas que desarrollan las mismas actividades comerciales, pero el servicio que ofrece Demecio es puntual, además que el pertenecer a una cooperativa le permite contar con una ventaja ante la competencia. La presente solicitud es para la implementación de un punto de llamadas VIVA. Sus antecedentes crediticios son buenos ya que siempre cumplió de manera puntual con sus cuotas.

loans.use: Purchase and install a communications/telephone station in their store.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación Agrocapital, a partner of ACDI/VOCA - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: 9 De Agosto Group

texts.es:
This group is maD. up of 12 people, 75% of which are women. The name of the group comes from the area where they all live. All the members have stable businesses and most sell in the Sensata market. Most of the members are builders who have a fixed income through a government plan whereby they build in the Cristal neighbourhood. The group's objective is to grow and improve their standard of living using the loans that they are given. Like Catalina (who you can see in the photo above wearing the blue sweater and cap) who sells hats and gloves as this credit will allow her to buy more gloves for the cruel winter which is when she sells most of her products. Ignacia will also be helped as she sells food in a strategic place near the 25 D. julio school where she sells lunches and small meals, and this loan will allow her to bulk buy flour to make dough and bread.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Grupo conformado por 12 personas 75% del grupo mujeres. El nombre del grupo viene D. la zona donD. ellos residen. Todos las socias y socios tienen negocios estables, casi la mayoría venD. en la feria D. Sensata, los socios son en su mayoría albañiles que tienen un ingreso fijo por el nuevo plan del gobierno que ha impuesto D. las construcciones D. vivienda que queda en la zona cristal. El Grupo tiene por objetivo dar crecimiento y mejorar su nivel D. vida con el préstamo que se les esta brindando. Como ser la señora Catalina que se encuentra en la foto D. la parte superior vestida con chompa celeste y una gorra azul, ella se dedica a la compra D. guantes y gorras este crédito que se le esta otorgando es para la compra D. guantes para este crudo invierno como es fecha clave la señora tendrá éxito en la inversión que ella realizara. También se encuentra doña Ignacia, ella se dedica a la venta D. comida, su pensión se encuentra en un punto estratégico por que esta casi a lado del colegio 25 D. julio donD. venD. almuerzos y platos extras, este préstamo otorgado es para la compra en cantidad D. harina para la elaboración D. algunas masitas y pan.

loans.use: Capital for the businesses of the groups/CAPITAL OPERACIONES

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi I. sells candles, mosquito coils, and matches. She is single, and her income is not sufficient for Esi and her child. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits. She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: As additional capital to expand her business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Christian Rural Aid Network (CRAN) - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Illimani Group

texts.es:
This is the third time the Illmani group has applied for loans, so most of them know the process well. This time they only have 3 new members. Their president Mrs Genara is very outgoing and this is one of the oldest groups in the institution. Their costs range from between 1000Bs - 3300 Bs. The most that they have given was to Ingrid, and they can only give money to members of the institution. In this new cycle they hope to meet everyone's needs and all the members promise to respect and conform to the rules of the credit cycle. The women live in the neighbourhood of Sensata which is where they have their meetings. The women all work in different roles, such as selling food, clothes and clothing articles, fruit and other things. They do this responsibly and the group is very ethical which is why they have high hopes for this cycle.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

El grupo Illimani esta ya en su tercer ciclo, es por esto que ya se conocen muchos D. los componentes, en esta ocasión solamente se cuenta con tres nuevos a los que se les recomendó marchar al ritmo D. la asociación. Su presidenta la Sra. Genara esta muy animada ya que serian unos D. los grupos más antiguos dentro D. la institución. Los montos oscilan entre los 1000 Bs. Y los 3300 Bs. El monto mayor se le dio a la Sra. Ingrid, y según los informes D. central D. riesgos solamente sería cliente D. nuestra institución. En el nuevo ciclo se espera cumplir con todas las disposiciones del grupo, ya que todos los componentes se comprometieron a respetar y cumplir las reglas del ciclo D. crédito. Las señoras pertenecen al barrio D. Sensata, misma zona donD. se realizan las reuniones, las señoras son trabajadoras en diferentes rubros como la venta D. comidas, venta D. ropas y artículos D. vestir, venta D. frutas y otros. Estas actividades la realizan con responsabilidad, y existe bastante solvencia moral en el grupo por lo que se espera acabar el presente ciclo con las mejores expectativas.

loans.use: Capital for operations/CAPITAL DE OPERACIONES

loans.name: Las Tres Estrellas/the Three Stars Group

texts.es:
Group composed of 13 people and 100% of them are women. The name of the group is THE THREE STARS, the women live in the zone of Villa Ingenio. The women carry out various activities; some of them are butchers, others have their stores in the street. The women have known one another for 36 months and are very friendly and supportive of eachother. The president of the group, Mrs. Rosario, has two children and she sells lights to carry to the Yungas region, in particular to Chulumani. Her husband’s name is Israel. The treasurer is Mrs Jannette, she sells detergents in zone 16 of Julio, she has 2 children. The secretary, Mrs. Juana has a carpentry where she works together with her husband Esteban. The group is well consolidated with all the women working before with other entities and for that reason they are well known.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Kirkvold, Kiva volunteer.

Grupo conformado por 13 personas 100 % son mujeres. El nombre del grupo es LAS TRES ESTRELLAS, las señoras viven en la zona D. Villa Ingenio. Las señoras realizan diferentes actividades algunas son carniceras, otras tienen sus tiendas D. barrio. Las señoras se conocen hace 36 meses ellas son muy compañeras y solidarias. La sra. Rosario es la presidenta del grupo tiene 2 hijos ella venD. focos lleva a los Yungas exactamente a Chulumani, su esposo se llama Israel. La tesorera Dña. Jannette, venD. detergentes en la zona 16 D. Julio, tiene dos niños. La secretaria Dña. Juana tiene su carpintería en el cual trabaja juntamente con su esposo Esteban. El Grupo esta bien consolidado ellas anteriormente trabajaron con otras entidades y por lo cual se conocen muy bien.

loans.use: CAPITAL FOR OPERATIONAL COSTS

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 53173

loans.name: Lucerito Group

texts.es:
Las Señoras D. la asociación Banco Comunal LUCERITO, son personas que en su mayoría viven y tienen residencia en la Zona Cupilupaca Central, por intermediaciones D. la avenida periférica D. la ciudad D. La Paz, ellas se dedican al comercio, como la venta D. ropa, venta D. frutas y otros rubros al comercio. La asociación se ve muy unida y con una visión D. progreso en sus respectivas actividades, esperan que el dinero obtenido como crédito D. la entidad fortalezca sus negocios y que más adelante se pueda seguir trabajando con responsabilidad y puntualidad. La presidenta Dña. Rosa Q. D. L. manifiesta las ganas D. trabajar y además D. ser uno D. los mejores grupos en la institución. También se traduce en lo dicho anteriormente por la presidenta la voz D. todos los componentes.

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva Volunteer.

The Ladies of the Bank Communal Lucerito are people who mostly live and have homes in the Cupilupaca Neighborhood of LaPaz. They are mostly businesswomen who sell clothes, fruit and other items. The association is very united around their activities and has a strong vision for progress with the expectation that the money obtained as a credit with strengthen their business and that in the future they will be able to continue working with responsibility and punctuality. The chairwoman, Rosa Quente, reiterates their desire to work and indicates that they are one of the best groups of the institution.

loans.use: Capital for Operational Costs

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana S. sells furniture that he makes. He is married, but his wife's income from selling goods is not sufficient for Nana and his 2 children. Demand for his goods is high, and he is looking to expand his business to increase his profits. He is asking for $400 of additional capital to expand his business.

loans.use: To expand his business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Christian Rural Aid Network (CRAN) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: John

texts.en: John A. sells fish that he catches on his “Awam Sea,” which is a popular canoe here in Ghana. He is married, but his wife's income is not sufficient for John and his 3 children. Demand for his goods is high, and he is looking to expand his business to increase his profits. He is asking for additional capital to expand his business.

loans.use: As additional capital to expand his business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Christian Rural Aid Network (CRAN) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Nuevo Renacer Group

texts.es:
NUEVO RENACER está conformado por 12 personas D. los cuales 10 son mujeres y 2 son varones. La sra. Adelaida es la presidenta del grupo; tiene una hija, ella es profesora en dos colegios. La tesorera Sra. Elizabeth, tiene dos hijos D. 10 y 13 años D. edad, ella confecciona chamarras y venD. telas en Desaguadero y Potosí. La secretaria Srta. Claudia Daniela, realiza ajuares D. bebe y pinturas en tela. Las señoras arguyen que no sabían que en nuestra institución existía la banca comunal, ellas pensaban que solo se otorgaban créditos individuales, pero ahora que ya conformaron su grupo y se les otorgo el crédito, ellas están ahora con muchas ganas D. seguir trabajando en la institución. Juntas y unidas, se comprometen a ser solidarias y responsables, para así poder pasar al segundo ciclo y sacar un poco más D. crédito.

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva Volunteer.

Nuevo Renacer is maD. up of 12 people of whom 10 are women and 2 are men. The president Adelaida is a professor in two highschools and has a daughter. The treasurer, Elizabeth, sells jackets and fabrics in Desaguadero and Potosi; she also has two sons who are 10 and 13 years old. The secretary Claudia Daniela makes baby clothes and painting on canvas. Previously the ladies did not know that their was a communal bank; they thought that it was only possible to obtain individual loans, but now that they have formed their group and have asked for credit, they are very keen to continue working with the organization. United, they promise to be caring and responsible so that they can move onto the second cycle and get a little more credit.

loans.use: Capital for Operational Costs

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 53177

loans.name: Shahida's Group

texts.en:
Shahida baji, wife of A. A., has lived in Kasur, Pakistan, for the last three years. (Baji is an Urdu term meaning "elder sister.") She is a mother of a one-year-old daughter named Kubra and live in a one room house. Her husband runs a grocery shop. Shahida baji is applying for a loan for her husband’s grocery shop.

Her loan group includes four other members. Razia baji wants a loan for her vegetable business; Riaz baji wants a loan to buy a fruit cart; Zikria baji wants a loan for her food business; Bushra baji wants a loan to expand her fruit business.

loans.use: To expand their food businesses

loans.name: Mukankaka

texts.en:
The client, MUKANKAKA M., was born in 1966 in Gikongoro, the south western province of Rwanda. She is married to NTAGENGERWA Eugene, has 8 children and takes care of two more orphans. She has a senior 4 secondary education, and has 13 years of experience in tailoring and in selling different types of clothes she has made.

She makes different models of clothes as she is sharing a tailoring workshop with others. She also sews clothes to be rented for wedding ceremonies. She likes Vision Finance Company because she feels the company meets her need for the loan she is requesting.

The loan will help her to buy different colors and piece of cloth and thread in a larger quantity so as to boost her sales and maximize her profit. She believes that the loan will improve her own and her family's well-being.

loans.use: To buy different colored pieces of cloth and thread for tailoring business.

loans.name: Ojos Del Cielo Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Carmen es la presidente del Banco Comunal OJOS DEL CIELO, perteneciente al barrio de Vino Tinto de la ciudad de La Paz del Municipio La Paz, expresa sus expectativas del trabajo con la entidad, lo mismo se puede rescatar de los otros componentes del grupo, las mismas que se dedican a la venta de diferentes artículos de consumo cotidiano como la presidenta que se dedica a la elaboración y venta de humintas en las arterias de la ciudad. Este mismo espíritu de trabajo y superación tienen las demás socias. El conocimiento y la confianza mutua es importante para un buen desempeño del grupo, es la opinión de los componentes, por esta razón esta etapa de crédito dentro de la entidad viene a ser un nuevo reto para OJOS DEL CIELO.

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva Volunteer.

Ms. Carmen is the president of Bank Communal Ojos del Cielo which is located in the Vino Tinto neighborhood in La Paz. She expresses her expectations of those within the group who are engaged in the sale of various articles of daily consumption; the president makes and sells humintas in the city. This same hard working spirit and the desire to get ahead in life is seen within the other members of the group. Ojos del Cielo see knowledge and mutual trust to be key for the good performance of the group thus for them this becomes a new challenge for them.

loans.use: Capital for Operational Costs

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
Grupo conformado por 16 personas 25 % varones y 75 % mujeres. Estas personas tienen buena experiencia en el sistema financiero, son muy puntuales y unidas. El grupo Renacer se crea el año 2007 y hasta la fecha trabajan juntas sin ninguna falla. Todas las socias tienen negocios estables, mayormente se encuentran ubicadas en el centro paceño, El crédito otorgado esta destinado para el día D. la madre y las fiestas del Gran poder donD. la recuperación es segura por las inversiones que ellas realizan. Dos socias del grupo se dedican al bordado D. los trajes D. la entR. del gran poder y también para las fiestas venideras, la Sra. Delia Irene tiene un local ubicado en la zona villa victoria exclusivamente para estas fiestas, donD. ella compra lotes D. cajas D. cerveza, la Sra. Juana tiene un radio taxi ingresado en la línea Jocar donD. ella trabaja como operadora. El crédito D. esta socia es para el mantenimiento del radio taxi.

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva Volunteer.

This group consists of 16 people 25% men and 75% women. These people are very punctual and united and thus have had a good experience in the financial system. The Renacer group was established in the year 2007 and so far they have been working together without any problems. All partners have stable businesses, mostly located in downtown LaPaz. This credit is intended for Mother's Day and the feasts of “Gran Poder” where they will surely recover their investment. Two members of the group work on embroidering dresses for the “Gran Poder” as well as for the holidays to come. Some of the other members incluD. Mrs. Delia Irene who has a room in the Victoria neighborhood where she stores crates of beer for the holiday season, Mrs. Juana has a radio taxi with the group Jocar where she works as an operator. The provision of this credit is for the maintenance of the radio taxi.

loans.use: Capital for Operational Costs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase stocks of toiletries and underwear in order to start a small business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase of bedspreads, tablecloths and similar goods for re-sale by a small business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase the inventory of a small underwear shop to include pants and shirts

loans.name: Jhonny

texts.es:
Jhonny has three children who are in school or studying at the university. His wife has been working in Spain for the past two years. Jhonny and his family own the home they live in. He dedicates himself to fishing the local rivers, given he has several years of experience in this activity and he is knowledgeable of the business. He has two motorized boats with which he carries out his activities. There is not a lot of competition because to fish one must know the rivers and the area, in addition to being committed to the work. Jhonny’s success is based on his experience and dedication. Currently, he is a member of the Rio Yapacaní fishing association which grants him his fishing license. His loan request is to increase his capital so he can buy a Pentium-based computer, along with the necessary accessories (approximate cost is $700USD). He has a favorable loan history and only works with our institution.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Jhonny tiene tres hijos de los cuales mantiene a sus hijas que se encuentran una estudiando en el colegio y la otra en la universidad, su esposa trabaja en España desde hace dos años. Jhonny y su familia viven en su casa propia. Se dedica a la pecas en ríos de la zona, ya lleva varios años de experiencia en esta actividad y sabe muy bien acerca del negocio, para este fin cuenta con dos motores y botes que le permiten desarrollarse en su actividad. La competencia no es mucha ya que para pescar se requiere de conocimiento del río y la zona, además de dedicación en el trabajo. El éxito de Jhonny se basa en la experiencia y dedicación. Actualmente es miebro de la asociación de pescadores Rio Yapacaní quienes le otrogan una licencia de pesca. La presente solicitud es incrementar capital para la compra de una computadora Pentium, con sus accessorios respectivos el costo aproximado es de $us. 700.-. Tiene buenos antecedentes crediticios y sólo trabaja con nuestra intitución.

loans.use: Purchase of a computer.

loans.name: Dede

texts.fr:
Twenty-five years old, Ms. Dédé T. was born in Lomé, the capital of Togo, and is single. She lives with her younger sister who is going to school. She is an energetic woman who really struggles and who established in 2003 a hair salon called “Coiffure Monte Carlo” in the Adidogomé neighborhood. She manages her salon very professionally with hospitality and high-quality services. This first loan she is seeking will allow her to buy 12 cartons of hair extensions and two bags of hair weaves.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer

Agée de 25 ans, Mademoiselle T. Dédé est née à Lomé, la capitale du Togo et est célibataire. Elle vit avec sa petite sœur qui va à l’école. Elle est une femme dynamique qui se bat beaucoup et a crée en 2003, un atelier de coiffure dénommé « COIFFURE MONTE CARLO » dans le quartier d’Adidogomé.
