Elle gère son atelier avec beaucoup de professionnalisme par son accueil et ses services de qualité. Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 12 cartons de mèche et 2 sachets de tissage.

loans.use: Purchase 12 cartons of hair extensions and two bags of hair weaves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of clothing wholesale

loans.name: Joaquin Mauricio

texts.es:
Mauricio is 43 years old and has three children. Two of his children are studying at the university, and the third is in Spain with his wife. For the past ten years, Mauricio has worked at repairing and painting cars; he has been the owner of this business for the past five years. His excellent service allowed him to consolidate his customers, who appreciate the quality of his work and how well-treated they are. The current loan request is to cancel a debt with our institution and for capital to invest into his workshop. The price he charges per repair varies depending on the degree of damage to the vehicle. He maintains a good credit history with our institution.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Mauricio tiene 43 años de edad y cuenta con tres hijos de los cuales dos de ellos están estudiando en la universidad y el otro se encuentra en España junto a su esposa.Mauricio cuenta con un negocio de chaperio y pintura en general para vehículos desde hace más de 10 años atrás, como dueño del taller lleva unos 5 años. El tiempo de trabajo y buen servicio le permitieron consolidar su clientela, que aprecia la calidad de su trabajo y el excelente trato. La presente solicitud es para liquidar un crédito con nuestra institución y para capital de inversión en su taller. El precio que cobra por cualquier servicio depende de la magnitud de daño del vehículo. Mantiene un buen historial crediticio con nuestra institución.

loans.use: Cancel the debt with AgroCapital and for investment capital.

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr:
Mr. Mamadou C. is a shopkeeper who was born on 19 November 1965 in THIES. He is married and has two children. He has benefited from two previous loans, which he repaid on time. It is with the aim of improving his profit margin that he is requesting this loan to buy merchandise in bulk to resell to his customers.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

M. Mamadou C. est un commerçant qui est né le 19/11/1965 à THIES.il est marié et est père de deux enfants .il a eu à bénéficier de deux crédits qu'il a remboursé correctement.c'est dans le but d'améliorer sa marge bénéficiaire qu'il sollicite ce pret pour acheter des marchandises en quantité pour les revendre à ses clients.

loans.use: To increase his stock of merchandise

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for UIMCEC, a partner of Christian Children\'s Fund - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase ingredients for making pasties and candy

loans.name: Bocar

texts.fr:
Mr. Bocar B. has been a member of the Moda Kane bank since 2006. He has been a mason by profession for over ten years in the city of THIES. He is requesting another loan to buy planks that he will use at his construction sites and that he can relocate from time to time.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

mr bocar B. est un sociétaire de la caisse de moda kane depuis 2006.il exerce la profession de maçon depuis plus de 10ans dans la ville de THIES.il sollicite à nouveau un crédit pour acheter des planches qu'il utilise dans ses chantiers et qu'il peut mettre en location de temps en temps .

loans.use: To buy planks for construction

loans.name: Afua

texts.en: Afua N. is fifty years old. She is married with six children. She is a very resourceful woman and her biggest wish is to provide quality education for her children and give them better life opportunities. At the moment, three have completed senior high school, while the rest are in primary school. She has been a local manufacturer of palm kernel oil for nine years now. Palm kernel oil is produced from palm kernel, which is a by-product of palm oil. She produces and supplies to food vendors to prepare their meals. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of palm nuts and an electric milling machine to facilitate the production process and increase her efficiency to produce in larger quantities. She believes this will help expand her business and raise more income to support her husband, provide food for her family, and finance her children’s education. She belongs to the community group called “So mu yie” (Handle with care) Trust Group and she was photographed at her group meeting. In this group, members guarantee one another as social collateral to access loans, and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bags of palm nuts and an electric milling machine.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.es:
Lorena is an enterprising young woman, who started out as an entertainer at the age of 14 in a well-known children’s show. As she gained experience, she started her own show with her mother’s help. Now that she is grown, she wants to invest in her business to make it grow and to have greater independence. She employs 13 workers who participate in the events with her.

She seeks a loan of $825USD, to be repaid over a period of three months, because she needs additional funds to invest in additional and more varied costumes. On occasion, she has lost a customer who requested a certain type of show that she could not provide and this would allow her to increase her enterprise's wardrobe. With your support, Lorena will be able to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Lorena, es una joven emprendedora que inicio como animadora desde los 14 años en un reconocido Show Infantil, como adquirio experiendia realizo su propio show con la ayuda de su mama, pero ahora que ya es mayor de edad desea empezar a invertir en su negocio para hacerlo crecer y tener mayor solidez. En su show cuenta con 13 empleados que participan en los eventos con ella.

Ahora necesita un prestamo por US $825 que pagara en 3 meses ya que ante la falta de dinero para invertir en mayor cantidad y variedad de botargas en ocaciones ha perdido clientes porque le que solicitan un show que no tiene, ademas de esto podra invertir en mas vestuario para su negocio. Con tu apoyo Lorena consolidara su negocio.

loans.use: To buy new costumes.

loans.name: Tani

texts.en:
Married with four children who are currently schooling, Tani A. is forty years old and has been a local manufacturer of palm kernel oil for ten years. The driving force behind her hard work is providing quality education for her children to give them better life opportunities, which she did not enjoy from her parents.

Palm kernel oil is produced from palm kernel, which is a by-product of palm oil. She produces and supplies to food vendors to prepare their meals. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of palm nuts and an electric milling machine to facilitate the production process and increase her efficiency to produce in larger quantities. She believes this will help expand her business and raise more income to support her husband and provide her children with quality education. She belongs to the community group called “Megyefo Tease” (My Redeemer lives) Trust Group, and she was photographed at her group meeting. In this group, members guarantee one another as social collateral to access loans, and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bags of palm nuts and an electric milling machine.

loans.name: Aissatou

texts.fr:
Aissatou S. is a young woman who was born in Fatick in 1973. She is married and lives with her children in the district of Som in THIES. She does commerce on a small scale with various goods in a canteen located near her home. With this loan, she intends to buy merchandise to bolster her inventory in order to improver her income.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

aissatou S. est une jeune femme née à fatick en 1973.elle est mariée et vit avec ses enfants au quartier som de THIES .elle fait du petit commerce de marchandises diverses dans une cantine située près de chez elle .avec ce pret elle compte acheter des marchandises pour renforcer ses stocks en vue d'améliorer ses revenus.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama A. is a forty one year old divorced mother with seven children. According to Ama, her husband divorced her six years ago, leaving her with the total responsibility of the children. By dint of hard work, she has supported one of the children in finishing vocational school. Another one has successfully completed a learning apprenticeship, while the rest are in school. She sells frozen beef, chicken, fish and palm oil at the local market.

She wants to use the loan to buy an additional refrigerator to increase her stock of beef, chicken, fish and palm oil, as well as to expand her business. She believes that with increased income, she would be more capable of financing her children’s education and be able to provide them with life opportunities that are better than what she had. She belongs to the community group called “Megyefo Tease” (My Redeemer lives) Trust Group, and her photograph was captured at her group meeting. In this group, members guarantee one another as social collateral to access loans, and peer pressure to repay the loan

loans.use: To buy an additional refrigerator to increase stock of beef, chicken, fish and palm oil.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.es:
Eufemia started her business because her husband’s earnings were not enough to cover their living expenses. She worked in a “maquiladora” (factory) but was not earning a full salary, which made it very difficult to financially meet the needs of her three small children. This is how she came to decide to start selling clothing, initially offering her goods to relatives. She now has built a good customer base.

She seeks a loan of $400USD to be repaid over six months. The loan would be used to purchase merchandise so she can, in turn, increase her sales. With your support, she will be able to reach her goal.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Eufemia empezo su negocio porque no completaba con el dinero que percibia su esposo para solventar los gastos del hogar. Ella trabajaba en una maquiladora, pero no estaba percibiendo su salario completo, por lo que le era muy dificil solventar los gastos de sus 3 pequeños hijos. Fue asi que decidio vender ropa, empezo ofreciendola a sus familiares, y actualmente tiene una buena cartera de clientes.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $400 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancia y asi poder incrementar sus ventas. Con tu apoyo podra lograrlo.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce P. is thirty one years old. She is a wife and mother of two children who are currently in school. She is a focused business woman who works hard to provide for her family. She owns and operates grocery shop and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, skimmed powdered milk, etc. She deems it an opportunity to expand her business and wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams and include stationery to increase her stock of goods available for sale. Mary belongs to the community group “Megyefo Tease” (My Redeemer lives) Trust Group. Joyce was photographed at her group meeting.  In this group, members guarantee one another as social collateral to access loans.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams and stationery.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary K. is a widow. She is a forty two year old mother of three children who are currently in school. Mary owns and operates a grocery and cosmetics shop in the local market. She believes she can make her business grow bigger and brighter with loan support, and wants to use the loan to buy more grocery stocks like rice, canned food, bottled water, candies, biscuits and assorted cosmetics to increase her stock of goods. She belongs to the community group called “Asempa kanea” Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee one another as social collateral to access loans, and peer pressure to repay the loan. Mary’s photograph was taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To buy more grocery stocks like rice, canned food, bottled water, candies, biscuits and assorted cosmetics.

loans.name: Women's Wing Group

texts.en: Mabinty Sesay owns a small restaurant in Makeni town and has been in business for more than 3 years.  With her previous loan, she purchased saucepans, plates, bags of rice and five galons of palm oil.  This increased her business capacity and income.  She would like to further expand the business.  Mabinty is 35 years old and married with 5 children.  With her income, she is able to pay school expenses for the children.  She is the group leader and is hardworking.  Ramatu sells dried fish, Gbassey sells rice and palm oil and Adama also runs a small restaurant.  The group is requesting a loan of Le.3200000 to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for the restaurant, stocks of rice, beans, dried fish and vegetables

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia A. is married with four children who are currently in school. She is fifty two years old and has been a seamstress for twenty years. She sews all forms of female clothng in various kinds of styles that suit the tastes of her customers like kaba and slit, wedding dresses, funeral clothes, etc. She wants to use the loan to buy increased supplies of sewing material like linen, threads, thimbles, etc. in order to increase her output and efficiency. She hopes to raise sufficient income to provide her daughter with a quality education. She is a member of the community group called “Asempa kanea” Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee one another as social collateral to access loans, and peer pressure to repay. Cecilia’s photograph was taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To buy increased supplies of sewing material like linen, threads, thimbles, etc.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy S. is the mother of four children. She is forty five years old and married. Mercy is a resourceful mother and she works with the motivation of supporting her children’s education to provide them with better life opportunities in the future. At the moment, three of the children have completed senior high school, but the rest are still in school. She sells corn dough and ice water. Corn dough is a milled maize grain mixed with water and it used in local meals like banku and porridge. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of maize to increase her production of corn dough. She belongs to the community group called “Asempa kanea” Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee one another as social collateral to access loans, and peer pressure to repay the loan. Mercy was photographed during her group meeting.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize.

loans.name: Rosa Idalia

texts.es:
Rosa started her business when her husband lost his job and they entered into a difficult financial situation. Since Rosa wasn't working either, she and her husband couldn’t afford food for their two children. Two years ago Rosa started selling roasted chicken out of her home. Later she had a chance to start selling ceramics, which she has begun to do as well. Selling these ceramic items has been profitable for Rosa, so she would like to continue with this aspect of her business.

Rosa needs a $400 loan, which she will pay back in 6 months, to purchase additional ceramic items for sale. With your support Rosa will be able to continue building a better life.

Translated by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva volunteer

Rosa inicio el negocio debido a que su esposo estaba desempleado, por lo que su situacion economica era muy dificil, ya que ella tampoco laboraba y no tenia ni para comprar alimento para su 2 hijos; por lo que hace dos años ella inicio vendiendo pollo asado en su casa, despues surgio la oportunidad D. vender articuL. D. ceramica. y decidio inicar con esto tambien, esta ultima actividad le ha generado buenos ingresos por lo que desea seguir llevandola a cabo.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $400 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mas articuL. D. ceramica y continuar con las ventas. Con tu apoyo Rosa seguira progresando.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena D. is fifty eight years old. She is a wife and the mother of four children who are currently in school. She is a retailer of charcoal and fire wood in her local community. Charcoal and fire wood are a very popular source of energy for cooking in almost all the traditional Ghanaian homes. Abena obtains her supply of charcoal and fire wood from the villages and retails it to her customers. She wants to use the loan to buy more supplies of charcoal and fire wood to increase her stock. She belongs to the community group called “Asempa kanea” Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for another as social collateral to access loans, and peer pressure to repay the loan. Abena was photographed during her group meeting.

loans.use: To buy more supplies of charcoal and fire wood.

loans.name: Serwaa

texts.en: Serwaa A. is thirty five years old. She is married with three children. Currently, one of them has completed junior high school and is ready to enter senior high school, but the rest are in primary school. She is a retailer of charcoal and frozen fish in her local community. Charcoal is a very popular source of energy for cooking in almost all the traditional Ghanaian homes. Serwaa obtains her supply of charcoal from the villages and retails it to her customers. She also supplies her customers with fresh fish for their meals. She wants to use the loan to buy more supplies of charcoal and fire wood to increase her stock. She belongs to the community group called “Asempa kanea” Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee one another as social collateral to access loans, and peer pressure to repay the loan. Serwaa was photographed during her group meeting.

loans.use: To buy more supplies of charcoal and fire wood.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel A. is not married. He is thirty years old and has been a local producer of polytin (rubber) bags for the past ten years. Daniel is a young man with the vision to serve humanity with his talent and skills. He dreams of a well established company of his own from which to produce the bulk of polytin bags to serve all kinds of purposes. He produces and supplies to food vendors, market sellers and super market operators to wrap bought items for their customers. Daniel is constrained by capital from producing on a large scale to meet the demands of his customers. He wants to use the loan to buy a large quantity of rubbers and another machine to facilitate his production and meet demand. He belongs to the community group called “Nyame Bekyere” (God will provide) Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee one another as social collateral to access loans, and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of rubbers and a machine.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en: Salamatu Y. is forty two years old. She is a wife and the mother of six children who are currently in school. She is a food vendor and sells “waakye”. Waakye is cooked rice and beans enjoyed with stew, macaroni and fish. It is sold in the mornings as breakfast. It is very tasty and satisfying, and almost all tribes in Ghana enjoy waakye. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice, vegetable oil, beans and macaroni to prepare good ‘waakye’ for her customers. She believes this will provide her with increased income to send her first son to medical school this year. She belongs to the community group called Ruth “Mma” (Children of Ruth) Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee one another as social collateral to access loans, and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, vegetable oil, macaroni and beans.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
Alejandra is divorced and has three small children. Because of the pension Alejandra receives, her children are able to attend elementary school. But the pension isn’t enough to cover some of the children’s costs, such as food, school fees, sickness, etc. Three years ago Alejandra decided to start a business and began selling lightly used clothing, which she buys in bundles. Her business has been profitable.

Alejandra needs a loan of $600, which she will pay back in 6 months, to remodel her house and convert one of its rooms into a shop. This way she’ll have more space to display the clothes she sells. She also plans to buy shelves to display these clothes. With your support Alejandra can expand her business.

Translated by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva volunteer

Alejandra es divorciada y tiene 3 hijos pequeños que cursan la primaria debido a que la pension que recibe es muy poca y no es suficiente para mantener los gastos de los niños como: de alimentacion, gastos escolares, enfermedades, etc., hace tres años ella decidio emprender un negocio, empezo con la venta de ropa seminueva la cual compra por pacas, y le ha generado buenos ingresos.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $600 que pagara en 6 meses ya que desea remodelar su casa y convertir en local una de las recamaras para asi tener mayor esapcio para la exhibion de la ropa, ademas de comprar algunos estantes para lo mismo. Con tu apoyo Alejandra podra hacer crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Remodel and buy shelves

loans.name: Nyiragicari

texts.en:
She was born in 1969 in Burundi, neighbouring country to the south of Rwanda where her parents took refuge. She is married to GAHIGI Prosper and has 8 children and 7 orphans whom she is taking care of.

She has completed senior 4 secondary school. She has been a businesswoman since after the 1994 genocide in Rwanda. She started by selling small items and after years in the business she started to improve as now owns a shop selling embroidered clothes in her local market.

She wants an additional loan to boost her business and is confident enough to improve her business, once she gets a loan from Vision Finance Company. She is also expecting that the loan will allow her to earn more income that will help her to improve her family living conditions, especially for the health care and education of children and the orphans she cares for.

loans.use: To buy embroidered clothes for retail

loans.name: Martha Maria Cristin

texts.es:
Ten years ago, when Martha’s husband died leaving her with three children and no money, she had to find a means to support her and her children. She attended a training class in making decorative candles and with the money that she had saved, she started her own small business. With the income from this business she has managed to support her children.

Martha requires a loan for $975, repayable over six months, to fulfil her existing orders and to purchase basic materials for making decorative candles, since from around this time of the year she has to start preparing for the festive season in December.

With your support, Martha can grow her business further.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

Martha es viuda y tiene 3 hijos por lo que tuvo que buscar una actividad que le generara ingresos comenzó hace aproximadamente 10 años cuando enviudo al no tener ya el dinero que le proveia su marido para su manutencion y la de sus hijos, tomo un curso para la elaboracion de velas decorativas y con dinero que tenia ahorrado, empezo su negocio comprando materiales para elaborarlas, de ahí en adelante emprendio su microempresa y gracias a esta ha podido sacar adelante a sus hijos.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $975 que pagara en 6 meses ya que desde estas fechas empieza a prepararse para la temporada fuerte de diciembre con la elaboracion de diferentes tipos de velas, ademas de surtir lo pedidos que tiene pendientes, por lo que necesita dinero para adquirir materia prima. Con tu ayuda Martha consolidara su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of basic materials

loans.name: Love Group

texts.en: Adama S. is 36 years old and married with 5 children. Adama and  her husband  own small stalls of used clothes in the town of Makeni.  Her husband assisted her in establishing the business 3 year ago and, with her previous loan from SMT, she diversified the business.  The other 4 goup members own small grocery shops in the same town. Adama S. is the group leader, and the members are requesting the loans in order to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To increase stocks of used clothes and groceries

loans.name: Rosa Hilda

texts.es:
Rosa is married and has two children, one 19 and the other 23 years old.

She began her small business selling tacos and plain and filled pastries from a corner of her make-shift premises. Fortunately, by being in the right place at the right time, one of her customers offered her larger premises for the preparation and sale of her products. Her business has prospered since and she has many loyal customers.

Rosa requires a loan of $350, repayable over six months, to purchase basic natural ingredients so that she can put her business on a firmer footing.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

Rosa es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 19 y 23 años, empezó su pequeño negocio hace 4 años con la venta de tacos de harina y enrollados en una esquina de su colonia. Gracias a su buen sazón, un cliente le propuso que le prestaba por un tiempo un local para que se estableciera y pudiera tener mas espacio para su venta. Entonces ella acepto, hasta hoy en día le ha ido muy bien, le deja buenas ganancias, ya que gracias a que esta en un lugar estable tiene muchos clientes.

Ahora ella solicita un crédito por US $350 que pagara en a 6 meses, para la compra de materia prima trabaja, ya que desea establecer bien su negocio. Con tu apoyo Rosa lograra sus metas.

loans.use: Purchase of basic and natural ingredients

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es:
Emilia started her business two years ago selling soft drinks and different types of fried potatoes, including French fries. In addition, she designed bridal gowns and special gowns for girls’ fifteenth birthday. (In some Latin American countries, a girl’s fifteenth birthday is a special occasion and is celebrated differently and more elaborately – similar(ish) to the “sweet sixteen” celebrations).

She invested the profits from these two sources of income into buying a shop and converting it into a mini-supermarket. Consequently, she has achieved what she had always wanted and today she owns a small supermarket called “Super Mini Emy”.

Emilia requires a loan of $975, repayable over six months, to buy stock and to expand and remodel her store. With your assistance, she will achieve her goal.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

Emilia inicio el negocio hace aproximadamente 2 años vendiendo refrescos y frituras, y también dedicándose a la costura principalmente al diseño de vestidos para Quinceañeras y Novias. De estos dos ingresos fue invirtiéndole más y más ya que deseaba tener una tienda, que deseaba convertir en un pequeño mini súper, gracias a su esfuerzo ha visto lograda su meta, ya que hoy en día cuenta con un mini súper llamada Mini Super “Emy”.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $975 que pagara en 6 meses, para comprar mercancía, para ampliar y remodelar la tienda. Con tu ayuda ella lograra sus próximas metas

loans.use: Purchase of stock and redecoration of business premises

loans.name: Sara Bertha

texts.es:
Sara is an enterprising woman who started her business selling flour tortillas eight years ago. She later expanded her business to include preparation and sale of a selection of food dishes for dinner parties and banquets. More recently, she decided to sell groceries as well. Her activities have gradually borne fruit and now she has her own premises, from which she sells groceries as well as prepared food dishes.

Sara requires a loan of $975, repayable over six months, to purchase stock and ingredients. She is confident that with your support she can achive her goals.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

Sara es una mujer emprendedora inicio su negocio vendiendo tortillas de harina, posteriormente empezó hacer platillos de comida ofreciéndolos para banquetes, ella inicio este negocio hace aproximadamente 8 años. Posteriormente tuvo la idea de emprender otro negocio como la venta de abarrotes, empezó a surtirlo poco a poco hasta que adquirió un local, y hoy en día le ha ido bien, tanto en la venta de abarrotes como en la venta de comidas, ya que realiza las 2 actividades.

Ahora ella necesita de un crédito de $975 que pagara en 6 meses para la compra de mercancía. Ella confía que con tu apoyo podrá lograr sus metas.

loans.use: Purchase of stock and ingredients

loans.name: Jorge Roman

texts.es:
Jorge is married and he has two grown up children who are also married.

He began his business seven years ago when he was made redundant from his job in a gas company following its restructuring and reorganisation. Needing to earn an income, he decided to use the knowledge and experience he had gained on security products to market and sell these products.

Jorge needs a loan for $975, repayable over six months, to remodel and redecorate his office premises to be able to convey a better and more professional image to his clients. With your support, he will be able to increase his revenue and grow his business.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

Jorge es casado y tiene dos hijos, ya casados. El inicio su negocio hace 7 años al quedarse desempleado debido a un reajustado de la compañía de gas donde trabajaba, por lo que requeria de algun ingreso seguro, fue asi que decidio emprender su propio negocio, y al tenr conocimiento sobre los productos de seguridad decidio empezar con la comercializacion de dichos productos.

El necesita un prestamo por US $975 que pagara en 6 meses para remodelar el local donde trabaja y tener una mejor imagen para sus clientes. Con tu apoyo Jorge hara crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Remodelling and Redecoration of business premises

loans.name: Silvina

texts.es:
Silvina is a widow and has three grown-up and married children. She lives alone.

To remain active and earn extra income, she attended an informational session on the use of natural products six years ago. Following her own positive experience of using these products, she recognised their sales potential and decided to join and has been part of the distribution network that sells natural products ever since.

Silvina requires a loan of $450, repayable over six months, to purchase stock and to fulfil the orders she has already received and are outstanding.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

Silvina es viuda tiene 3 hijos ya adultos y casados, ella vive sola y para mantenerse activa demas de percibir ingresos extra, deicidio emprender su negocio todo surgio cuando la invitaron a una platica de informacion de productos naturistas cuando ella empezo a consumir estos productos, como ella tuvo una experiencia positiva con estos productos, estaba convencida de que realmente cumplian lo que prometian por lo le fue muy facil venderlos, y desde hace 6 años es distribuidora de red de esta marca.

Ahora ella necesita un prestamo por US $450 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancia y asi poder surtir algunos pedidos que tiene pendientes.

loans.use: Purchase of stock

loans.name: Juan Gloria

texts.es:
Juana is divorced and has four children, three who are married and a little 7-year-old. She worked as a cleaner for a doctor's office ever since she was little, but when she divorced she needed to increase her income. So she started selling candy, but it was still not enough. She has sold stuffed animals and toys for the past three years and that has worked out better.

Now Juana is requesting a loan of $500, which she plans to repay within six months, to purchase supplies. With your help, Juana will be able to make headway.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva volunteer

Juana es divorciada tiene 4 hijos, tres hijas casadas y uno pequeño de 7 años. Ella trabaja con una doctora haciendole el aseo, desde que era jovencita, pero cuando se divorcio, necesitaba aumentar sus ingresos por lo que empezo a vender dulces pero no le dejaba suficientes ingresos, ahora vende muñecos de peluche y blancos desde hace 3 años, actividad que le reditúa mejor.

Ahora ella necesita un préstamo por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía. Con tu apoyo Juana saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Purchase supplies / Comprar mercancia

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business #53217

loans.name: Amanecer Senkata Group

texts.es:
The Amanecer group is made up of12 people, 25% men and 75% women. The group name comes from the name of the area where the members live, Senkata. The group is entering its third cycle; the previous two were completed with integrity and honesty without fail, except for one person who has now left the group for that reason. The hope is that everyone is able to continue to capitalize for the future and not depend on loans in order to work with their own capital in order to create their small businesses for the benefit of their families. The types of businesses of the group’s members include the sale of underwear, groceries, fish, shoes, gasoline and others.

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva Volunteer.

El grupo amanecer sensata está conformado por 12 personas 25 % varones y 75% mujeres. El nombre del grupo sale de la misma zona por que residen por la zona de Senkata. El grupo actualmente ingresó a su tercer ciclo, en los dos primeros trabajaron con honestidad y honradez sin fallar ninguna de sus cuotas, exceptuando una persona que en este ciclo no ingreso por la misma razón. La esperanza de cada persona es poder seguir capitalizándose para mas adelante ya no depender de prestamos y poder trabajar con capital propio, de esa manera crear sus microempresas para el provecho de sus familias. Nombre del socio Actividad Años en el Rubro P. C. THELMA MERCEDES VENTA DE ROPA INTERIOR 9 Q. A. ADELA Q. T. BERNARDA C. J. JUAN M. Y. CRISTINA Q. SILFORIO HORACIO I. H. FILOMENA VENTA DE BATIDOS 3 R. T. JUANA ELABORACION DE ZAPATOS 5 M. Q. AGUSTINA VENTA DE PESCADO 4 T. B. JOAQUIN VENTA DE ABARROTES 2 P. P. FLORENCIA VENTA DE ABARROTES 2 C. C. PANFILA VENTA DE GASOLINA 3

loans.use: Capital for Operational Costs

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación Agrocapital, a partner of ACDI/VOCA - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maria is married, and her husband is a contracted security guard but does not make much income. They have two small children, one in preschool, the other in primary school, and given that there were a lot of expenses and little to pay it with from her husband Maria decided to start her business to generate extra income. Little by little she was able to set up a convenience store, and the business has given the economic stability it needed.

Now Maria is requesting a loan of $975, which she plans to repay in six months, to purchase merchandise for her store. With your help, Maria can make her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva volunteer

Maria es casada su esposo trabaja en seguridad publica, por lo que no percibe muchos ingresos, ella tiene 2 niños pequeños que cursan pre-escolar y primaria, dado que eran muchos los gastos y muy pocos los ingresos de su esposo ella decidio emprender un negocio que le genrara ingresos extras, por lo que poco a poco fue poniendo una tienda de abarrotes, este negocio le esta dando la estabilidad economica que su familia necesitaba, ya que el trabajo de su esposo es por contratos.

Ahora necesita un prestamo por US $975 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancia. Con tu ayuda Maria hara crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise / comprar mercancia

loans.name: Maricela

texts.es:
Maricela is married and her husband is an iron and steel worker. They have three school-aged children. She started her business nine years ago because her husband back then was on disability and his pay was very low. So she started making flour tortillas in their kitchen stove to later sell, and little by little she consolidated her business and set up a shop where she now has two employees who help her make the tortillas.

Now Maricela is requesting a loan of $500, which she plans to repay within six months, to remodel her shop and thus improve its image. With your support, Maricela can make her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva volunteer

Maricela es casada su esposo trabaja en la siderurgica Altos Hornos de Mexico, tiene tres hijos de edad escolar. Inicio su negocio hace 9 años. porque su esposo en aquel entonces estaba incapacitado, y su pago era muy poco, entonces ella empezo a hacer tortillas de harina en la estufa de su cocina para despues venderlas, poco a poco logro consolidar su negocio y establecerse en local donde tiene dos empleadas que le ayudan haciendo las tortillas.

Ahora ella necesita un prestamo por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para remodelar su local y asi tenr una mejor imagen. Con tu apoyo Maricela hara crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Remodel her tortilla shop / Remodelar su local

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business #53220

loans.name: Yanapassiñani Group

texts.es:
This group is maD. up of 14 people who all live in the Collpani area. The name comes from the word Yanapasiñani which means “We will help each other” and was created by Victor who is chairman of the bank. The group is entering its third cycle; the previous two were completed without any problems or delays. The group is very supportive and anytime anyone within the group had trouble repaying the group covered their debt. The fourteen people are aware of the obligations they are committing to as well as those of the institution and above all know that the money is provided to them for investment in their respective businesses. They each have good expectations for growth. The types of businesses of the group’s members incluD. the sale of clothes, cosmetics and cell phones as well as several drivers.

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva Volunteer.

Grupo conformado por 14 personas todas viven por la zona D. Collpani. El nombre fue creado por el señor Víctor que es el Presidente del banco, por que la palabra Yanapasiñani significa “Nos ayudaremos”. El grupo entro a su tercer ciclo D. los cuales los dos anteriores trabajaron sin ninguna preocupación ni retraso alguno mas al contrario el grupo es muy solidario y D. la persona que una vez falló, el grupo cubrió su deuda. Las catorce personas están concientes respecto a la obligación que están adquiriendo, tienen conocimiento D. todas las obligaciones que tienen con la institución y sobre todo saben que el dinero que se les presta es para la inversión en sus negocios respectivos. Estas personas tienen buenas expectativas para el crecimiento D. cada uno D. los componentes del grupo.

Nombre D. los socios:

P. E. EULOGIA P. S. HILDA ROSA M. N. LUSMILA JIMENA M. M. VICTOR B. E. EDITH JESUSA M. D. T. VICTORIA C. COND. VICTOR HUGO B. D. Y. MERCEDES LIDIA A. D. A. ELENA G. M. YOVANA MIRIAM C. COND. WILDER RAMIRO VENTA D. CELULARES 5 C. D. M. MARIA VENTA D. ROPA 1 R. L. ESCOLASTICA VENTA D. COSMETICOS 2 T. B. VIDAL ZENON CHOFER 2

loans.use: Capital for Operations

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario started her business so she could help her children get ahead and help her husband with family expenses, since they wanted to own a house. She started working about three years ago on the invitation of a friend and has dedicated herself to selling footwear. She began by selling her items to friends and neighbors until little by little she was able to add more customers.

Now Rosario is requesting a loan of $250, which she plans to repay within three months, to stock up on shoes for graduation, which is fast approaching. With your support Rosario will be able to keep moving ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva volunteer

Rosario inició el negocio para sacar adelante a sus hijos y ayudar a su esposo ya que deeaban tener su casa, y forjar un patrimonio para sus hijos. Comenzó su negocio por por invitacion de una amiga hace aproximadamente 3 años, se decida a la venta de zapatos, empezo vendiendo entre sus amigos y vecinos, hasta que poco a poco se ha ido haciendo de mas clientes.

Ahora necesita un prestamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para surtir calzado escolar para las graduaciones, que estan proximas. Con tu apoyo Rosario saldra adelante.

loans.use: Purchase supplies / Comprar mercancia

loans.name: Gloria Azucena

texts.es:
Gloria started her business so she could have an activity and supply additional family income since she wanted to remodel her home and purchase furniture to make it more comfortable for her and her family. So she started offering footwear to friends and her husband's co-workers more than two years ago.

Gloria is requesting a loan of $250, which she plans to repay within three months, to purchase school shoes since that time of year is approaching and is when her sales increase. With your support Gloria can make her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva volunteer

Gloria inició el negocio para tener una actividad y un ingreso adicional al que le da su marido ya que ella deseaba acondicionar su casa y comprar muebles para estar mas comoda ella y su familia. Comenzó hace mas de 2 años ofreciendole calzado a los compañeros de trabajo de su esposo y amistades.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar zapatos escolares ya que se aproxima la temporada de graduaciones que es cuando sus ventas se incrementan. Con tu apoyo Gloria hara crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase shoes to sell / Comprar mercancia

loans.name: Sonia Patricia

texts.es:
Sonia started her business on the advice of her mother, who had sold footwear and cosmetics for a long time. Her mom showed her how to sell products by catalogue, and Sonia enjoyed the activity. Sonia was in very bad economic trouble because her husband did not have steady employment, so they were in need of good income. She started about two years ago helping her mother with her sales until she went out on her own with her own clients. Unlike her mother, she's solely dedicated to shoe sales.

Now Sonia is requesting a loan of $250, which she plans to repay in three months, to purchase supplies and have a better product stock so she better serve her customers. With your help, Sonia can make her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva volunteer

Sonia inició el negocio por consejo de su mama ya que la señora siempre ha sido vendedora de calzado y cosmeticos , animo a su hija a que vendiera por catalogo y a ella tambien le gusto la actividad. Ella tenia problemas economicos muy fuertes ya que su esposo no tenia trabajo fijo, por lo que necesitaba de ingresos fuertes. Comenzó hace aproximadamente 2 años ayudandole a su mama con las ventas hasta que se independizo creando sus propios clientes, ella solo se dedica a la venta de zapatos.

Ahora ella necsita un prestamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancia y tener un mayor surtido de productos y asi darle mejor atencion a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Sonia hara crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase supplies / Comprar mercancia

loans.name: Josefa Benigna

texts.es:
Small business owner Josefa Benigna F. M. is native of the city of Bluefields, she is 61 years old and a single mother of 3 children over 18 years of age. Currently Mrs. F. takes care of her 8 years old grnadson for whom she pays his studies, food, and clothing with the income she get s from the business, which is her only source of incom. She has been the owner of a small retail store for more than 30 years. She sells footwear ¨slippers¨, cosmetics, perfumes, body creams, and underwear for men and women. Her clients prefer shopping at her store since she offers a wide variety of products. Mrs. F. needs to buy six dozen of footwear ¨slippers¨ for men each US$ 24, seven dozen footwear ¨slippers¨ for woman each US$ 23, six dozen footwear ¨slipper¨ for teenagers each US$ 24, these type of slippers have great demand in this city. With this investment she will be able to increase the profit of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer

La microempresaria Josefa Benigna F. M. es originaria de la ciudad de Bluefields, tiene 61 años de edad, es madre soltera de 3 hijos mayores de edad, en la actualidad la Sra. F. tiene a su cuidado un nieto de 8 años quien le paga sus estudios, alimentación, vestimenta con el ingreso del negocio, cabe mencionar que el único ingreso de la Sra. F. es su negocio. La microempresaria es propietaria de un tramo por más de 30 años donde vende calzados ¨chinelas¨, cosméticos, perfumes, crema corporales, ropa interior para hombres y mujeres de todas las edades, sus clientes son los transeúntes que la prefieren por ofrecer una variedad de productos. La microempresarias necesita comprar 6 docenas de calzado ¨chinelas¨ para hombres a $ 24.00 dólares la docena, 7 docenas de calzado ¨chinelas¨ para mujer a $ 23.00 dólares la docena, 6 docenas de calzado ¨chinela¨ para adolecentes a $ 24.00 dólares la docena, cabe mencionar que este tipo de calzado ¨chinelas¨ tiene gran demanda en nuestra ciudad. Con esta inversión podrá aumentar la ganancia de su negocio.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

payments.comment: La cuota real de pago es de $ 74.79 dólares.
La  cuota real de pago es de $ 74.79  dólares.

loans.name: Llegando Lejos (Going Far) Groups 1 & 3

texts.en:
Eugenia, the group leader, has five children, ages 2, 6, 7, 11 and 16. She lives in a batey (which is a very poor community) of Haitian families in El Seibo, Dominican Republic. Families that live in bateys have small houses generally made of scrap tin and wood; the best possible accommodation is a cement-block house. These ¨houses¨ consist of only one room where the whole family lives together. To provide for her family, Eugenia has a small business killing chickens and selling their meat in neighboring bateys. In order to travel between bateys, Eugenia pays a small fee to ride on the back of a motorcycle.

By receiving loans, she and the other members of the Bank of Hope are better able to survive the economic fluctuations and frequent sicknesses that make work hard and volatile. With this next loan, Eugenia hopes to further grow her business by buying more chickens and travelling to more bateys. Someday she dreams of owning her own house. Eugenia also wants to be able to provide the best for her children, including a good education, so that they will have a bright future.

Eugenia is part of the Llegando Lejos (Going Far) group. The Bank of Hope with Esperanza International supports six groups in total, two of which are requesting new loans now.

Note: This is a group loan to 10 people.

loans.use: To buy more chickens and pay for transportation

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Esperanza International, a partner of HOPE International - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Esperando En Dios (Hoping In God) Groups 5&6

texts.en:
Lislena, the group leader, is 28 years-old and has four children ages 4, 6, 7 and 10.  She lives in a batey (which is a very poor community) of Haitian families in El Seibo, Dominican Republic. Families that live in bateys have small houses generally made of scrap tin and wood; the best possible accommodation is a cement-block house.  These ¨houses¨ consist of only one room where the whole family lives together. To provide for her family, Lislena buys clothes in the city and then re-sells them for a profit in her batey and another neighboring batey.  
By receiving loans, she and other members of the Bank of Hope are better able to survive the economic fluctuations and frequent sicknesses that make work hard and volatile. Lislena hopes that this loan will help her continue to grow her business so that her family can improve their living situation.  She would love to own her own house someday and hopes to provide a good education for her children.
Lislena is a member of the Esperando en Dios (Hoping in God) group. The Bank of Hope with Esperanza International supports six groups in total, two of which are requesting new loans now.
Note: This is a group loan to 10 people.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to re-sell

loans.name: Clarial

texts.es:
Clarial P. dedicates herself to the business of selling shoes in the central market in the city of Chinandega. She has dedicated herself to this business for several months during which time she has been able to succeed in this business. This has alllowed her to provide her two small children with better living conditions.

The necessity she is currently faced with is that in order for her to succeed, she must invest in the purchase of shoes. For this reason she is calling upon Ceprodel for a loan to purchase merchandise for its subsequent sale.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

La dama Clarial P. se dedica al negocio de la venta de calzados en el mercado Central de la ciudad de Chinandega. Se dedica al negocio desde hace varios meses y a medida que el tiempo ha venido transcurriendo ha logrado salir adelante en el negocio proporcionándoles mejores condiciones de vida a sus dos pequeños hijos que tiene bajo su responsabilidad.

La necesidad que ella atraviesa es que para salir adelante necesita invertir en la compra de los zapatos para comercializarlos. Por esta razón es que acude a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito necesario para la compra de la mercadería para luego ofrecerla en su sector de trabajo.

loans.use: Purchase of shoes.

loans.name: Doris Sagrario

texts.es:
In the central market in the city of Chinandega, Doris Martinez dedicates herself to selling food which she endeavors to prepare at a high quality.

She is the mother of three small children and she provides for the schooling of one of her children who is in school. The necessity which her business is currently faced with is that she must invest in the purchase of ingredients to prepare food. For this simple reason she is calling upon Ceprodel for a necessary loan to purchase ingredients so that she can continue her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

En el mercado Central de la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Doris Martinez se dedica al negocio de venta de comida el cual prepara con mucho empeño y un alto grado de calidad.

Es madre de tres pequeños hijos de los cuales uno de ellos está estudiando en el colegio por lo que debe de proporcionarle los estudios que este necesita. La necesidad que el negocio atraviesa es que debe de invertir en la compra de los ingredientes para la comida. Por esta sencilla razón acude hoy en día a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito necesario para la compra de la materia prima y así continuar con el negocio en su localidad.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients to make food.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria Membreno dedicates herself to the sale of fruit such as grapes, apples, bananas, mangos, watermelons and papayas which she sells outside the central market in Chinandega.

This lady distinguishes herself by being hard working in preparing fruit to sell to her clients who visit the market. The necessity that this lady is faced with is the need for a loan to purchase fruit. This is why she is relying on Ceprodel, trusting that her loan will be granted so that she can continue her daily labors.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Gloria M. se dedica a su negocio de venta de frutas como lo son uvas, manzanas, bananos, mangos, sandias y papayas vendiéndolos en las afueras del mercado central en Chinandega.

Esta dama se caracteriza por ser una persona muy esforzada que en todo momento prepara sus frutas para comercializarlas a los clientes que visitan el mercado. La necesidad que hoy en día atraviesa esta dama es que necesita el crédito para la compra de sus frutas. Por esto se apoya de Ceprodel confiando que su crédito será otorgado y así continuará su labor diaria.

loans.use: Purchase of fruit.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel Munoz dedicates her efforts to her business of selling clothing in the city of Chinandega where she sells her products at the central market.

She is a hard working person who is looking for a way to succeed in her business so that she can provide for her family. For this simple reason she is calling upon Ceprodel for a loan that will allow her to purchase merchandise to sell to her clients so that she may be able to continue supporting her family.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Maribel M. se dedica con mucho esfuerzo a su negocio de venta de ropa en la ciudad de Chinandega donde vende sus productos en el mercado Central de esta ciudad.

Actualmente ella es una persona esforzada que busca la manera de salir adelante en su negocio para llevar el sustento a su hogar. Por esta sencilla razón es que acude a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito necesario que le permita obtener la mercadería para luego ofertarla a sus clientes en su tramo y de esta manera continuar con el sustento de su hogar.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing.

loans.name: Miriam Del Carmen

texts.es:
In the Central Market of the city of Chinandega, Miriam del Carmen Z. vigorously dedicates herself to her business of selling vegetables - in particular, bananas. Her business is currently in need of an investment due to rough weather.

With a lot of effort and sacrifice, she has been able to provide for her family, to feed her three small children as well as provide for their education. The loan that she seeks from Ceprodel will benefit her as well as her humble family.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

En el Mercado Central de la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Miriam del Carmen Z. se dedica muy esforzadamente a su negocio de venta de verduras especialmente plátanos los cuales los comercializa en su establecimiento con necesidad de inversión por estar a la intemperie.

Con muchos esfuerzos y sacrificios, ella ha logrado llevar a su casa el pan de cada día y así alimentar a sus tres pequeños hijos brindándoles también los estudios. Con el crédito que solicita en Ceprodel se beneficia tanto ella como su humilde familia.

loans.use: Purchase of vegetables.

loans.name: Nery Lisseth

texts.es:
Mrs. Nery Lisseth C. operates her own business selling shoes in the Central market in the city of Chinandega.

Since she is responsible for maintaining her home, she has decided to improve her business in order to attract new customers to buy her products. It is important to highlight that she has put forth great effort to improve the conditions of her business already using loans from Ceprodel to make improvements to her shop. She is seeking a loan today in order to purchase more merchandise; she hopes she will be granted the loan soon without any problems.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Nery Lisseth C. se dedica a su negocio de venta de calzados los cuales los comercializa en su tramo en el mercado Central de la ciudad de Chinandega.

Con la responsabilidad de llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación, ha decidido mejorar las condiciones del negocio para ganar nuevos clientes que compren sus productos. Es de importancia destacar que ella se ha venido esforzando grandemente para mejorar las condiciones de su negocio y para ello ha hecho uso de los préstamos brindados por Ceprodel los cuales los ha utilizado en el mejoramiento de su local. El propósito por el cual hoy en día solicita un nuevo crédito es para la compra de la mercadería. Por esta razón espera muy confiadamente que su crédito le será otorgado sin ningún problema.

loans.use: Purchase of shoes

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario S. is a woman who stands out for being an excellent cook who sells prepared meals in the Central market in the city of Chinandega.

She has worked for 30 years in the business of making and selling various types of meals and this has been her only income in order to feed her family. She is seeking a loan from Ceprodel in order to purchase raw materials to make these meals and thereby continue maintaining her humble home.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosario S. es una dama que se ha destacado por ser una excelente cocinera ya que vende alimentos preparados por ella misma en el mercado Central de la ciudad de Chinandega.

Es una dama que desde hace 30 largos años se ha dedicado al negocio de la elaboración de distintos tipos de platillos siendo este su único ingreso con el cual alimenta a su familia. La razón por la cual solicita el crédito en Ceprodel es para la compra de la materia prima para elaborar los alimentos y así continuar con el mantenimiento de su humilde hogar.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials to make meals

loans.name: Miscelánea

texts.es:
Her dedication to food sale has provided the possibility of building a restaurant at doña Miscelánea’s home, as she has won the affection and respect of her clients due to her good attention and seasoning. She is a single mother and in spite of such a huge responsibility it is her wish to make progress. Doña Miscelánea wishes her business to continue growing as she wants to open another restaurant in the future and therefore she wishes to implement new things to her kitchen and for this project she requires a loan as soon as possible. Doña Miscelánea awaits the selfless support from your noble heart.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Su dedicación a la venta de comida ha posibilitado la construcción de un restaurante en el domicilio de la señora Miscelánea, ella por su buena atención y sazón, se ganó el cariño y respeto de sus clientes. Es madre soltera, y a pesar de cargar con esta responsabilidad tan grande tiene muchos deseos de progresar. La señora Miscelánea quiere seguir surgiendo en su negocio ya que posteriormente quiere abrir otro restaurante y para ello quiere implementar su cocina con cosas nuevas y para este proyecto estima de un préstamo lo más pronto posible para cumplir su objetivo. La señora Miscelánea espera la ayuda desinteresada de tu noble corazón.

loans.use: Increase capital to update kitchen tools and purchase new ones to improve service.

loans.name: Odisea

texts.es:
Odisea is a 42 year-old mother of two. Presently she sells food in front of the facilities of an educational center offering a variety of dishes to students and teachers. As a single mother she has been able to improve remarkably her life quality through this activity and today, thanks to the demand of her food she wishes to build a small space where she can receive her customers comfortably. This dream can come true if your significant support reaches her at this moment.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Odisea tiene 42 años de edad y es madre de 02 hijos. Actualmente se desempeña frente a las instalaciones de un centro educativo ofertando diversos alimentos para los estudiantes y maestros. Con su actividad, debido a que es madre soltera, ha podido mejorar notablemente su calidad de vida y ahora gracias a la demanda de sus alimentos está deseosa de construir un pequeño espacio para recibirlos con comodidad. Y este sueño podrá hacerse realidad si vuestra importante ayuda llega a ella en estos momentos.

loans.use: Build a secure and comfortable sales space.

loans.name: Enith

texts.es:
Enith is the only lady selling fruit in her community and therefore here clients’ demands are large and very satisfactory. Daily she spends hours of attention and joy with each and every housewife that visits her, and her wish to improve is centered on the development of her little ones. Your response and immediate support would contribute to make her dream come true as it is her wish to enlarge her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Enith, dentro de su zona es la única dama que comercializa frutas y debido a esta razón la demanda de sus clientes es amplia y muy satisfactoria. A diario dedica horas enteras de atención y alegría a cada una de las amas de casa que la visitan y su deseo de mejora se centra en el desarrollo de cada uno de sus pequeños. Vuestra respuesta y ayuda inmediata podrá contribuir con el cumplimiento D. deseo de ampliación de su negocio.

loans.use: Enlarge a small sales stand.

loans.name: Sally

texts.es:
Sally is the owner of four motortaxies and at the same time she sells beauty products. She has two young children and is separated from her husband as a result of poor understanding between them, nevertheless, her brother supports her and he looks after her work tools. It is her wish that her children become successful professionals and therefore she wants to establish a business in the future. She requires a sum of money to invest in maintenance and repair of her work tools and to improve her home environment, keeping in mind that later on she will rent a space to set up her business. Let us support this mother who is working with arduous effort and dedication to make progress.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Sally es propietaria de cuatro mototaxis y al mismo tiempo se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza. Tiene dos hijos menores y se separó de su cónyuge a razón de no tener una buena comprensión, sin embargo tiene el apoyo de su hermano quien se dedica al cuidado de sus herramientas de trabajo. A futuro desea que sus hijos se conviertan en profesionales de éxito, es por eso que ella está pensando poner un negocio mas adelante. Requiere de una suma de dinero para invertirlos en el mantenimiento y arreglo de sus herramientas de trabajo, y para mejorar los ambientes de su vivienda con el objetivo de posteriormente alquilar un local para poner su negocio. Apoyemos a esta madre que con esfuerzo y dedicación sigue trabajando arduamente por progresar.

loans.use: Purchase spare parts and cover maintenance of work tools as well as purchase material to improve infrastructure of home.

loans.name: Kelita

texts.es:
Doña Kelita is a 48 year-old single mother of 7 children, who are independent with their own families, and daily she makes a effort to feel useful and to support her beloved daughter who is a single mother and her young granddaughter. For a living she sells fruit and candy and her main clients are employees of a state health center. Due to the demand of her products and her constant effort, she has decided to improve her work space and she is awaiting the response from your generous heart.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Kelita D. 48 años D. edad es madre soltera y tiene 07 hijos los cuales ya se independizaron y poseen sus propias familias, se esfuerza a diario para sentirse útil y para apoyar a su amada hija, que es madre soltera, con su pequeña nieta. Se dedica a la venta D. frutas y dulces y sus principales clientes son los funcionarios D. un centro D. salud estatal. Debido a la demanda D. sus productos y a su esfuerzo constante ha decidido mejorar su espacio D. labor y se encuentra en espera D. la respuesta D. tu bondadoso corazón.

loans.use: Increase capital to enlarge and improve work space.

loans.name: Zelmira

texts.es:
Zelmira owns a motor taxi and runs her own transportation business. She also sells general grocery items in a tourist location near Lake Yarinacocha. She has two young children. She would like to expand her business and make necessary repairs to her motor taxi. She is requesting a loan and with your support she will be able to achieve her goals.

Zelmira, se dedica a la administración de un mototaxi, debido a que es propietaria de una de estas herramientas de transporte, además de dedicarse a la venta de abarrotes en Tushmo (lugar turístico perteneciente al Lago Yarinacocha), tiene dos hijos menores.Tiene muchos deseos de mejorar su espacio de labor y de reparar los desperfectos de su herramienta de movilidad y por esa razón solicita la ayuda de tu bondadoso y noble corazón.

loans.use: TO MAKE REPAIRS TO HER MOTOR TAXI AND CONTINUE TO GROW HER BUSINESS.

loans.name: Rosanita

texts.es:
For a long time Rosanita has been selling various plastic products such as chairs, buckets and storage containers. She is 33 years old and has three small children. She would like to invest in her business and set up a space from which she can sell her products. We can help make it possible for this hardworking mother to achieve her goals.

La señora Rosanita, se dedica a la venta de artículos de plástico (tapers, buyones, sillas entre otras variedades) desde hace mucho tiempo, tiene 33 años y es madre de tres pequeños hijos. Desea incrementar su capital de inversión para pronto establecerse en un espacio cómo y adecuado para sus ventas diarias. Posibilitemos su petición para que pronto esta trabajadora madre haga sus sueños realidad.

loans.use: TO INVEST IN HER BUSINESS AND SET UP A BETTER SPACE FROM WHICH TO SELL HER PLASTIC PRODUCTS.

loans.name: Ines Veronica

texts.es:
Ines Veronica P. is a woman who has worked for many years operating her own general store in her native town of Chinandega.

It is important to highlight that thanks to the support offered from Ceprodel, she has improved her business substantially, adding new display counters and shelves where she can place her products. Now she is again seeking a loan from Ceprodel in order to purchase more merchandise for her business. She has previously repaid two loans from Ceprodel and has stood out for her faithful, on-time payments.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

Ines Veronica P. es una dama que desde hace varios años se dedica a atender su propia pulpería en la ciudad de Chinandega de donde es originaria.

Es de mucha importancia destacar que gracias al apoyo brindado por Ceprodel, ha logrado mejorar las condiciones de su negocio habiendo adquirido vitrinas y nuevos estantes donde colocar sus productos. Hoy en día una vez mas busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito para la compra de mercadería en su negocio. Su record crediticio es de 2 créditos con la institución habiéndose destacado como fiel cliente en su record de pagos.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Martha Del Carmen

texts.es:
In the city of Chinandega in the Bisne market, Mrs. Martha P. works selling various products to her customers: backpacks, underwear, toys, plastic products, etc. She works hard in her store in order to support her family in her humble home.

She is seeking a loan from Ceprodel in order to purchase more merchandise to continue selling in her store. She hopes the loan will be granted so that she can improve her income and continue supporting her family.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

En la ciudad de Chinandega, en el Mercado el Bisne, la señora Martha P. se dedica al negocio de venta de productos generales ofreciendo a sus clientes mochilas, fajas, juguetes, productos plásticos, etc. vendidos esforzadamente con el propósito de mantener su humilde hogar al que tiene que mantener.

Hoy en día ella acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con el crédito necesario que le permita la compra de su mercadería para continuar con su negocio. Espera confiadamente que su crédito será otorgado y de esta manera mejorará sus ingresos en su sector de habitación.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Nidia

texts.es:
Nidia is a mother of three children. Her desire to improve their quality of life motivated her to begin selling sweets and cigarettes around her neighborhood. Thanks to her hard work every day, she is able to contribute to the most urgent needs of her family. She would like to set up a more comfortable and secure space from which to sell her products, so she is requesting a loan. You can help make it possible for her to achieve her goals.

Nidia, es madre de tres hijas, y su deseo por progresar la han conducido a ofertar de manera ambulante dulces y cigarrillos, gracias a su desempeño diario colabora con la manutención y necesidades más urgentes de su hogar.Debido a lo delicado que se ha tornado su labor tiene e deseo de establecerse en un espacio más cómodo y seguro para seguir desarrollando su labor y a esa razón atiende la petición de un préstamo.Vosotros podéis posibilitar su solicitud.

loans.use: TO SET UP A MORE COMFORTABLE AND SECURE PLACE FROM WHICH TO SELL HER PRODUCTS, INSTEAD OF HAVING TO CARRY THEM AROUND THE NEIGHBORHOOD.

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es:
Gilberto is a hard working man who works all day offering breakfast, lunch and dinner to his customers. Thanks to his efforts, he has been able to improve his quality of life, and each day he continues to improve his situation. He would like to invest more in his business and with your support he will be able to reach his goals.

Gilberto, es un hombre muy trabajador y polifacético ya que todo el día oferta diversos alimentos de acuerdo al horario, por las mañanas desayunos, por las tardes almuerzos y por las noches algún bocadillo, gracias a su esfuerzo ha podido mejorar su calidad de vida y día a día se esfuerza por mantener su logro y progresar aún más.Desea mejorar su labor con una inyección de capital y espera la respuesta de tu bondadoso y noble corazón para alcanzar sus metas.

loans.use: TO GROW HIS SMALL RESTAURANT BUSINESS AND CONTINUE TO IMPROVE HIS QUALITY OF LIFE

loans.name: Melvin Leonel

texts.es:
In the city of Chinandega, Mr. Melvin C. works making and selling bread in the bakery that carries his name “C. Bakery.” He has put forth great effort in his business in order to support his children in their studies so they have the chance to become someone in life.

He needs to invest more in raw materials in order to continue making the delicious bread for which he is well-known. This is why he is seeking a loan through Ceprodel in order to purchase the raw materials to continue his humble business. Currently, he has repaid 9 loans on time and in accord with the agreements he has made with the Ceprodel institution.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

En la ciudad de Chinandega, el señor Melvin C. se dedica a su propio negocio de elaboración y venta de pan ofrecido en su panadería el cual lleva el nombre “Panadería C.”. Sus grandes esfuerzos los ha llevado a cabo porque desea mantener los estudios de sus hijos para que lleguen a ser alguien en la vida.

La necesidad que el negocio atraviesa es que requiere invertir en la compra de materia prima para la elaboración del delicioso pan. Es por esta razón que acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con el crédito y de esta manera adquirir la materia prima para continuar con su humilde negocio. Actualmente su record crediticio es de 9 créditos con Ceprodel pagados en tiempo y forma de acuerdo a lo establecido por la institución.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Didi

texts.es:
Didi is 42 years old and the father of three small children. His kids are his inspiration for hard work. Didi owns a motor taxi business. He also works as a mechanic from his small shop when he has time between transporting passengers, or when he has requests. He used to work buying and selling wood before he started this business. He wants to continue to build his new business. He is requesting a loan to expand his shop and make necessary repairs to his motor taxi, so he can continue to grow his income and support his family.

El señor Didi de 42 años de edad, es padre de 03 pequeños, quienes son su inspiración para alcanzar el progreso, es propietario de un mototaxi y se dedica al transporte de pasajeros, también tiene un pequeño taller mecánico en donde en sus ratos libres o cuando le solicitan algún servicio apertura.Anteriormente se dedicaba a la compra y venta de madera. Se caracteriza por ser un padre emprendedor y decidido que quiere seguir creciendo sin embargo requiere de un préstamo para mandar a ampliar su taller y reparar su vehículo para no disminuir las ganancias de su labor tan útiles para su familia.

loans.use: TO MAKE REPAIRS TO HIS MOTOR TAXI AND EXPAND HIS AUTO MECHANIC BUSINESS.

loans.name: Yamileth Del Socorro

texts.es:
In the city of Chinandega, Mrs. Yamileth V. works selling various products in her own small general store; she offers foodstuffs and personal products to her loyal customers.

She is the mother of three children who she supports in their studies; for this simple reason she is seeking a loan from Ceprodel to purchase more merchandise to sell from her store.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

En la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Yamileth V. se dedica al negocio de la venta de productos varios atendiendo su propia pulpería donde ofrece productos comestibles y personales a sus fieles clientes que le visitan

Ella es madre de 3 hijos con la necesidad de mantener sus estudios, es por esta sencilla razón que ella hoy en día busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito necesario para la compra de sus productos y así comercializarlos en su sector de actividad.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Lucía

texts.es:
Lucia has a business selling cold drinks in a busy area where many people of her community pass by. She began this business a short time ago, because she wanted to help her dear son achieve his dreams. With the great demand from her customers, she would like to invest in her business and offer a greater variety of beverages, generating more income and growing her business.

Lucía, se dedica a la venta de bebidas heladas en una zona muy concurrida y visitada por los miembros de su comunidad, su incursión en este rubro comercial se dio hace poco tiempo debido al deseo de contribuir con el cumplimiento de los sueños de su amado hijo.Debido a la gran demanda a decidido incrementar su capital de trabajo a fin de ofertar más y mayor variedad de bebidas a sus clientes.

loans.use: TO INVEST IN HER SMALL BUSINESS AND OFFER MORE COLD BEVERAGES TO HER CUSTOMERS, GROW HER BUSINESS AND HELP HER SON.

loans.name: Jaiser

texts.es:
Jaiser is 32 years old and single. He lives with his beloved mother who he supports a lot because she is ill. He learned to cook empirically and he is now happy because he provides services to various restaurants who are familiar with his great work. At the same time he also sells articles clothing. His dream is to have his own restaurant in order to delight thousands of diners with his excellent dishes.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Jaiser, de 32 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, vive en compañía de su amada mamá, a quien apoya mucho ya que se encuentra mal de salud; él aprendió el arte culinario empíricamente y ahora se siente feliz por que brinda sus servicios a distintos restaurantes que saben de su buen trabajo, pero a la vez también se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir. Su deseo es implementar su propio restaurante para deleitar a miles de comensales con sus excelentes platillos.

loans.use: Increase capital to run his own restaurant.

loans.name: Lizbeth

texts.es:
As many of her acquaintances know, Lizbeth sells plastic products (chairs, jars, clothes hangers, etc.) for the benefit of everyone and also works with articles of clothing and other products. She works very hard towards her only goal, which is to help her 2 children to get ahead and then expand her business so that she can have her own store in the future. Lizbeth is 27 years old and is a single mother. This great responsibility for her children is reason enough to improve her business. She wants to get ahead in her business selling plastics products and has already found a good place to have a store which, without any doubt, she wants to rent. For this reason she needs a loan. Let us support this young mother who has demonstrated her desire to improve her situation.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Lizbeth, como muchos la conocen, vende productos de plásticos (sillas, jarras, porta ropas, etc.) a gusto de todas las personas, y complementa su labor con prendas de vestir y otros productos. Ella trabaja muy duro con la sola intención de sacar adelante a sus 02 hijos y desde luego crecer con su negocio para adquirir más adelante su propia tienda. Lizbeth de 27 años de edad es madre soltera, y esta responsabilidad tan grande con sus pequeños, es razón suficiente para progresar. Ella quiere salir adelante en su negocio de venta de plásticos y hasta incluso ya vio un local apropiado para su negocio y sin lugar a duda lo alquilará. Pero para esto requiere de un préstamo. Apoyemos a esta joven madre que muestra sus ganas de superación.

loans.use: Inject capital to increase the products she offers.

loans.name: Grisella

texts.es:
Grissella is 34-years-old and the mother of 4 children who are students and are the biggest inspiration for her progress. She sells food and has entered this business to help support her family, and her beloved husband, Jesus Augustus, who supports her in all of her decisions and certainly agrees that she belong to a community bank. Grissella wants to expand her business to provide better service to her customers and is seeking a loan to reach this goal. With your help, the objective of this working mother is possible.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Grissella 34 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de comida, es madre de 04 hijos que están estudiando y desde luego son su mayor inspiración de progreso. Ella se encaminó en este negocio para ayudar con el sustento de su familia, su amado esposo, Jesús Augusto, la apoya en todas sus decisiones y desde luego está de acuerdo que pertenezca a un banco comunal. Grissella quiere mandar a ampliar su negocio para brindar una mejor acogida a sus clientes, para ello estima de un préstamo para llegar a cumplir su meta. Con tu ayuda has posible el objetivo de esta madre trabajadora.

loans.use: To expand her space to provide better service to her customers.

loans.name: Lira

texts.es:
Lira, a 55-year-old mother of 3 children, has sold homemade breads for many years along with the help of her beloved husband, Mariano. She rises early to prepare her breads and travels to sell them in the various areas of Yarinacocha and in the outskirts of the city of Pucallpa. Ms. Lira and her husband work very diligently with the sole desire to provide their children with a happy life. Lira's objective is to grow her business more and eventually open her own bakery. Therefore, she requires a capital to achieve this goal. With your help, Lira will achieve her objective in a short time.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Lira, de 55 años de edad, es madre de 03 hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de panes caseros desde hace mucho tiempo con ayuda de su amado esposo, Mariano. Se levanta muy temprano a preparar este aperitivo para ofertarlo de manera ambulante por los diferentes lugares de Yarinacocha, y del mismo modo por los alrededores de la ciudad de Pucallpa.
