La señora Lira junto a su esposo trabajan con mucho esmero con el único deseo de otorgarles felicidad a sus hijos.Lira tiene un objetivo crecer más en su negocio y con el tiempo poner su propia panadería, y por eso requiere de un capital para cumplir con su propósito. Con tu ayuda la señora Lira logrará su objetivo en corto tiempo.

loans.use: To grow her business selling homemade bread and eventually open a bakery.

loans.name: Jeny

texts.es:
Jeny, a 46-year-old mother of two small children, prepares and sells exquisite dishes alongside her beloved husband. Her efforts and perseverance have enabled her to improve and rely on captive customers. Now, her immediate wish is to improve her work space to better attend to her customers. We hope her loan request will soon become a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

Jeny, madre de 46 años de edad, es madre de dos pequeños niños y en compañía de su amado esposo se dedica a la preparación y venta de exquisitos platillos. Su esfuerzo y constancia le ha permitido mejorar y contar con clientes cautivos, ahora su deseo inmediato es mejorar su espacio de labor para brindar una mejor atención.Posibilitemos su petición para que pronto su anhelo puedo hacerse realidad.

loans.use: To improve the area where she prepares and sells her dishes.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Doña Maria Isabel has its small business of selling spare parts and lubricants for cars. She is responsible for managing and attending to her business. She is 36 years old and a mother of three children. She is eager to expand and equip her work space in order to improve the economica situation of her beloved family. For this reason, she is requesting a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Maria Isabel, tiene su pequeño negocio de venta de repuestos y lubricantes para autos, ella es la encargada de administrar y atender su negocio. Tiene 36 años de edad y es madre de tres hijos. Tiene muchos deseos de ampliar e implementar su espacio de labor para obtener mayores beneficios económicos para su amada familia y a esa razón atiende su petición de un préstamo.

loans.use: To expand and equip her daily work space.

loans.name: Nora

texts.es:
Nora Luz runs a store selling frozen drinks. She is 40 years old and began the business many years ago, continuously inspired by her four children to work hard. Nora Luz would like to get ahead, and hopes that her business will become a well-known establishment with a large customer base. In order to achieve this, Nora Luz needs the capital that will help her to quickly achieve her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

Nora Luz, tiene un negocio de venta de bebidas heladas se ha encaminado en esta actividad hace tiempos atrás y le va muy bien, tiene 40 años de edad, es madre de 04 hijos los cuales la inspiran a seguir adelante.La señora, Nora Luz, quiere surgir y salir adelante y con el tiempo espera que su negocio se convierta en un lugar conocido y de mucha concurrencia, para lograr este propósito necesariamente requiere de un capital que le ayudará a alcanzar su objetivo en corto tiempo.

loans.use: Injection of capital to improve her work space.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Every day Maribel prepares and sells food to her clients. She prepares tamales and juanes. Thanks to the superior service she provides and jovial nature has gained steady clientele that demand nothing but the best. Maribel fulfills her commitment and prepares each tamale and juan to perfection.

Maribel is 42 years old, and due to divorce, is single. Maribel would like to expand and redecorate her service area in order to create a more welcoming space for her clientele. She will need capital in order to do so. Your help will make it possible for this woman to realize her dream.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

La labor que tiene todos los días es la venta de comida(Juanes y Tamales) y gracias a su buena atención y jovialidad Maribel cuenta con una clientela exigente y detallista, y por esa razón prepara sus juanes y tamales todo en su punto. Ella a sus 42 años de edad es soltera e independiente, a razón de su divorcio.Desea ampliar y desde luego ambientar y mejorar sus instalaciones para una mejor acogida de sus clientes, sin embargo ella para realizar lo que desea requiere de un capital. Con tu ayuda harás posible el propósito de esta trabajadora mujer.

loans.use: Injection of capital in order to expand and redo the serving room.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther is 58 years old and the mother of two small children. Out of her home, Esther prepares and sells meals to the locals. Her home is in a very well trafficked region of the city.

Esther’s customers have provided her with a certain level of fame, and every day more and more people pass by to visit her small restaurant. Esther has decided to settle expand her location to better receive her clients and to provide them with a comfortable space.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Esther de 58 años de edad, es madre de dos pequeños niños y se dedica a preparar y a comercializar platillos típicos de su región en una zona muy concurrida de su localidad. Sus visitantes le han dado fama y día a día más personas concurren a visitarla por ese motivo desea implementar su espacio de labor a fin de recibir a sus clientes en un espacio adecuado y con mayores comodidades.

loans.use: Injection of capital in order to expand her restaurant.

loans.name: Yrene Del Pilar

texts.en:
Yrene belongs to the María Milagrosa Village Bank and lives in Villa María del Triunfo in Lima with her husband. She has 3 children, 27, 29 and 31 years old who are married and who have children as well.

Yrene has a microenterprise of materials for furniture, chair and bench tapestries. Until last year, her husband was managing the business because she dedicated herself to selling cakes. But from this year, she’s in charge of the entire business.

Yrene is soliciting a 3 000 soles loan so as to purchase tapestry materials such as leather, foam rubber, cotton, and cloth to stock in her store.

Her microenterprise has helped her for her sons’ education and also helped her son-in-law to buy a car, given that he had had the car he was using as a taxi stolen.

Now, Yrene wants to help her grandchildren, she has lots of plans in mind, one of them is to purchase a car to make her grandchild work, it’s a great challenge but she is sure he’ll succeed.

loans.use: Yrene is asking for a 3 000 soles loan so as to purchase tapestry materials such as leather, foam rubber, cotton, and cloth to stock in her store.

loans.name: Sixta

texts.en:
Sixta belongs to the María Milagrosa Village Bank and lives in Villa María del Triunfo in Lima with her common law husband.

She has 2 children, 28 and 26 years old, and a little 9-year-old daughter who’s still in school. She also has a little grandson.
She dedicates herself, with her elder daughter, to her microenterprise, a restaurant in which she sells menus and à la carte meals. This business helped her to live and to educate her children. She has improved and decorated it little by little.

Sixta is soliciting an 800 soles loan to purchase fizzy drinks, sugar, and rice, which she usually purchases wholesale for her restaurant.

Sixta wants to grow her business, she’s planning to set up a poulterer’s. She can always rely on her family support, her son-in-law sells chicken but she lacks an oven, which she will strengthen with the next loan.

loans.use: Sixta is soliciting an 800 soles loan to purchase fizzy drinks, sugar, and rice, which she usually purchases wholesale for her restaurant.

loans.name: Magda

texts.en:
Magda belongs to the María Milagrosa Village Bank and lives in Villa María del Triunfo, Lima. She is married and has a 14-year-old daughter who is studying in high school. 

She started working in a kiosk selling magazines and newspapers. She sold sweets and she gradually grew and could buy the kiosk where she was employed before. Now she has her own business.

Magda is soliciting a 400 soles loan so as to implement her business to sell phonecards, reviews, newspapers and supply more sweets to increase her sales.

Magda has a lot of plans in mind for the future, like setting up another kiosk, that will help for her daughter’s professional future.

loans.use: Magda is soliciting a 400 soles loan so as to implement her business to sell phonecards, reviews, newspapers and supply more sweets to increase her sales.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.en:
Carmen Rosa belongs to the María Milagrosa Village Bank and lives in Villa María del Triunfo in Lima.

Carmen lives with her husband and has a 9-year-old daughter. She started bringing lunches and menus to her husband’s work but this job was temporary because she didn’t have enough capital to make it every day. She has been owning her restaurant in her father’s house for 6 months, selling not only menus but also ice cream and fizzy drinks. She wants to grow her business and be prepared for this.

That’s why she aims to study, to set up a poulterer’s and to build the second floor of her house.

Carmen Rosa is soliciting a 400 soles loan so that she can purchase supplies such as rice, sugar, and oil, ingredients she uses every day.

loans.use: Carmen Rosa is soliciting a 400 soles loan so that she can purchase supplies such as rice, sugar, and oil, ingredients she uses every day.

loans.name: Dewa Ayu Rai Arti

texts.id:
Dewa Ayu Rai Arto is a housewife that also operates a small kiosk at her home. To supplement her income, Dewa Ayu Rai tried to farm pigs with financial and technical help from DINARI. She bought one breeding pig and feeds with her first loan. That pig gave birth to 10 piglets in 6 months. She sold those 10 piglets for $27 total. Dewa Ayu RAi earned $44 more than she used to. So she decided to seek second loan from DINARI. This second loan will be used to purchase another breeder pig., so her farm will produce more piglets that she can sell. With training and guidance from DINARI, Dewa Ayu Rai hopes to earn higher income than before.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Dewa Ayu Rai Arti adalah seorang Ibu rumah tangga yang sehari-hari berjualan di warung miliknya di rumah. Untuk menambah penghasilan warungnya Dewa Ayu Rai mencoba beternak babi dengan meminjam ke DINARI. Dari pinjaman periode pertama dibelikannya seekor induk babi beserta pakannya kemudian dipelihara selama 6 bulan dan melahirkan 10 ekor anak babi. Setelah penjualan 10 anak babi tersebut dimana per ekor laku dijual sebesar Rp.250.000,- Dewa Ayu Rai memperoleh peningkatan pendapatan sebesar Rp. 400.000,-. Sehingga Dewa Ayu Rai memutuskan untuk melanjutkan pinjaman ke DINARI untuk periode kedua dengan jumlah pinjaman yang sama. Pinjaman kedua ini nantinya akan dibelikan seekor induk babi lagi sehingga akan terjadi penambahan jumlah anak babi yang dilahirkan. Dengan bimbingan dan pelatihan dari DINARI nantinya Dewa Ayu Rai berharap akan mendapatkan hasil yang lebih tinggi lagi dari sebelumnya.

loans.use: Purchase feeds and breeding pig

loans.name: Fernando Rafael

texts.en:
Fernando belongs to the María Milagrosa Village Bank and lives in Villa María del Triunfo in Lima.
He lives with his wife and has 2 children; the elder is 18 and is at university and the youngest is 10 and still in school.

Fernando began his business 15 years ago selling iced drinks, then he was selling hamburgers at his house door, as well as french fries and hot dogs and now he owns a poulterer’s in his house. He has been improving his business after a great deal of effort. He purchased appliances and the loan requests taught him to be responsible for his payments.

Fernando is soliciting a 1000 soles loan to extend his business and sell not only braised chicken but also Chinese food.

Fernando wants his children to finish their academic studies. He also wants to have another chicken restaurant. He told us that once, they were slightly injured in a road accident but he coped and now he knows that it’s always useful to have a financial backing.

loans.use: Fernando is soliciting a 1000 soles loan to extend his business and sell not only braised chicken but also Chinese food.

loans.name: Luz María

texts.en:
Luz María belongs to the María Milagrosa Village Bank and lives in Villa María del Triunfo in Lima. She lives with her husband and has 4 children, 2 of them still in school.

She started her business 4 years ago selling sandwiches and braised chicken. This business is profitable during weekends. Since last year, she began selling pullovers hand-sewn. It helped her a lot because it’s a support for investment in her business and to better her quality of life.

Luz María is asking for a 400 soles loan that she plans to invest in her 2 microenterprises for the purchase of supplies for her sandwiches and wool to weave pullovers.

Luz María wants to purchase machines to implement a pullover workshop and thus enable her children to go to college. Because in the sandwich sector located in her living area, there is much competition, that’s why she relies on the pullover selling.

loans.use: Luz María is asking for a 400 soles loan that she plans to invest in her 2 microenterprises for the purchase of supplies for her sandwiches and wool to weave pullovers.

loans.name: Ni Nyoman Bakti

texts.id:
Ni Nyoman Bakti works in her parents' field. However the production is not enough to fulfill her family's daily needs. Her husband works as a furniture maker. However he has not been making much money due to the downturn in business. This motivated Nyoman to start a pig farm with DINARI's help. This loan was used ti purchase a piglet and feeds. With DINARI's financial and technical help, Nyoman earned $260 after 6 months breeding to slaughter cycle. With this result, Nyoman Bakti decided to seek second loan from DINARI. This second loan will be used to purchase more piglets and feeds than before. Nyoman hopes to reap more profit and help her family's finances more.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Bertani di kebun orang tuanya merupakan kesehari-harian Ni Nyoman Bakti. Tetapi dari hasil kebun tersebut tidak mencukupi kebutuhan keluarganya. Suaminya yang berprofesi sebagai tukang meubel juga tidak terlalu banyak membantu penghasilan keluarga karena sepinya order dan sulitnya mencari bahan baku meubel. Selanjutnya Nyoman berusaha beternak babi dengan meminjam ke DINARI. Pinjaman tersebut kemudian dibelikan bibit babi dan pakannya untuk digemukkan. Dengan pendampingan dari DINARI, Nyoman berhasil memperoleh keuntungan sebesar Rp. 2.400.000,- selama 6 bulan masa pemeliharaan. Dengan hasil yang terlihat memuaskan tersebut, Nyoman Bakti memutuskan untuk kembali bekerja sama dengan DINARI untuk mendapatkan pinjaman kedua. Dari pinjaman kedua ini nantinya akan dibelikan bibit dan pakan babi yang lebih banyak dari pembelian dengan pinjaman pertama. Sehingga Nyoman berharap akan memperoleh keuntungan yang lebih baik lagi sehingga mampu mendongkrak perekonomian keluarganya.

loans.use: Purchase Piglets and Feeds

loans.name: Ni Luh Nuriani

texts.id:
Ni Luh Nuriani started to farm pigs because of the ever increasing cost of living. She did this to help her husband who works as a construction worker. At this time, construction business is pretty quiet. Additionally she has to afford tuition fees for her two children that are in grade school. She joined DINARI and sought funding and technical help to start her pig farm. She used her first DINARI loan to purchase 1 breeder pig and 2 slaughter piglets that she raised for 6 months. After feeds and breeding cost she earned $130 profit. This experience motivated Ni Luh Nuriani to seek second loan from DINARI. THis loan will be used to purchased more breeding piglets and feeds. Ni Luh Nuriani hopes that she will earn more profit from this cycle to help her family's financial condition.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Karena kebutuhan keluarga yang makin lama semakin tinggi akhirnya Ni Luh Nuriani memutuskan untuk beternak babi. Hal ini dilakukannya untuk membantu suaminya yang bekerja sebagai tukang bangunan yang sekarang ini lagi sepi order untuk membangun. Selain itu dorongan untuk mencukupi kebutuhan kedua anaknya yang masih duduk di bangku sekolah juga membakar semangat Ni Luh Nuriani untuk memberanikan diri meminjam ke DINARI untuk mengikuti program menambah pendapatan keluarga melalui beternak babi Dari pinjaman pertama Ni Luh Nuriani mempunyai 1 ekor induk babi dan 2 ekor bibit penggemukan yang dipelihara selama 6 bulan. Setelah dipotong harga pakan, penjualan bibit dan babi penggemukan miliknya memperoleh keuntungan mencapai Rp.1.200.000,-. Hal inilah yang mendorong Ni Luh Nuriani untuk melanjutkan pinjamannya ke DINARI pada periode kedua. Dari pinjaman kedua ini nantinya akan dibelikan pakan dan bibit babi lagi. Besar harapan Ni Luh Nuriani untuk mendapatkan keuntungan yang melebihi keuntungan pinjaman pertama sehingga meringankan beban ekonomi keluarga.

loans.use: Purhchase Piglets and Feeds

loans.name: Ni Komang Wasiantini

texts.id:
As a wife of a farmer, Ni Komang Wasiantini is expected to work to supplement her family's income. The seasonal nature her husband's income motivates her more in working her farm, consisting of a small plantation and pig pens. Komang earns decent profit from her pig farm that can be used to supplement her family's income. However, increasing price of feeds makes it difficult for her to breed and farm more pigs. Therefore she decided to apply for a loan from DINARI to purchase feeds and more piglets. With the help of 6 month loan, Komang earned additional $110 profit. After that result, Komang decided to apply for second loan from DINARI. This loan is going to be used to purchase more feeds. Komang expects that this loan would help her just like the first loan. The increased profit from her farm will be used to help her family's finances.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Sebagai istri dari suami yang berprofesi sebagai seorang petani sudah seharusnyalah Ni Komang Wasiantini membantu suami dalam menambah jumlah pendapatan keluarga. Penghasilan suami yang tergantung dari musiman membuat ia harus lebih tekun dalam mengelola kebun dan lebih giat dalam beternak babi yang juga digelutinya. Keuntungan dari beternak babi yang diperoleh Komang lumayan untuk menambah pendapatan keluarganya. Tetapi dengan tingginya harga pakan babi membuat Komang kesulitan mngembangkan ternak babinya. Oleh karena itu Komang memutuskan untuk ikut program DINARI dengan meminjam dana yang digunakan untuk membeli bibit dan pakan babi. Dari pinjaman selama 6 bulan tersebut Komang mendapatkan keuntungan sebesar Rp. 1000.000,-. Melihat hasil itu Komang melanjutkan pinjaman dengan DINARI ke periode kedua. Pinjaman ini akan digunakan untuk membeli bibit lebih banyak disamping juga membeli pakan babi. Komang mengharapkan hasil yang lebih besar akan didapatkannya dari pinjaman periode kedua ini sehingga meningkatkan perekonomian keluarganya.

loans.use: Purchase Piglets and Feeds

loans.name: Ni Made Kerti

texts.id:
Ni Made Kerti has been married to I Made Media for 35 years. Her husband is a carpenter / wood statue makers for local temples. However he is making less money than he used to, worsening their family's financial condition. This situation decided to start a pig farm with financial support from DINARI foundation. Made Kerti used her first loan from DINARI to purchase 2 piglets that were sold 6 months later when they matured for $70 profit. Currently Ni Made Kerti is seeking second loan from DINARI to purchase more piglets so she can farm more pigs and increase the profit making potential of her farm. Hopefully the income from the farm can improve her family's financial condition.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Ni Made Kerti telah hidup bersama dengan suaminya I Made Madia selama 35 tahun. Penghasilan suaminya sebagai seorang pemahat kayu untuk tempat persembahyangan semakin hari semakin merosot membuat perekonomian keluarga Ni Made Kerti pas-pasan. Oleh karena itu Made Kerti memutuskan untuk memelihara babi yang didukung oleh program DINARI dengan cara peminjaman modal. Dengan pinjaman pertama yang diperoleh Made Kerti untuk pembelian 2 ekor bibit babi penggemukan yang kemudian dijual setelah 6 bulan Made Kerti meraup keuntungan sebesar Rp.600.000,- Dari situ Made Kerti kembali melakukan pinjaman periode kedua ke DINARI untuk menambah bibit babi peliharaannya sehingga keuntungan yang diperoleh pun akan bertambah. Dan hal ini tentunya akan meningkatkan penghasilan keluarganya.

loans.use: Purchase Piglets and Increase Number of Farmed Pigs

loans.name: Abduvahob

texts.en:
Abduvahob S. is 44 years old, and with his wife they have raised four children. Abduvahob is a farmer, and a strong physical and spiritual man. Each day he works diligently to make sure that he takes good care of his crop. Not one minute goes by that he is not attentive to his crop. He plows the land to the best of his abilities.

Thanks to his energy and high spirit, he has been able to support his family for 15 years and to offer them an education as well. With his job, he has been able to pay for the schooling of his three children, and this motivates him even more to keep working the land. He is a great role model to his children due to his discipline and diligence, which are good values for his children to learn and to help them throughout life. Abduvahob sows potatoes, corn, carrots, and tomatoes, which he then sells at the local market.

Now that the business is stable, Abduvahob believes that it will be the main income for him in the future as his dearest children are growing up and the expenses are rising.

Abduvahob is requesting a loan of US$850, which he plans to use to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer. Abduvahob thanks everyone who trusts him and supports him today, and he promises to repay the loan in a timely manner. You can be an important part of the growth of Abduvahob’s business.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Kuchkor

texts.en:
Kuchkor T. is 45 years old, and is married with 4 children. He loves his children very much and is doing his best to make them happy and give them a good education. Kuchkor runs a farm, and has worked in agriculture for twenty-seven years. In that time he has gained a lot of experience and a love for the land. Kuchkor is a strong physical and spiritual man and each day he works diligently to make sure that he takes good care of his crop. His wife and daughter help him with the business.

Kuchkor sows potatoes, cucumbers, carrots, and tomatoes, which he then sells at the local market. The business is stable and generates the main source of income for the family. However, this business also requires lots of effort. Now that the business is stable, Abduvahob believes that it will be the main income for him in the future as his dearest children are growing up and the expenses are rising. Thus, Kuchkor needs to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer, and he is requesting a loan of US$500. Kuchkor thanks all for supporting him and he promises to be accurate when repaying the loan.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Mohchehra

texts.en:
Mohchehra is 43 years old, is married and the loving mother of 4 children of school age. She is doing her best to ensure that her children have the best future and a good education. Mohchehra’s husband is currently unemployed, thus Mohchehra's business is the main source of income for her family.

Together with her elder son, who is pictured in the photo, she started her business of selling white salt 5 years ago. She rents a stall in an open air market of Istaravshan, and purchases the white salt wholesale from her suppliers. As time went by, she expanded her business and it now generates a stable income for the family. However, Mohchehra’s children are growing up and the expenses are growing.

Mohchehra dreams of her children being well-educated, but in order to do that Mohchehra is planning to expand her business. With this purpose in mind, she is requesting US$900 to increase stock. Your support will really help this dedicated mother to achieve her dreams.

loans.use: To increase stock of white salt.

loans.name: Guljahon

texts.en:
Guljahon Y. is 38 years old, has been married for about 15 years and has three children. Her husband is currently unemployed and that’s why her business is the main source of income for her family. Guljahon has been running her business for twelve years already. She sells fabric for traditional dresses, and her husband helps her with the business.

The traditional dresses in Tajikistan are very popular and a very important item of the dowry for any girl. Guljahon has a trading place at the central local market of the city of Istaravshan. All of the fabrics are supplied from the neighboring country China. Guljahon is trying to have a wide range of goods, and thus be able to meet the requirements of her customers and their different levels of income.

As with all mothers, Guljahon is doing her best for her children to be well-educated and happy. Today, Guljahon is requesting US$600 to purchase new fabrics for the summer season. Guljahon is counting on your help, and you can be an important part of the growth of Guljahon’s business.

loans.use: To purchase new fabric and increase the range of goods.

loans.name: Seang

texts.en:
Miss. Seang S. , 60, is single and lives with her daughter (shown in the picture on the left), Mrs. Ty S., 41, who lives along National Road number two about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. Mrs. Ty and her husband were married in 1988 and have two sons, who are in school. Thy has been a garment worker since 1990, while her husband is a mason.

Miss. Seang has been in the farming business since 1980. She grows rice and vegetables such as: morning glory, bean, cucumber, and tomatoes. She sells her produces at Ta Khmao market.
Now Seang is requesting a loan of US$1200 to purchase one motorcycle for her nephews drive to school and to buy one pumping machine to use in her farming business.

loans.use: To purchase one motorcycle and one pumping machine

loans.name: Thoeun

texts.en:
Mr. Thoeun, 48, and his wife, Mrs. Phy Neang, 47, who live along National Road number two about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1989 and have five children, three sons and two daughters. Two of their children are garment factory workers and other three are in school.

Mr. Thoeun has been working on a crocodile farm for five years, while Mrs. Phy stays at home take care of their children. His house is on lower ground than his neighbour’s houses and this means that it floods during the rainy season.  So, Thoeun has requested a loan of US$300 to fill up the ground around his house.

loans.use: Thoeun would like to fill up the ground around his house

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Mr. Sim S., 58, and his wife, Mrs. Ret San, 54, who live along National Road number two about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1971 and have four children: three sons and one daughter. Two of their children are married and live outside the family home. One of the remaining works in a garment factory and the other is in a local school. 

Mr. Sim has been a motor remoque taxi driver since 1982. Remoque is a motorcycle which has a trailer at the back. His wife stays at home to take of their children. Currently, Sim is in the process of creating another business: he wants to rent musical intstruments to his fellow villagers.  He has requested this loan of US$500 to purchase musical instruments to rent.

loans.use: To purchase musical instruments to rent out to villagers.

loans.name: Sothy

texts.en:
Mrs. Sothy S., 34, and her husband, Mr. Teav Ny who live across Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh, were been married in 2004 and have one son (shown in the picture). 
Mrs. Sothy and her husband have been selling grocery items for two years. They buy the grocery items from a market in Phnom Penh for resale at her shop in front of the house. Besides the grocery store, the couple also sells food in the evening, as well as raising cows.
Now Sothy is requesting a loan of US$1000 to purchase grocery items for resale and to buy more cows for raising.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for resale and buy cows for raising.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Mrs. Pov M., 58, and her husband, Mr. Vanthorn Nai, 57, who live along National Road number two about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1982 and have one son, who is a taxi driver.

Mrs. Pov has been selling blankets, mosquito nets, and scarves for just over one year. She buys them from markets in Phnom Penh for resale in her village. Her husband, Mr. Vanthorn is a mason. 
Mrs. Pov is requesting a loan of US$300 to purchase more blankets, mosquito nets, and scarves for resale.

loans.use: To purchase blankets, mosquito nets, and scarves for resale

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.en:
Sharofat Z. is a 62 year old woman, who is a widow and has 4 children. Thanks to her work, she has supported her 4 dear children and their home, and now all of her children are independent. Sharofat is a farmer, and she plants crops like wheat, potato, carrot and other vegetables on her land. She also raises cattle, which she buys as calves at the market for a low price. She then feeds and raises them to then resell at the same market for a more profitable price. Her younger son helps her with the business. As a rule, Sharofat and her son grow enough crops for the family's consumption and also for selling.

By applying to IMON for a loan, Sharofat hopes to produce a rich yield that she will sell at the market at prices attractive to the population. She is requesting US$850, and she plans to purchase fertilizer and create better conditions for the cattle. This woman has a lot of courage and the strength to live.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, and maintain the cattle.

loans.name: Simean

texts.en:
Mrs. Simean T., 35, is divorcee, who lives along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. She has two children; one son and one daughter . Both of them are in local school. 

Mrs. Simean has been farming since she was fifteen years old. She grows many kinds of vegetables in her farm. Now she has created another business selling fruit. She buys the fruit from the village and resells it at a market in Phnom Penh. She is requesting a loan for the amount of $300 to purchase fruit for resale.

loans.use: To purchase fruit for resale

loans.name: Channa

texts.en:
Mrs. Channa E., 35, and her husband, Mr. Chhorn Cheng, 40, who live on an Island of Mekong River about fifteen kilometres from Phnom Penh, were married in 1988 and have four children, three sons and one daughter. Three of their children are in school and the youngest one stays at home.

Mrs. Channa has been a silk weaver for twenty years, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the village trader, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh.  Mr. Chhorn has been a construction worker since 1993. Mrs. Channa is requesting a loan of US$500 to purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Bushra Mumtaz Ahmad's Group

texts.en:
Bushra baji, wife of M. A., has lived in the city of Kasur, Pakistan for the past thirteen years. She is the mother of two sons - Qamar, who is thirteen years old and reads in the sixth standard, and Faisal, age ten, who reads in the fourth standard. Her husband is a trader by profession, and buys and sells wheat. Bushra baji is applying for a loan for her husband's business to increase his income and improve the financial condition of the household.

Bushra baji's loan group has four other women as members. They are Saima baji, Zahida baji, Sumera baji and Safia baji. Zahida baji wants the loan to repair her auto-rickshaw. Sumera baji needs funds to expand her thread business and Safia baji will use the loan to expand her candy business.

This is a group loan and the funds will be distributed among the members. They mutually guarantee one another's loans and if one member does not repay, the others are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Asasah, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Razia Ghulam Abba's Group

texts.en:
Razia baji has lived in the city of Kasur, Pakistan for the past fifteen years. She has a three room brick house and is the mother of five sons. Her husband, G. A., is a cook and runs his own small shop with the famous name, G. A. Hotel. Her eldest two sons run a grocery shop and her third son reads in the second standard. Razia baji makes embroidered dresses and will use the loan to diversify her embroidery business.

Razia baji's group has three other women as members. Sakina baji will use the funds for her grocery shop. Arshad baji and Hamidan baji each have a vegetable business and will invest in them.

This is a group loan. The funds will be distributed among the members and each will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans and if one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Asasah, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Rizwana M.yunas Group

texts.en:
Rizwana baji is the wife of M. and has lived in the city of Kasur, Pakistan for the past fifteen years. She has a two room brick house and is the mother of four children: two sons and two daughters. All of her children are enrolled in a local school. Rizwana baji is a housewife and prefers to run her household. Her husband is a land contractor and she is applying for the loan on his behalf.

She has been joined in her loan group by four other women, each with her own business. Jhagan baji wants the loan for her fruit business. Suraiya baji will use the loan for her corner drink enterprise. Shahnaz baji will expand her sweetmeat business and Nasreen baji will improve her vegetable business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members and each will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans and if one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To improve and expand their businesses

loans.name: Zareena M.nawaz Group

texts.en:
Zareena baji is the wife of M. and has lived in the city of Kasur, Pakistan for the last 25 years. She is 4 years younger than her husband and the mother of five children: three sons and two daughters. She has a two room brick house. Her husband is famous for his samosas, the well known Punjabi food. Zareena baji is applying for a loan to expand her husband’s business.

There are five other women who are members of the loan group. Suraiya baji wants the loan to improve her food business. Shahnaz baji wants to buy a horse cart and Uzma baji wants to expand her oil business. Kosar baji will expand her sewing machine business and Shamim baji wants to repair her auto-rickshaw.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members and each woman will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans and if one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand and improve their businesses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase clothing in bulk for re-sale in a local community

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothing wholesale for re-sale in a small, well-established shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more inventory for a small clothing shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more inventory for a shop selling shoes an underwear

loans.name: Adil

texts.en: Adil B. is 53 years old and earns income running a food store. He lives in the Imishli region and started his business in 1990. Adil is married and has two sons. To improve his business, he would like to purchase a refrigerator and beverages that sell particularly well in the extremely hot summer season in southern Azerbaijan. Therefore, Adil is asking for a loan of US$1,200.

loans.use: Purchase of beverages and a refregerator

loans.name: Sumera M.afzal's Group

texts.en:
Sumera is the wife of M. and lives in the city of Pak Pattan, Pakistan. She has been married for the last 6 years and is the mother of one son named Junaid. Her husband is a sweetmaker and has been in this profession for the last 12 years. Her daily income is $4 to $5. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah, a microfinance institute in Pakistan. Now she is applying for a loan for her husband so that he can expand his business.

She has been joined in her loan group by three other women with businesses. Naseem baji wants the loan for her wheat business. Bushra baji wants lthe funds to expand her grocery shop and Zuhran baji will use the finances to expand her wall clock shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members and each will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans and if one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Vasif

texts.en: Vasif N. is 24 years old and earns income selling women's clothes in the center bazaar of Imishli region. He started his business in 2002 and, since then, has gained respect among local women because of his knowledge of the clients' needs, as well as the discounts that he often offers. Clothes in Vasif's store sell so quickly that sometimes he has to temporarily close it, because there is nothing left to sell. Vasif's income is just enough to cover his family's needs, but not enough  to expand his business. Therefore, Vasif is asking for a loan of US$1,000 which he will use to purchase additional clothes.

loans.use: Purchase of clothes for sale

loans.name: Khursheed M.rafiz's Group

texts.en:
Khursheed baji is the wife of M. and has been married for the last 40 years. She is the mother of nine children: three sons and six daughters. She is a sweeper in a school and her husband is a fruit seller. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah, a microfinance institute in Pakistan. She bought fruits for her husband’s fruit selling business and is applying again for funds for the same business.

Khursheed baji has been joined in her group by three other women. Nazia baji wants this loan to expand her welding business and Hamidan baji needs funds to expand her scrap work. Abida baji will use the loan for her garment business.

This is a group loan and the funds will be distributed among the group members and each will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans and if one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand and improve their businesses

loans.name: Shazia M.riaz's Group

texts.en:
Shazia is the wife of M.. She has been married for the last 6 years and is a mother of one son. She successfully completed her first loan from Asasah a microfinance institute in Pakistan. Her husband has a pesticide business and she is applying for a loan to improve his business.

She has been joined in her loan group by three other women. One member is Naseem baji who wants the loan to expand her bakery business. The other members, Sajida baji and Rani baji, will use the funds to expand their fruit business and grocery shop, respectively.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members and each will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans and if one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Nazia Ghulam Farid's Group

texts.en:
Nazia baji is the wife of G. F.. She lives in a city named Pakpattan, Pakistan. She has been married for the last 3 years, is a housewife and prefers to run the household. Her husband has a grocery shop and she is applying for a loan to improve his grocery enterprise.

Nazia baji has been joined in her loan group by two other women. One is Irshad baji who wants the loan to expand her vegetable business. The other is Rani baji and she will use the funds to expand her milk business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members and each will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans and if one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To improve their financial conditions

loans.name: Zulaikhan M.shan's Group

texts.en:
Zulaikhan baji, who is the wife of M., lives in the city of Pakpattan, Pakistan. She has been married for the last 15 years and is the mother of four children. Zulaikhan baji is a housewife and prefers to run the household. Her husband makes iron trunks and buckets and sells them in various places. She successfully completed her first loan from Asasah a microfinance institute in Pakistan. Now she is applying for a loan to improve her husband’s business.

She has been joined in her loan group by three other women. Nooran baji wants the loan for her bakery. Razia baji will use her portion for her milk business and Fatima baji will fund her scrap business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group member and each will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand and improve heir businesses

loans.name: Sadiqan's Group

texts.en:
Sadiqan baji, the wife of N. B., lives in a city named Pak Pattan, Pakistan. She has been married for the last 20 years. She is a mother of two children: one daughter and one son. Both are enrolled in a local school. Her husband has a bicycle spare parts shop. He has been in this profession for the last 25 years. Now she is applying for a loan for her husband to expand his business.

She has been joined in her loan group a few more members: Shamim baji, who wants loan to expand her oil business; Kosar baji wants loan to buy an auto-rickshaw spare parts business; Asma baji wants a loan to buy chairs and a mirror for her barber salon; Sardaran baji wants a loan to expand her grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.name: Ni Made Tesni

texts.id:
Ni Made Tesni is a hard working woman who works as a farmer and a pig breeder. Since the income from farming is not enough and the income from breeding pig is still under her expectation, Ni Made Tesni decided to join DINARI's program to buy more pigs and pig food. Starting from a female pig, Made Tesni managed to obtain 8 piglets which she sold for Rp.250,000 per piglet. She gained a profit of Rp.2,500,000 after 6 months. As the outlook of the business is promising, Made Tesni decided to apply for a second loan from DINARI. She will use the second loan to buy piglets in addition to the female pig and also to buy pig food. The profit from the business is very useful to support her family's life.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Made Tesni adalah sosok perempuan yang tekun dalam menggeluti pekerjaannya sebagai petani dan peternak babi. Karena hasil bertani bersama suaminya tidak mencukupi membuat kerja sambilannya sebagai peternak babi juga memperoleh hasil yang kurang maksimal. Akhirnya Ni Made Tesni memutuskan untuk ikut program DINARI untuk menambah populasi babi dan juga digunakan untuk membeli pakan babi. Berawal dari membeli 1 ekor induk babi, Made Tesni berhasil mengembangkannya dengan menghasilkan 8 ekor anak babi yang kemudian dijual dengan harga Rp. 250.000 / ekor. Dari penjualan tersebut diperoleh keuntungan sebesar Rp. 2.500.000,- selama 6 bulan. Karena hasil yang cukup menjanjikan Made Tesni memutuskan untuk melanjutkan pinjaman kedua ke DINARI. Pinjaman kedua ini akan digunakan untuk membeli bibit babi penggemukan disamping tetap memelihara induknya dan tentunya dibelikan pakan babi juga. Keuntungan yang diperoleh Made Tesni sangat bermanfaat bagi peningkatan ekonomi keluarganya.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig food

loans.name: Sakeena's Group

texts.en:

Her remaining children just received education till 5th standard. Her husband is a driver. He has been in this profession for the last 5 years. She has been joined in her loan group a few more members: Shaheen baji, who wants loan to buy an auto-rickshaw; Khalida baji wants loan to buy electric items for her electric shop; Anwar baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart; Sajida baji wants loan to buy ice for selling.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Asasah, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Ni Made Juliasrini

texts.id:
Luh Juliasrini spends her daily life to do house works, farming and also breeding pig. She does all of them to support her family and to cover her children's education expenses. She has run the business for quite some time but the result is still under her expectation due to the high pig food expense. Using the loan from DINARI, Luh Juliasrini could buy 2 pigs. After breeding them for 4 months, she sold them and she could gain a profit of Rp 900,000. After that, she applied for a second loan from DINARI. She will use the loan to buy a female pig and pig food. After 6 months, she will be able to sell the piglets. This business profit is very useful to support her family.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Keseharian Luh Juliasrini dihabiskannya dengan mengurus pekerjaan rumah tangga bertani dan juga menekuni ternak babi. Semua itu dilakukannya untuk bisa memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya dan menyekolahkan anaknya. Usaha ternak babi memang sudah lama ditekuninya tetapi hasil yang dicapai belum sesuai harapannya karena harga pakan yang begitu tinggi. Dengan tambahan modal dari DINARI Luh Juliasrini mampu membeli 2 ekor babi dan setelah 4 bulan dipelihara lalu kemudian dijual mampu mendatangkan keuntungan sebesar Rp. 900.000,- Dari situlah Luh Juliasrini kembali meminjam modal ke DINARI untuk kedua kalinya yang nantinya akan digunakan untuk membeli induk babi dan pakan. Sehingga setelah 6 bulan akan melahirkan anak babi yang bisa dijual. Keuntungan yang diperoleh Luh Juliasrini sangat membantu pendapatan keluarganya.

loans.use: To buy female pig and pig food

loans.name: Jero Puri

texts.id:
Jero Puri is a Balinese hard-working woman. Besides working a farmer, Jero Puri is also a hard-working pig breeder. Since the people in her neighbourhood breed pigs, Jero Puri decided to raise a female pig so she can sell the piglets. After she was granted a loan from Dinari, Jero Puri received a capital to buy a female pig. After 6 months breeding the pig, she obtained 10 piglets which she sold for Rp.250,000 per piglet. Jero gained a profit of Rp 1,500,000 after deducting the pig food expenses. Later on, Jero Puri applied for a second loan from Dinari to add 2 more piglets in addition to the female pig. The business profit is really helpful to support her family and to cover her children's education fee.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Jero Puri adalah potret wanita Bali yang sangat ulet dalam bekerja. Disamping sebagai petani Jero Puri juga menggeluti pekerjaan lainnya sebagai peternak babi yang tekun. Karena disekitar rumahnya juga banyak yang memelihara babi penggemukan maka Jero Puri memutuskan untuk memelihara induk babi sehingga anak-anaknya bisa dijual untuk babi penggemukan. Setelah permohonan yang diajukan ke DINARI disetujui, Jero Puri mendapatkan modal untuk membeli 1 ekor induk babi. Setelah 6 bulan pemeliharaan dan pengarahan cara beternak yang baik dari DINARI, induk babi tersebut menghasilkan 10 ekor anak babi yang dijual Jero seharga Rp. 250.000,- / ekornya. Dari penjualan itu Jero mendapatkan keuntungan lumayan besar yaitu Rp. 1.500.000,- setelah dipotong pemakaian untuk pakannya. Selanjutnya Jero Puri mengajukan pinjaman kedua ke DINARI untuk menambah populasi ternak babinya dengan maksud untuk membeli 2 ekor bibit disanping tetap memelihara induknya. Hasil yang didapat Jero sangatlah membantu ekonomi keluarganya dan sanggup menyekolahkan anak-anaknya.

loans.use: To buy piglet

loans.name: Noreen's Group

texts.en:
Noreen baji is a wife of M. Y.. She has been married for 20 years. She lives in Vehari, Pakistan. Noreen baji has no children. Her husband is a land owner. He wants a tractor for loading so he can make a profit. Therefore, Noreen baji is applying for a loan for her husband.

She has been joined in her loan by a few group members. Abida baji who wants loan to buy an ice-Cream maker. Shekeela baji wants a loan for her welding business. Fozia baji wants a loan for her garment business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

NOTE: 'Baji' (elder sister) is an Urdu term of respect for women.

>

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Nengah Rai Magdalena

texts.id:
Nengah Rai Magdalena sells ice cubes to cover her three children's life expenses. Her husband is a driver for a night bus (Denpasar - Jakarta). He rarely stays at home. Rai Magdalena doesn't just sit at home waiting for her husband to come home and give her allowance. Rai Magdalena is running a small business which is selling ice cube. With this business, she can cover her and her children's daily expenses in addition to her husband's income. Since her refrigerator was old and needed to be replaced, Rai Magdalena applied for a loan from Dinari. She used the loan to buy a new refrigerator so she can meet the demands of her customers. Every morning and evening, Rai Magdalena makes the ice cubes. She cooks the water until boiled. After it cools down, she pours them into plastics and put them in the refrigerator. The next day or in the evening, she takes out the ice cubes and delivers them to her customers' kiosks. She gains a net profit of Rp 10,000 to Rp 15,000 and she uses it to cover her family's expenses.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Untuk mencukupi keperluan ke tiga anaknya Nengah Rai Magdalena harus berjualan Es Batu.Suaminya adalah seorang sopir bus Malam Jurusan Denpasar- Jakarta, yang kesehariannya jarang sekali dirumah.Rai Magdalena tidak tinggal diam dirumah sambil menanti suami pulang dengan harapan membawa uang sepulang bekerja.RaiMagdalena mempunyai usaha kecil-kecilan yaitu berjualan Es Batu. Dengan usaha inilah Rai Magdalena dapat mencukup keperluan belanja harian bersama ketiga anaknya selain dari penghasilan suaminya. Karena lemari es yang sudah tua dan perlu diganti, Maka Rai Magdalena mengajukan pinjaman dana pada Dinari. Denga dana itulah dipakai untuk membeli sebuah lemari es yang baru agar dapat menuhi kebutuhan pelanggannya. Setiap pagi dan sore Rai Magdalena mebuat es, caranya terlebih dulu dengan merebus air hingga matang. Setelah dingin mulailah air tesebut dimasukan kedalam plastik dan dimasukan kedalam lemari es. Esok hari atau sore hari barulah mengambil es yang sudah jadi untuk dipasarkan ke warung-warung langganannya. Dengan penghasilan bersih sebesar Rp.10.000,- s/d 15.000,- dapat diterimanya yang dapat dipergunakan untuk mencukupi keperluan keluarganya bersama ketiga anaknya.

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia baji is a wife of M.A.. She has been married for 18 years and is the mother of 8 children, four sons and four daughters. All of her children are being educated. Razia baji and her husband wish to give their children a good education so that they are able to built a good future and have progess in every walk of life and feel proud of their parents.

Razia baji’s husband is a tailor and runs his own shop. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah, a microfinance institute of Pakistan. Now she is applying a loan for her husband so that he buy a sewing machine and expand his business.

She has been joined in her loan group by the following members. Parveen baji wants a loan for her food business. Nusrat baji wants a loan for her vegetable business. Ramzana baji wants a loan for her bakery business. Sultana baji wants a loan for her grocery store.

Hafizan baji successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah, a microfinance institute of Pakistan. Now she is applying for a loan for her son's shoe shop.

This is a group loan. Hafizan baji has been joined in her loan group by a few more members. Kosar baji and Salma baji want a loan for their garment businesses. Arifa baji wants a loan for her shoe business.

In a group loan, the loan funds are distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

NOTE: "Baji" (elder sister) is an Urdu term of respect for women.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Kayi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Kayi A. was born June 6th in Lomé. She is married and the mother of four children all going to school. She is a retailer of basic goods in the Agoè neighborhood of northwest Lomé. She started doing business in 1998 and makes significant sales on market days because she displays her merchandise at Agoè’s market. The first credit she obtained allowed her to stock rice which increased her sales in November and December, especially during holiday periods, producing good results. After prompt repayment of this first loan, she is seeking a loan of 500,000 Francs CFA to buy three bags of sugar, ten bags of rice, seven drums of vegetable oil, and six cases of canned goods.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer

Madame A. Kayi est née le 6 juin 1961 à Lomé. Elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants tous scolarisés. Elle est une revendeuse des produits de premières nécessités dans le quartier d’Agoè au nord ouest de Lomé. Elle a commencé cette activité depuis 1998 et réalise de chiffre d’affaires important les jours de marché car elle expose ses marchandises dans le marché d’Agoè. Le premier crédit qu’elle avait obtenu lui a permis de faire le stock de riz ; et ceci lui a permis de bien vendre dans le mois de novembre et de décembre surtout pendant les périodes de fêtes et de dégager de bons résultats. Après un prompt remboursement de ce premier crédit, elle sollicite un crédit de 500.000FCFA afin d’acheter 3 sacs de sucre, 10 sacs de riz, 7 bidons d’huile végétale et 6 cartons de concave.

loans.use: Purchase basic goods merchandise

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for WAGES - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Hadisa

texts.ru:
Hadisa A. is a tailor. She sews traditional women's clothing. She had been in this business for the past 5 years. Currently, she has only one sewing machine. There is a demand for her products, and that is why she wants to open a mini tailor shop. To do that, she needs to purchase more textiles and an additional sewing machine. This will help her to increase efficiency and, in turn, profits. Hadisa is 25 years old, divorced, and has 4 children. She is the sole provider for her family. For this reason, she needs to develop her business. Moreover, many residents of her town use her services. To achieve her goals, she decided to apply for a loan, which will solve many of her problems. She is planning to pay it off within the next 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Ачилова Хадиса –портниха . Шьет национальную женскую одежду. Работает уже 5 лет . Имеет дома одну швейную машинку. Работа идет. Но она хочет открыть миниателье. Поэтому ей необходимо закупить сырье и еще одну швейную машинку. Это поможет ей ускорить темп работы и соответственно увеличить доход. Хадисе 25 лет , она разведена и имеет четверых детей. Весь груз по обеспечению семьи лежит на ней. Поэтому она должна развивать свое дело. Кроме того ее услугами пользуется весь кишлак в котором она живет. Поэтому для того , чтобы достичь этой цели она решила получить кредит , который и решит ее проблемы . Погасить кредит сможет в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase textiles and sewing machine

loans.name: Sardaran

texts.en:
Sardaran baji is a wife of N. A. and the mother of four children. Her eldest son, Asim A., quit school when he was in 2nd standard. The next son, Tasawar Hussain is 7 years old and is in 2nd standard. The younger sons, Faisal A. and Eshan A. are enrolled in a local school.

Sardaran baji is a housewife and makes embroider clothing on order. Her husband runs a poultry farm and sells chicken meat. Sardaran baji successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah, a microfinance institute of Pakistan. Now she is applying a loan for her husband’s chicken meat business. Her husband hopes that if he earns a good profit he can buy his own shop where he can sell chicken meat independently.

loans.use: To expand her husband's chicken business so he can open his own shop

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Irshad Begam, widow of K. D., lives in Kasur, Pakistan. Irshad baji is a mother of six sons, all of whom quit school when their father died. After the death of her husband, Irshad and her children struggled so much. Irshad baji makes wooden sticks and wooden curtains which called "chikhs." Irshad baji feels so proud of her children because her children faced every difficulty with so much courage. As a result of their hard work, Irshad baji and her sons were able to buy their own land and, now, they are living in their own home.

Irshad baji is facing yet another difficulty. Her younger son has anemia, althought the doctors suggest that with proper treatment, her son will be fine.

Now, Irshad baji is applying a loan for her wooden sticks business so that she able to expand her business and provide medical treatment for her son.

NOTE: "Baji" (elder sister) is an Urdu term of respect for women.

loans.use: To expand her wooden curtain business

loans.name: Matluba

texts.ru:
Matluba R. lives in the town of Vahdat. She is in the business of food sales. She has been in this business for the past 10 years. She purchases produce from farmers and sells it at higher prices. This business allows her to earn significant profits. However, she does not have enough funds to support larger inventory turnover during the season. For this reason, she often needs to loan money from friends and family. Once Matluba learned about our organization, she decided to seek our help. After obtaining a loan, she will be able to continue and grow her business. She plans to pay off the loan within the next 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Рахмонова Матлюба живет в городе Вахдат. Занимается торговлей сельхоз. продукцией. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 10 лет. Скупает товар у дехкан по низкой цене и продает по более выгодной. Ее бизнес приносит неплохой доход. Но в сезон у нее не хватает оборотной суммы. Поэтому часто приходится занимать . Но узнав про нашу организацию , Матлюба решила обратиться к нам. Получив кредит она сможет спокойно работать и развивать свой бизнес. Погасить кредит она планирует в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase inventory turnover

loans.name: Hurbi

texts.ru:
Hurbi S. lives with her family in the town of Vahdat. She is 49 years old, married, and has 5 children. Her main occupation is animal farming. She would like to purchase a milk cow so she could provide her family with milk. In addition, she will be able to sell the extra milk to her neighbors. This will allow her to earn additional income and, at the same time, she will help her neighbors, who will have an opportunity to purchase fresh milk at low prices. For this reason, she is applying for a loan, which she plans to repay within the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Сафарова Хурби жительница города Вахдат. Живет со своей семьей. Ей 49 лет она замужем и имеет 5 детей.Занимается животноводством. Хочет купить дойную корову для того , чтобы обеспечить свою семью молоком. Кроме того лишнее молоко она сможет продавать соседям , что даст для ее семьи дополнительные доходы , а так же поможет соседям , которые смогут покупать молоко по более низким ценам. Для этого она хочет получить кредит и погасить его в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Mohira

texts.ru:
Mohira G. is 49. While she does not have children of her own, Mohira lives happily with her brother and his six kids. She raises livestock and sells milk for a living, which helps her brother's family. Mohira has a cow and sells the milk wholesale at the market. She would like to purchase another cow in order to increase the yield of milk. This will help Mohira make more money. In order to buy the cow, Mohira decided to apply for a loan, which she can repay within twelve months.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva volunteer.

 Гулова Мохира -49 лет. Детей не имеет. Живет с братом у которого шестеро детей. Не смотря на это они живут дружно и весело. Занимается она животноводством и продажей молока. Этим она помогает семье брата. Имеет корову . которая дает молоко и продает оптом на рынке. Хочет купить еще одну корову для того , чтобы увеличить количество молока. Это поможет заработать больше денег. Для того , чтобы купить корову Мохира решила получить кредит . Погасить его она сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Gulraftor

texts.ru:
Gulraftor H. produces sour milk products to sell at the market and to her neighbors. She has a cow that yields about ten liters of milk per day. However, this isn't enough for her business to grow, so Gulraftor has applied for a twelve month loan to purchase a second cow for additional milk. With two cows, Gulraftor can increase her production volume and increase her income.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva volunteer.

Холова Гулрафтор производит кисло-молочные продукты и продает на рынке и соседям. Имеет во дворе корову , которая дает около 10 литров в день. Но этого не хватает для того , чтобы равивать свой бизнес. Поэтому со сроком в 12 месяцев она хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы купить еще одну корову , которая будет давать дополнительное молоко.ь Таким образом она сможет увелить объем производимой продукции , а так же увеличить доход.

loans.use: To buy a milk cow

loans.name: Mahmadroib

texts.ru:
Mahmadroib R., 38, lives with his wife and three children in Vahdat. He raises livestock for a living, buying and re-selling cattle. Mahmadroib would like a loan in order to buy two additional calves. This way, he can increase his sales volume. The more calves he has, the more offers Mahmadroib gets at the market. He can repay the loan within twelve months. Since his wife does not work, Mahmadroib is the sole breadwinner for his family. If things go as planned, this loan will improve his family's living conditions.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva volunteer.

Розиков Махмадроиб житель города Вахдат . Возраст 38 лет , женат и имеет троих детей. Занимается животноводством .Покупает и перепродает бычков. Хочет взять кредит и купить еще двоих бычков. Так он сможет увелить товарооборот. Больше бычков , больше предложение на рынке. Погасть кредит он сможет в течении 12 месяцев. Жена его не работает , поэтому вся ответственность по обеспечению семьи лежит только на нем. И если его дела пойдут так как он запланировал , то условия жизни его семьи улучшаться.

loans.use: To purchase calves

loans.name: Sherali

texts.ru:
Sherali S. lives in Vahdat with his wife and three children. He is 36, and for 10 years of his life, Sherali has been in retail. He owns a store where he sells groceries. Since many food products spoil, causing inventory loss, Sherali has applied for a loan to buy a refrigerator for perishable items and cold drinks. This will preserve Sherali's products, while at the same time providing locals with fresh, unspoiled food. He plans to repay the loan within twelve months.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva volunteer.

Салимов Шерали житель города Вахдат. Женат и имеет 3 детей. Ему 36 лет и 10 лет из них он занимается торговлей. Имеет магазин , где торгует продуктами питания. В связи с тем , что продукты портятся и из-за этого происходит потеря продуктов . Поэтому Шерали хочет получить кредит и купить холодильник для хранения продуктов питания и прохладительных напитков. Это поможет сохранить продукты на некоторое время , а так же население сможет покупать свежие не испорченные продукты . Погасить кредит Шерали планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Asimas

texts.en:
Mrs. Asimas M., 32, and her husband, Mr. Sary Loispoun, 33, who live about twenty kilometres from Phnom Penh, were married in 1991 and have five children, two sons and three daughters. Four of their children are in school and the youngest one stays at home. 

Mrs. Asimas and her husband have been fishing since they were young. Currently it is the low season because the authority bans people from fishing when the fish are breeding . Therefore, the couple has decided to create another business selling beef. This is why Asimas has requested this loan of US $700. She would like to purchase beef for resale and a motorcycle to transport the beef.

loans.use: To purchase beef for resale and to buy one motorcycle to transport the beef

loans.name: Chanroeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanroeun M., 38, and her husband, Mr. Sros Poeng M., 38, who live on an Island of Mekong River about fifteen kilometres from Phnom Penh, were married in 1993 and have two children, one son and one daughter. Both of their children are in school.

Mrs. Chanroeun has been a silk weaver for twenty six years, a skill she learned from her mother. Mrs. Chanroeun then taught her husband how to weave and he has been doing so for fifteen years. The Couple sells their finished products to the trader in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh. Now Chanroeun is requesting a loan of US$100 to purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Chreach

texts.en:
Mrs. Chreach C. (shown in the picture with her daughter), 57, and her husband, Mr. Sokhim Chey, 64, who live in a small village across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers north of Phnom Penh, were married in 1972 and have three daughters. Two of them are married and live outside the family home and the youngest one sells cloth and beauty products in Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Chreach and her husband have been growing rice since 1979. Beside the farming business, Mr. Sokhim has been motor taxi driver for eight years. He is in his early of 60s but is still strong enough to work.

Now Chreach is requesting a loan of US$700 to purchase cloth and beauty products for her youngest daughter (who shown in the picture with her) to sell.

loans.use: For her daughter to purchase cloth and beauty products for resale.

loans.name: Faizimo

texts.ru:
Faizimo S. has been selling at the central market in Vahdat for six years. She brings various industrial goods to the market from Dushanbe, Tajikistan's capital, to sell at her stall. Faizimo is the mother of four children and with her husband currently unemployed, she is the family's sole breadwinner. Faizimo wants to increase her sales by bringing in a new assortment of goods. However, to do this she will need a twelve-month loan. This will help Faizimo earn more and improve her children's living conditions.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva volunteer.

Шарипова Файзимо торгует на центральном рынке города Вахдат. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 6 лет. Привозит товар из города Душанбе и продает со своей торговой точки. Торгует разными промышленными товарами. Она замужем и у нее четверо детей. Муж нигде не работает , поэтому она одна обеспечивает свою семью. Хочет привести новый ассортимент товара и таким образом увеличить товарооборот. Но для этого ей необходимо получить кредит со сроком на 12 месяцев.Это поможет ей заработать больше и улучшить условия жизни своих детей.

loans.use: To increase her sales

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Mrs. Sem O., 53, and her husband, Mr. Thoeun Sun, 61, who live on an Island of Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1978 and have eight children, three sons and five daughters. Four of her children are garment factory workers in Phnom Penh. One son is married and lives outside the family home. One daughter does farming with her parents and the other three children are in local school.

Mr. Sem and her husband have been farming for over twenty years. They grow many kinds of vegetables whcih they sell to the village trader who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh.  Now the family is in the process of constructing a new house (shown in the picture) but lack the money to finish it.

So, Sem is requesting a loan of US$1000 to add to the money she has saved herself to construct a new house.

loans.use: To add to the money she has saved for constructing a house.

loans.name: Rahmat Allah

texts.en: Rahmat Allah lives in district 3 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is educated and married, and has a small electronics store where he works to support his family. He wants to enlarge his store, so he is requesting an individual loan to complete his stock and make his business more successful. He hopes that he can do it and he is pleased with the loan. He would like to thank Kiva lenders that are helping people, especially in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To complete his stock.

loans.name: Sophat

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophat B., 52, and her husband, Mr. Yorn Pov, 56, who live on an Island of Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1980 and have six children, one son and five daughters. Four of her children are garment factory workers in Phnom Penh. One daughter is married and lives outside the family home, and one helps her parents with the family farming business. 

Mr. Sophat and her husband have been farming for almost twenty years. They grow many kinds of vegetables which they sell to a trader in Phnom Penh.  Now Sophat is requesting a loan of US$700 to rent more land for farming.

loans.use: To rent a field for farming

loans.name: Agnes Group

texts.en: Kaday Kopey is 50 years of age and married with 6 children.  Four of her children are still schooling and her business income contributes a lot to the education of the children.  Kaday's husband is a motor mechanic with irregular income.  Kaday is a group leader.  The group had 5 members, but 3 members decided to rest from taking loans until after the rain season. Kaday sells palm oil and Nazratu K. sells fish; both members are requesting a loan of Le.1,600,000, and Le.800,000 in order to increase their stock and income.

loans.use: Purchase fish and palm oil

loans.name: Abdujabor

texts.ru:
Abdujabor B. is retired and lives in Vahdat. He has six children, and his oldest child is now working in Russia. However, the family still needs money, so Abdujabor raises livestock as a business. He purchases calves at low prices and sells them on for a small profit. Since the earnings from his business are not large, Abdujabor has applied for a loan in order to buy another pair of calves. This will help him increase his sales volume. In addition, the calves that he sells provide fresh meat for the local population. Abdujabor plans to repay the loan within a twelve month period.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva volunteer.

Буров Абдуджаббор пенсионер. Живет в городе Вахдат Имеет шестерых детей. Старший из них уехал на заработки в Россию. Но денег все равно не хватает. Поэтому Абдуджаббор сам занимается животноводством. Покупает бычков подешевле и продает подороже. Прибыль не большая , поэтому он решил получить кредит и купить еще пару молодых бычков. Это поможет увелить товарооборот . кроме того бычки , которых он продает используют на мясо и это помогает населению покупать свежее мясо. Погасить кредит его бизнес позволит в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase his head of livestock

loans.name: Sreypheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreypheap L., 25, and her husband were married in 2006. The couple lives about fifteen kilometres from Phnom Penh. They have one son.

Mrs. Sreypheap has been garment factory worker for seven years. Her husband has been running a flat tyre fixing business in the front of the house for many years, but he lacks some material for his business. Sreypheap is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase materials to fix the flat tyres.

loans.use: To purchase materials for a flat tyre fixing business.

loans.name: Amin

texts.en:
Amin Fatima, a wife of R. I., lives in a two-room brick house in Kasur, Pakistan. She is a housewife and prefers to do household work. Her husband is a shoe maker and he has been in this profession for the last 5 years. By the grace of God, their business grew; due to this expansion, they were able to hire five workers. Now they have their own shoe shop, and they have good reputation in the eyes of their customers.

Amin baji wishes to expand her husband's shoe business much more and wants to start another shoe shop.

NOTE: "Baji" (elder sister) is an Urdu term of respect for women.

loans.use: To expand her husband's shoe business and open another store

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en:
Mr. Phalla S., 26, and his wife, Mrs. Sreynoun Ngoun, who live about twenty kilometres from Phnom Penh, were married in 2004 and have one daughter.

Mr. Phalla has been motor trailer taxi (Tok Tok) driver in Phnom Penh for two years. His trailer is broken and he needs some money to buy a new one. Phalla is requesting this $700 to purchase a trailer to replace the old one, so that he can continue driving a motor trailer taxi.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer for a motor trailer taxi (Tok Tok).

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Vutha

texts.en:
Mr. Vutha S., 29, and his wife, Mrs. Sokny S., who live about twenty kilometres from Phnom Penh, were married in 2003 and have one daughter.

Mr. Vutha S. has been motor taxi driver for a few months, while his wife Mrs. Sokny S. sells rice soup and Khmer noodles at the village market. Before he started this business, Vutha was a garment factory worker. His motorcycle is very old and is now broken so he needs some money to buy a new one. Vutha is requesting a loan for the amount of $500 to purchase a motorcycle to replace the old one, so that he can continue  his motor taxi business.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle to replace his broken one

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem baji, wife of A. W., lives in Kasur, Pakistan in a two-room brick house. Naseem is a housewife and helps her husband in his shoe business. A. W. has a shop in a good area. He has good reputation in the eyes of his customers. He has 4 employees in his shoe shop. Naseem baji’s monthly income is $250 to $300.

Now, Naseem baji is applying for a loan for her husband, so that he can diversify his shoe business in urban areas, too.

NOTE: "Baji" (elder sister) is an Urdu term of respect for women.

loans.use: To diversify the her husband's shoe business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Asasah, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Avrodhon

texts.ru:
Avrodhon K. lives in Vahdat with his wife and five children. Avrodhon works in a store selling groceries. He brings flour and cottonseed oil in from Dushanbe, Tajikistan's capital, to sell in his store. Avrodhon has been in this business for three years. He has decided to increase his sales volume and expand the range of goods he sells. In order to do this, Avrodhon has applied for a 12-month loan. This will help him improve his store's profitability and his family's financial position. In addition, people in his village will be able to take advantage of the new products Avrodhon plans to offer.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva volunteer.

Косимов Авротхон житель города Вахдат. Женат и имеет пятерых детей. Работает в магазине. Торгует продуктами питания. Привозит из города Душанбе муку и хлопковое масло, а продает у себя в магазине. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже три года.Решил увеличить товарооборот и увеличить ассортимент товара. Хочет завести и другие продукты. Для этого он запланировал получить кредит со сроком на 12 месяцев. Это поможет ему увеличить прибыльность магазина и улучшить финансовое положение семьи. Кроме того население его кишлака сможет пользоваться его услугами

loans.use: To increase inventory and sales

loans.name: Khursheed

texts.en: Khursheed baji wife of M. lives in a city named Kasur, Pakistan. Khursheed baji is a housewife. She is master of making decorative embroidery. Through this skill she gets recognition in her neighborhood. Now she took this skill as an occupation and starts making embroider dresses on customers order. Khursheed successfully completed her first loan from Asasah a microfinance institute of Pakistan. Now she has lack of material to fulfill the requirements of her customers therefore she applies a loan to fulfill her customers need and earns a good profit.

loans.use: To improve the financial conditions

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Mrs. Kong T., 56, is a widow with five children. Her husband died four years a go. All of her children are married, two of whom live in the family house about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Kong has been selling fishes for thirty years. She buys them from her nearby district about twenty kilometers from her house for resale at Kandal market in Phnom Penh. Kong is requesting a loan in the amount of $800 to purchase a motorcycle to carry fishes for resale.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle to carry fishes for resale.

loans.name: Khursheed

texts.en:
Khursheed baji, wife of M. A., lives in Kasur, Pakistan. Khursheed is the mother of two children. Her children are enrolled in a local school near her home. Khursheed baji is a housewife. She is master of making decorative embroidery. She now considers this skill to be an occupation and has started making embroider dresses for customers on order.

Khursheed successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah, a microfinance institute of Pakistan. Now she needs material to fill her customers' orders. Therefore, she is applying for a loan to buy material so she can earn a good profit.

loans.use: To buy material for her embroidery business

loans.name: Oybonu

texts.ru:
Oybonu T. lives in the region of Vakhsh. She is 44 years old, widowed, with three children. She has a secondary education. Oybonu sells fruits and vegetables at the local market.
