She supports her family herself since her husband is dead. Her sales are the only source of income for the family. The client wishes to increase the variety of the produce she sells. That is why she plans to take out a three-month loan.

Translated from Russian by Anya Ezhevskaya, Kiva volunteer.

Талбакова Ойбону жительница района Вахш.Возраст 44 года, вдова, имеет 3 детей. Образование среднее. Ойбону торгует на местном рынке овощами и крупами.Свою семью она содержит сама , так как муж Ойбону умер. Торговля является единственным источником дохода ее семьи. Клиентка хочет пополнить ассортимент торговой точки.Для этого она планирует взять кредит сроком на 3 месяца.

loans.use: Increase product line

loans.name: Sam-Oeun

texts.en:
Mr. Sam-oeun P., 51, and his wife, Mrs. Phalla Khin, who about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1985 and have five children, two sons and three daughters. Two of their children were married and live outside the family home. One son has full time employment and other two are in local school.   

Mr. Sam-oeun and his wife have been selling vegetables at Doemkor market in Phnom Penh for five years. They earned for living about $7.50 to $10 per day. Sam-oeun wants to expand his selling but lack some money. So, he is requesting a loan in the amount of $1000 to purchase vegetables for resale in order to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase vegetable for resale.

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en:
Shakeela baji, wife of N. H., lives in a Kasur, Pakistan. She is a mother of three children. Shakeela baji is a housewife and is 3 years younger than her husband. She has a skill of making cots (baby cribs). She also makes cots on order. Her husband is an automotive electrician.

She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah, a microfinance institute of Pakistan. She is applying a loan for her husbandm who wants to buy tools related to his profession.

loans.use: To buy tools for her husband's business.

loans.name: Kheng

texts.en:
Mrs. Kheng S., 56, and her husband, Mr. Som-oun Nhem, 58, who live on an Island of Mekong River about fifteen kilometres from Phnom Penh, were married in 1962 and have seven children, two sons and five daughters. All of their children were married, two of whom live in the family.

Mrs. Kheng has been selling silk produces for fifteen years. She buys the goods from the local villagers and then resells them in the provinces. Mr. Som-oun has been a primary school teacher since 1983. Mrs. Kheng is requesting a loan of US$500 to purchase more silk goods for resale.

loans.use: To purchase silk goods for resale.

loans.name: Hamidan

texts.en: Hamidan baji, wife of M. I., lives in Kasur, Pakistan. Hamidan baji is a housewife. She is master of decorative embroidery. Through this skill, she gets recognition in her neighborhood. Now she considers this skill to be her occupation and has started making embroidered dresses for customers on order. Therefore, she is applying for a loan to establish her embroidery business.

loans.use: To start a business of embroidering dresses

loans.name: Niso

texts.ru:
Niso A. lives in the region of Vakhsh. She is 41 years old, married, with five children. She has a technical, secondary education. She buys and sells cloth. She has a small shop at the Vakhsh market, and over five years of experience working in the field. This work allows her to support her large family, since at the moment her husband has gone to Russia to earn money there. Niso wants to increase her product line, and she needs funding for that. She has decided to take out a three-month loan.

Translated from Russian by Anya Ezhevskaya, Kiva volunteer.

Эшонова Нисо жительница района Вахш. Возраст 41 год,замужем,имеет 5 детей.Образование средне-техническое. Занимается куплей продажей ткани.Имеет небольшой магазин на рынке района Вахдат.Опыт работы в бизнесе имеет более 5 лет. Этот вид деятельности позволяет ей содержать свою бошльшую семью.Так как в данное время ее муж уехал на заработки в Россию.Сейчас Нисо хочет увеличить ассортимент товара,на что ей нужны деньги.Клиентка решила взять кредит сроком на 3 месяца.

loans.use: Increase the variety of the product line

loans.name: Sokhoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhoeun K., 38, and her husband, Mr. Sophal Veng, 44, who live on an Island of MeK. River about fifteen kilometres from Phnom Penh, have been married since she was nineteen years old and have four children, three sons and one daughter. Two of their children have full time employment in Phnom Penh. One child is in school and the youngest one stays at home.

Mrs. Sokhoeun has been a silk weaver since 2000, a skill she learned from her neighbour. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh. Mr. Sophal is a farmer and raises cows in the village. 

Sokhoeun is requesting a loan of US$400 to purchase silk material for weaving and some to buy straw for feeding cows in flooding season.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving and  to buy straw to feed the cows

loans.name: Uzma

texts.en:
Uzma baji is a wife of G. M. and the mother of three children. Her husband has a business selling wooden sticks and wooden curtains which called "chikhs." Uzma baji has a two-room brick house. Uzma baji and her husband want to give their children a good education.

Uzma baji is applying a loan for her husband so that he can diversify his business much more and give his children a better future.

NOTE: "Baji" (elder sister) is an Urdu term of respect for women.

loans.use: To diversify her husband's business

loans.name: Sreymao

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreymao M., 39, and her husband, Mr. Savuth Ma, 39, who live on an Island of Mekong River about fifteen kilometres from Phnom Penh, were married in 1991 and have three children, two sons and one daughter. One of their sons is construction worker and the other two children are in local school.

Mrs. Sreymao has been a silk weaver since she was nineteen years old, a skill she learned from her neighbour. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh, while Mr. Savuth works in a parking station. 

Sreymao is requesting a loan of US$250 to purchase silk material to continue her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en: Bushra, wife of M. Ali, has lived in Kasur, Pakistan for the last 4 years. She is a housewife and helps her husband in his business. Her husband is a milk man and sells milk in the neighboring area. Therefore, she is applying a loan for her husband. Her husband wants to buy a buffalo to improve their financial condition.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo

loans.name: Zebonisso.

texts.ru:
Zebonisso K. lives in the town of Vakhsh. She is 40 years old, married, with four children. She has a secondary education. She buys and sells children's shoes, and has a small shop at the local market. She has over ten years experience in the field. At the moment, the client is supporting her whole family by herself, since at the moment her husband is not working. Zabonisso wants to buy summer shoes wholesale, and she needs money for this. That's why she's decided to take out a three-month loan.

Translated from Russian by Anya Ezhevskaya, Kiva volunteer.

Курбонова Зебонисо жительница района Вахш.Возраст 40 лет, замужем, имеет 4 детей.Образование среднее.Занимается куплей продажей детской обуви.На местном рынке имеет небольшой магазин. Имеет опыт в этой деятельности более 10 лет. В данный момент клиентка содержит всю семью сама,так как муж в данный момент не работает.Зебониссо хочет закупить летнюю обувь у оптовых поставщиков, для чего ей нужны деньги.Поэтому она решила взять кредит сроком на 3 месяца.

loans.use: Increase the variety of products sold.

loans.name: Han

texts.en:
Mrs. Han S., 38, and her husband, Mr. Dara Run, 43, who live on an Island of Mekong River about fifteen kilometres from Phnom Penh, were married in 1988 and have four children, three sons and one daughter. One of her sons help in her business and  the other two children are in a local school. The youngest one stays at home.

Mrs. Han has been a silk weaver since she was thirteen years old, a skill she learned from her neighbour.  They sell their silk to wholesalers in Phnom Penh. Besides the silk business the couple has been operating a grocery store at home for two years. 

Han now wants to expand her grocery business but she lacks money so she is requesting a loan of US $1200. She will spend $1000 expanding her grocery business, and will use the remaining $200 to invest in her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for resale and to buy silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Raupov

texts.ru:
A. Raupov is 27 years old. He is married but does not have children yet. He has finished High school. He has been helping his mother at the market since he was a little boy. When he came of age, he decided to separate from his mother and start his own business. It has been 7 years now since he started purchasing goods and selling them on the market by himself. He would like to obtain a loan in order to increase the variety of summer goods he has for sale.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Раупов Амир парень в возросте 27 лет женат но пока детей не имеет, образование имеет среднее. С детства помогал маме по бизнесу торговать на рынке , по совершенолетия он решил отделится от матери и начать свой бизнес.Вот уже 7 лет как он сам привозит товар и продаёт на рынке, для увеличения летнего товара он хочет взять кредит.

loans.use: women's shoes

loans.name: Phal

texts.en:
Mrs. Phal K., 53, and her husband, Mr. At Vorng, 49, who live on an Island of Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh were married in 1979 and have seven children,  one son and six daughters. Two of their children are married and live outside the family home.  Four of her children are in local school and one weaves silk at home. 

Mrs. Phal has been a silk weaver for twenty five years, a skill she learned from her sister. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been a farmer since 1979.
 
Phal has three looms in the family so she is requesting a loan of US$600 to purchase silk so that she can continue her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk for weaving.

loans.name: Struggle Group

texts.en: Aminata J. is a SMT client who has accessed several small loans.  The group leader and mother of 6 children sells children's shoes and Gara, tye-dye materials.  She has been running the business for six years and her income plays a major role in meeting her children's educational expenses.  She is very happy to join Kiva and would like to access a larger loan to expand her business.  Fatmata and Kadijatu own grocery stalls in Makeni market.  The group is requesting a loan of Le.2,400,000 to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To increase stocks of shoes, tye-dye materials, and groceries

loans.name: Sanovbar

texts.ru:
Sanovbar B. lives in the town of Vahdat with her husband and three children. She has a middle-school, technical training as a nurse, but she does not work. She sells fruits and vegetables at the Vahdat market. She wants to take out a loan to increase the amount of products she sells. This will help her earn more money and improve the living conditions for her children. She will repay the loan in twelve months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Ezhevskaya, Kiva volunteer.

Бурихонова Санобар проживает в городе Вахдат. Живет с мужем и тремя детьми. Имеет средне-специальное образование. По специальности медсестра, Но не работает. Торгует на рынке Вахдата , фруктами и овощами. Хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Это даст возможность больше заработать и улучшить условия жизни для своих детей. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase amount of products sold.

loans.name: Abdul Sami

texts.en: Abdul Sami lives in Kabul, Afghanistan, where he has a restaurant. His restaurant has lots of customers, but he would like to expand his business and needs funds to complete his stock. Therefore, he would like to take out an individual loan to buy stock for his restaurant and make it even more popular. He is pleased with this loan.

loans.use: To complete his stock.

loans.name: Alimova

texts.ru:
N. Alimova has successfully paid back her first loan in a timely manner. Now she has decided to increase the variety of summer fabric she has for sale. Her turnover has significantly increased thanks to the first loan. N. would like to thank Kiva for the support and apply for another loan of 3000 somoni.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Алимова Нажми удачно окончив первый займ, пунктуально погашала первый кредит.Теперь решила увеличить ассортимент летних тканей.После первого кредита у неё заметно увеличился товарооборот.Она хочет от всей души поблагодарить K IVA за понимание и поддержку.Она хочет получить 3000 сомони .

loans.use: Retail sale of fabric

loans.name: Temurova

texts.ru:
T. is 42 years old, is married and has 3 children. She has a college degree. Previously she worked as a middle school teacher, but because salaries in the public sector in Tajikistan are very small, 8 years ago she left work and has opened a wedding salon. She purchases wedding gowns and rents them for weddings. Her goods are unique and are in high demand in town. Her salon has become very well known. Summer is the season for weddings and for this reason she would like to increase her selection of gowns by purchasing some in Turkey. This will help the brides look their absolute best on their wedding day.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Турсуной женщина 42 лет замужем имеет троих детей, образование высшее.Она раньше работала учительницей в средней школе , но т.к. зарплата бюджетников в Таджикистане мизерная, поэтому она ушла с работы и уже 8 лет как она открыла свой свадебный салон, где закупает свадебные платья и отдает в аренду на свадебные мероприятия.Её товар оригинальный и имеет хороший спрос у нас в городе.Её салон знаменит.Лето это сезон для свадеб и поэтому она хочет увеличить свои платья завозом из Турции, чтоб наши девушки невесты были неотразимыми на своём свадебном вечере.

loans.use: свадебный салон

loans.name: Gaffarova

texts.ru:
M. Gafarova is a mother of 4. She has a college degree. She works as a doctor in the children's hospital. On her days off she travels to remote locations of the region and sells groceries (pasta, sugar, tea, etc.). Because these regions are far from markets, her goods sell well. In order to increase turnover she would like to obtain a credit. She is starting off with a small loan to see if this system will work for her or not. She plans to continue using loans in the future.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Гафарова Мархабо мать 4 детей с вымшим образованием.Работает медиком в детской больнице, по выхлдным дням она по районам в отдаленные местности возит продукты питания ( макароны , сахар, чай т.п).Т.к эти районы отдалены от базаров поэтому у неё удачно идёт реализация товара.Для увеличения активов она хочет получить кредит.Вначале малую сумму если ей понравится то в дальнейшем планирует продолжать кредитоваться.

loans.use: Selling groceries

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina is divorced and is raising her 12-year-old son by herself. She lives in Simferopol, Ukraine where she runs a small business selling seafood at the “Kievskyi market”. Galina has operated her business for ten years. Lively and full of energy, she works hard to make her business a success. By offering a wide selection of products at affordable prices, she has been able to broaden her customer base and meet the needs of more clients. Currently, she is making over 6000 Ukranian Hryvnias in sales each month and her net profit is about 800 Ukranian Hryvnias.

Galina is requesting a loan for $1075 US to allow her to re-supply her inventory and introduce new products. Her long-term goal is to expand her business by opening additional vending kiosks and increasing her sales. Currently, she is taking care of her father who is sick with cancer. Galina uses part of her income to buy expensive medications for her dad, hoping they will help him fully recover one day.

loans.use: To increase assorted inventory

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya is married with two kids. She runs a small business selling audio CDs and movies in the central mall of Ordzhonikidze, Ukraine. She has a variety of products for sale at reasonable prices in her stall. Natalya started her venture two years ago and has developed a stable enterprise since then. Currently, she has over 6000 Ukranian Hryvnias in inventory. Her monthly net profit is little over 700 Ukranian Hryvnias.

Natalya has many loyal customers. They always come to buy CDs and DVDs from her because they know she offers no low-quality products. Customer demand is constantly growing, which is why Alla would love to expand her trade and why she is requesting a loan for $550 US to increase her turnover capital. We believe Natalya’s determination and desire to provide only the best quality products will help her grow professionally and increase her sales.

loans.use: To increase turnover capital

loans.name: Nikolai

texts.en:
For one year Nikolai has operated a little business in Khoost, Ukraine selling electric supplies. Nikolai is single and commits all his time to his business. He decided to work in this sphere of trade because this type of merchandise does not spoil as food does, which makes it easier to store.

Nikolai has benefited from the support of Hope Intl-Nadiya Ukraine as he has built his business. He has been able to dramatically increase his amount of inventory on hand in the year that he has been in this trade. Nikolai believes this loan of $1075 US will allow him to offer a much more attractive product selection to customers and be better able to meet customer demand. One day Nikolai is hoping to open a new vending store of his own.

loans.use: To increase turnover capital

loans.name: Nina

texts.en:
Nina is a widow from Kamenka. She runs a business selling candy and sweets in the central city market. Despite losing her husband, Nina has managed to regain her business enthusiasm and determination. Eight years of being in business have helped her venture flourish into a successful enterprise with about 5000 Ukranian Hryvnias in circulating capital and about 600-650 a month in net profit.

Nina would like to see her business grow further. She believes additional financial assistance will help guarantee expansion and higher profits. Nina’s integrity, good reputation, stability and rich experience working in commerce should secure prompt repayment of this loan and consistent progress in her business.

loans.use: To increase inventory assortment

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
For the last three years, Oksana has been investing her time and finances into developing her small retail business at the busy central mall in Khoost. Years of experience have equipped her to be a very successful entrepreneur. Her business has grown to the point now where she has been able to generate about 3000 Ukranian Hryvnias in turnover capital. In addition to her daily work, Oksana also cares for her husband and daughter, Roksolana.

Oksana is known as a goal-oriented business owner who is optimistic about the future. She dreams of purchasing a second sales facility and would like to increase her inventory in order to boost her earnings. She is asking for a loan of $650 US to purchase additional inventory, which will help her to continually meet the needs of her customers while providing for her own financial responsibilities.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is married with two daughters, aged nineteen and two. She sells women’s lingerie in a busy market called the “Kiev Market” near a bus station in Simferopol, Ukraine. She owns a small store which gives her a strong benefit as a market vendor. Low competition also adds to the success of her business. Tatyana has been in this business for ten years.

Tatyana dreams of opening a couple of new vending facilities in surrounding cities on the Crimean peninsula. Her enterprising spirit always drives her forward and gears up her enthusiasm. She is requesting this loan of $1075 US to increase her turnover capital and continue growing her trade. One day she also hopes to generate enough savings to purchase a vehicle of her own, which would considerably facilitate her business.

loans.use: To increase turnover capital

loans.name: Thi Luong

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Lương (MS: 13010030), 35 years old, is a dress maker. Her husband is a construction supervisor. They have two small children. They have taken out loans in the past, all repaid fully. She is applying for a loan of 2,006,000 VND to buy new sewing machine. Their average combined weekly income is 300,000 VND. Her group has 4 other members. They all apply for loans of the same amount as hers except one.
  • Dương Thị Nguyệt (MS:13010034) applies for a loan to “đi chợ”
  • Nguyễn Thị Ngọc Lan (MS: 13010035) applies for a loan to uy a sewing machine
  • Nguyễn Thị Bình (MS: 13010036) applies for a loan to “đi chợ”
  • Đinh Thị Hải Nam (MS: 13010037) applies for a loan to “đi chợ”
(This is a repost. This group has been posted [ID of 51516] with an error of Loan Type.)

Đi chợ, a general Vietnamese term, describes the everyday trading activity of small items at village open market. Traders seek opportunity to buy items which can be resold to others at a minimal profit. These items can be anything, including products such as a little fish or a small bundle of vegetables. At times the Traders don't have a stand, but rather sell their wares directly from their person.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị Lương (MS: 13010030), năm nay 35 tuổi. Chị làm thợ may, chồng chị làm chủ thầu xây dựng. Anh chị hiện có hai con còn nhỏ. Trước kia anh chị đã tương vay vốn của ngân hàng nông nghiệp và phát triển nông thôn huyện và đã trả hết. Chị rất thích hình thức tiết kiêm của chương trình nên đã tham gia. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để mua thêm máy khâu về may quần áo bán. Mức thu nhập của gia đình chị là lớn hơn 300.000 VND/tuần. Chị Dương Thị Nguyệt (MS:13010034), vay 2.006.000 VND để lấy vốn đi chợ. Chị Nguyễn Thị Ngọc Lan (MS: 13010035), vay 2.006.000 VND để mua máy khâu. Chị Nguyễn Thị Bình (MS: 13010036), vay 2.006.000 VND để lấy vốn đi chợ buôn bán . Chị Đinh Thị Hải Nam (MS: 13010037), vay 1.534.000 VND để đi chợ. (Nhóm đã được đăng và có ID 51516 do Kiva cấp nhưng đã đăng nhầm là Loan Type của nhóm là Loan Type cá nhân. Nhóm được đăng lại với thông tin đầy đủ và chính xác).

loans.use: Various businesses

loans.name: Lubov

texts.en:
Lubov is an entrepreneur from Melitopol. She runs a business selling women’s footwear in the central city market. Lubov started this venture five years ago and today Lubov is making about $1000 each month. Her monthly net profit is about $400. Nadiya Ukraine loans have helped her business grow.

Lubov is an experienced entrepreneur. She loves to see how results of her labor bear abundant fruit. However, she is also a caring and loving mom. Lubov has two sons and tries to help them financially, too. She is hoping to continue developing her venture and providing for all her family needs.

loans.use: To increase stock

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is a well-known businessman in Primorsk, a town at the Azov sea. He offers entertainment services for tourists who visit the resort areas at the seaside. Some of the fun options he offers are water scooters, catamarans and banana boats (a banana-shaped airboat, pulled by a motor speedboat). The location of his business is very favorable as it is a busy beach with lots of tourists who come to swim and tan there. Many seek entertainment and fun and that's exactly what Alexander’s business is all about.

In the summer season he usually makes about 3000 Ukranian Hryvnias a month. He has about 9000 Ukranian Hryvnias invested in inventory right now. Alexander is seeking a loan for $550 US to provide quality equipment maintenance this summer season. He is hoping to have a second start-up and open a vending facility in the market, too. Alexander believes this summer season is going to bring him good profits, providing a decent livelihood to his family.

loans.use: For equipment maintenance

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is a businessman from Primorsk where he lives with his wife and a daughter. He sells groceries such as bread, sugar, candy, cookies and noodles in a small grocery store. Alexander can boast of high sales because his merchandise is regularly re-stocked and characterized by good quality. Presently, he is making about 4000 Ukranian Hryvnias each month. He has about 6000 Ukranian Hryvnias of turnover capital.

Alexander is very honest and polite with both his suppliers and his customers. It has helped him to gain a reputation as a trustworthy and friendly vendor and to build a solid client base. Alexander is applying for a loan of $550 US to re-stock his merchandise for the busy summer season and hopefully generate additional profit. He plans to invest the profits to open a new vending facility in the same neighborhood.

loans.use: To increase grocery store stock

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is single. She lives with her parents and younger brother in Simferopol on the Crimean peninsula. After college she worked as a market vendor; however, her salary was too small and Tatyana couldn’t meet even her basic needs and ensure decent living. That is how she ended up as an entrepreneur selling clothing items in the market.

Tatyana has a rich experience working in trade. Her perseverance and diligence, in combination with loans from “Nadiya Ukraine”, have helped her succeed in business over the past four years. Just recently Tatyana has become a proud owner of two vending facilities in the busiest central market. Tatyana is requesting a loan of $1075 US to increase her turnover capital, purchase seasonal merchandise and increase her sales. She believes trendy dresses and pants beautifully arranged on her stand will attract many potential women customers who will definitely end up buying something.

loans.use: To increase seasonal inventory

loans.name: José Cesar

texts.es:
Don José C. rents out videogames for a living in the town of Chinandega in Nicaragua. He is the father of two school aged children, and it is his obligation to offer them the necessary conditions for their development within their society. It is very important to point out that he started his business 8 years ago and presently he has improved business and purchased videogames to be sold.

Today he needs economic resources to buy videogames, and therefore he has approached Ceprodel to obtain the loan needed to purchase these videogames to be offered to the clients that visit his business.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

El caballero José C. se dedica a su negocio de alquiler de videojuegos en la ciudad de Chinandega en Nicaragua. Es padre de dos hijos en edades escolares cuya obligación es brindarles las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo en su localidad. Es de suma importancia destacar que el negocio lo inició desde hace 8 años y hoy en día lo ha mejorado y adquirido los videojuegos para ofrecerlos.

La necesidad que atraviesa hoy en día es que necesita el recurso económico para la compra de los videojuegos, por este motivo acude a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito necesario para la compra de estos videojuegos y así ofertarlos a los clientes que le visiten en su negocio de alquiler de videojuegos.

loans.use: Purchase videogames for rent.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es:
Mr. Manuel de Jesús is requesting a loan to invest in the improvement of his house, by plastering the walls and putting in a ceramic floor.

He has worked for 17 years and the director of the Rafaela Herrera school in the La Fonseca neighborhood, located 30 km from Nueva Guinea. He has three children, the oldest daughter is 20 years old and is in her third year of university study, his younger son is 14 years old and is in the fourth year of secondary education and his youngest son is 10 years old and in the fifth grade.

With a lot of effort, he has managed to provide for his children. His wife also works as a teacher and ,as such, contributes to covering the household expenses. His dream is that his children continue studying, having a decent home with better conditions, and job stability to continue providing for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Manuel de Jesús está solicitando su crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda como es repellar y ponerle la ceramica a la casa. Desde hace 17 años trabaja como director de la Escuela Rafaela Herrera en colonia la Fonseca a 30 km de Nueva Guinea. Tiene 3 hijos, la hija mayor de 20 años estudia su tercer año en la Universidad, su otro hijo tiene 14 años estudia su 4to año de educación secundaria y su hijo menor de 10 años estudia 5to grado. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado sacar a sus hijos adelante, su esposa trabaja como docente y aporta con los gastos familiares, su sueño es que sus hijos sigan estudiando, tener una vivienda con mejores condiciones y estabilidad laboral para así ayudar a su familia.

loans.use: Plaster the walls and put a floor in his house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase merchandise

payments.comment: La cuota real de pago es de $ 20.83 dólares.

loans.name: Ana Adilia

texts.es:
In the town of Chinandega, at the market Santa Ana, doña Ana Adilia G. has a general store where she sells all kinds of products like food, items for personal care and housecleaning to her clients.

For 7 years she has done this for a living and has achieved improvements thanks to her great efforts and the support from Ceprodel which has helped her improve her condition. Presently she has approached Ceprodel once more to obtain a loan that will allow her to purchase more products for her business. She has received a total of 18 loans and each of them has been repaid punctually.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

En la ciudad de Chinandega, en el Mercado Santa Ana, la señora Ana Adilia G. se dedica a su negocio de pulpería el cual ofrece todo tipo de productos como comestibles, personales y del hogar para sus clientes que le visitan.

Se dedica a esta labor desde hace 7 años habiendo alcanzado mejoras gracias a sus grandes esfuerzos y al apoyo brindado por Ceprodel, el cual le ha servido para mejorar su condición. Hoy en día una vez mas busca el apoyo de Ceprodel para obtener un crédito que le permita la compra de los productos para su negocio. Ella posee un total de 18 créditos habiéndose destacado en el cumplimiento de los pagos de cada uno de estos.

loans.use: Purchase products to be sold at general store.

loans.name: Maria Lina

texts.es:
María Lina is requesting a loan in order to invest in the improvement of her home by adding on an additional room.

She has worked as an elementary school teacher for 34 years. She has three children; the oldest is 27 years old and is in his last year of university study, her daughter is 19 years old and is in her fifth year of secondary education, and the youngest is 15 years old and is in his third year of secondary education.

María Lina has been an exemplary woman with her children and in the community of La Fonseca in Nueva Guinea as she has stood out for being responsible, honest, hardworking and an excellent mother and teacher of the rural students in the area. In addition, she is one of the few people that have fought so that her community can have better development. Her dream is to have a decent home, good health, job stability and that her children continue studying.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Maria Lina está solicitando su financiamiento para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda como es la construcción de una habitación. Trabaja como docente de Educación primaria desde hace 34 años. Doña Maria Lina tiene tres hijos, el mayor de 27 años de edad está estudiando su ultimo año en la Universidad, su otra hija de 19 años estudia su quinto año de educación secundaria y el hijo menor de 15 años estudia 3er año de educación secundaria. La profesora María Lina ha sido una mujer ejemplar con sus hijos y con la comunidad de la colonia la Fonseca en Nueva Guinea ya que se ha destacado por ser responsable , honesta, trabajadora, excelente madre y maestra para los niños campesinos de esa colonia , además es una de las pocas personas que ha luchado por su colonia para que tenga un mejor desarrollo, su sueño es tener una vivienda digna, salud, estabilidad laboral, y que sus dos hijos sigan estudiando.

loans.use: Construction of a room in her house

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
Doña Josefina P. is from the town of Chinandega and for a living she has been selling fruit for the past 10 years at the market Santa Ana. The start was difficult as her working capital was $25 (twenty five dollars) but as time went by sales have improved and now she is supporting her family.

Today she needs economic resources to buy fruits and sell them, and therefore she has approached Ceprodel hoping to obtain a loan that will allow her to continue improving her standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

La dama Josefina P. es originaria de la ciudad de Chinandega y se dedica desde hace 10 años al negocio de venta de frutas las cuales las comercializa en el mercado Santa Ana de la ciudad. Sus inicios fueron muy difíciles por lo que inicio a vender con un capital de trabajo de U$ 25 (Veinticinco dólares) y a medida que el tiempo ha venido transcurriendo ha mejorado sus ventas y llevado el sustento a su casa de habitación.

La necesidad que hoy en día ella está atravesando es que necesita el recurso económico para obtener las frutas y venderlas, por eso es que busca el apoyo en Ceprodel esperando que su crédito sea otorgado y de esta manera continuar con el mejoramiento de su nivel de vida.

loans.use: Purchase fruit to increase sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase 20 cases of beer

loans.name: Evangelina Segunda

texts.es:
Small business owner Evangelina L. A. is 40 years old, married and with 6 children who go to school. It has been 6 years since Evangelina sells perfumes so she can help her husband with the expenses of the home. Mrs Evangelina’s clients are women that work at governmental offices such as the department of education, the department of health and also some private offices. Evangelina has to send to the capital biweekly payments since these products are property of a business named Vogel, but most of her clients make monthly payments instead and therefore, she needs financing to be able to pay the debts and to recover the monthly expenses. She also needs to buy more products to maintain enough inventory at hand for her clients, products include lipsticks, face creams, perfumes etc…. This is the list of items Evangelica needs to purchase; 3 Crystal perfumes each US$ 35, two perfumes Celebrity each US$ 18, six deodorants Life each US$ 3, five lipsticks each US$ 4 , Three facial creams New Alternative each US$ 20 , four creams for cellulite each US$ 14, three perfumes 300 km/h each US$ 14, four packs of New Clinical products each US$ 47 .

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer

La microempresaria Evangelina L. A. tiene 40 años de edad, es casada con 6 hijos, todos estudian y desde hace 6 años se dedica a la venta de perfumes para apoyar a su marido en los gastos del hogar. Doña Evangelina tiene como clientes a mujeres que trabajan en oficinas publicas como el ministerio de educacion, el ministerio de salud y algunas oficinas privadas como el chino chow entre otras. Sin embargo ella tiene que enviar a la capital pagos quincenales ya que estos productos son propiedad de empresa vogel, pero la mayoria de sus clientas les pagan al mes por lo que necesita financiamiento para poder asumir esas deudas y recuperarlas mensualmente, ademas para poder comprar mas productos ya que sus clientas le compran estos productos por lo menos una vez cada mes, en algunos casos pintura de labios, en otros perfumes, en otros cremas en fin una sola clienta siempre le compra algo. Quiere comprar los siguientes productos los cuales ya estan encargados: 3 perfumes marca Cristal a US$ 35 Dolares cada uno Aura, 2 perfumes Celebrity a US$ 18 dolares cada uno, 6 desodorantes Life a US$ 3 dolares cada uno, 5 pinturas de labios a US$ 4 dolares cada una, 3 cremas a new alternative a US$ 20 dolares cada una, 4 cremas de celulitis a US$ 14 dolares cada una, 3 perfumes 300 km/h a US$ 14 dolares cada uno, 4 paquetes a new clinical a US$ 47 dolares cada paquete.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

payments.comment: La cuota real de pago es de $ 43.75 dólares

loans.name: Essoyomewè

texts.fr:
Born in Kara in the Koza prefecture in 1984, Mr. Essoyomewè T. is single and opened a shop selling basic goods in the Agoè neighborhood of Lomé. He is responsible for his two younger brothers who are both attending school. He has already received one loan and promptly repaid it. He envisions restocking his supply of basic goods and is seeking this loan to buy five bags of aromatic rice, two cartons of tomatoes, 20 cartons of pasta, and 30 packets of mineral water.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer

Né à Kara dans la préfecture de la Koza en 1984, Monsieur T. Essoyomewè est célibataire et a ouvert une boutique de vente des produits de premières nécessités dans le quartier d’Agoè à Lomé. Il assure la charge de ses deux petits frères qui vont tous à l’école. Il a une fois obtenu du crédit et a remboursé promptement. Il envisage refaire le ravitaillement de ces produits de premières nécessités et sollicite ce prêt pour acheter 5 sacs de riz parfumé, 2 cartons de tomates, 20 cartons de pâtes alimentaires et 30 sachets d’eau minérale.

loans.use: Purchase basic goods merchandise

loans.name: Noemí

texts.es:
More than four years ago, Noemí's mother helped her open a shop selling electric devices in the Túpac Amaru market in Juliaca. Noemí began her business with very little merchandise, but with a talent for the business and help from her mother, she increased the size of her shop. Thanks to her earnings, Noemí can cover her university tuition. While this diligent girl works toward her goals, her beloved mother helps her by minding the store. Mother and daughter work together to increase their earnings through improvements to the store, but in order to realize these improvements they must first finance them. They are sure that your collaboration will help them realize their dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace más de 4 años. Noemí con apoyo de su madre decidió dedicarse a la venta de artefactos dentro del mercado Túpac Amaru de la ciudad de Juliaca. Ella inició su negocio con poca mercadería pero con la predisposición y la importante colaboración de su querida madre logró ampliar e implementar su espacio de ventas.Gracias a los ingresos económicos que obtiene con este negocio, Noemí, puede cubrir los gastos que le demandan sus estudios superiores y mientras ésta diligente muchacha va en busca de sus objetivos su querida madre la apoya con la atención de su negocio y juntas tratan de mejorar sus ingresos económicos.Tiene muchos proyectos con su negocio y para concretarlos requiere de financiamiento, está segura que recibiendo vuestra colaboración cristalizará gran parte de sus anhelos.

loans.use: Injection of capital to improve her supply of electrical goods.

loans.name: Maysa

texts.es:
Maysa is an esthetician by profession, and since childhood she has been interested in this line of work. When Maysa finished high shool she didn't think twice before enrolling in cosmetology school. Now, after many years of practice, Maysa returned to school as a professor of cosmetology at the Henry Fayol Institute in Juliaca. In addition to teaching, Maysa earnes extra income by making delicious chocolates that are distributed in stores across the city of Juliaca. Thanks to these jobs, which Maysa does with pleasure and efficiency, she can cover the costs of providing an education for her beloved daughter, who she would like to send to university. Maysa is sure that with the help of your good heart she can achieve her dream.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

Maysa, es cosmetóloga de profesión, desde niña demostró sus cualidades y habilidades para este trabajo, es por ello que cuando apenas concluyó sus estudios secundarios y sin pensarlo dos veces decidió estudiar cosmetología, ahora tras varios años de ejercer esta labor se desenvuelve como profesora de cosmetología en el instituto Henry Fayol de la ciudad de Juliaca.Adicionalmente a esta labor Maysa encontró otra manera de generar ingresos extras elaborando deliciosos chocolates que son distribuidos en las principales bodeguitas de la ciudad de Juliaca. Gracias a estas actividades que desempeña gustosa y eficazmente puede cubrir los gastos de educación de su querida hija, a quien desea ofrecerle estudios superiores y está segura que con la ayuda de tu buen corazón podrá concretarlo.

loans.use: Injection of capital to optimize sales and prepare her delicious chocolates.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Oihanet

texts.es:
Oihanet is from the Putina district. When she became a single parent, Oihanet decided to open her own business, selling bread, cheese, and meat at the Rinconada mine. The mine is frigid and far from her hometown, but Oihanet makes sacrifices to undergo constant long journeys to transport her merchandise to the people of Rinconada. This hard-working mom perseveres out of love for her son, and is prepared to dedicate all of her energy to the business. Oihanet is planning to increase her capital to invest in flour and other supplies to make her delicious bread. Oihanet hopes to appeal to your generous heart.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

Oihanet, es natural del distrito de Putina, desde que se convirtió en padre y madre de su hijo, decidió emprender su negocio de venta de pan, queso y carne en la mina Rinconada, lugar muy frígido y distante de su ciudad natal.Este trabajo le resulta muy sacrificado a Oihanet, porque constantemente tiene que emprender largos y pesados viajes para llevar su mercadería y ofrecerlos a los habitantes de dicha localidad, esta trabajadora madre por amor a su hijo está dispuesta a seguir adelante poniendo su mayor esfuerzo y dedicación en su negocio, para ello tiene planeado aumentar el monto de su capital, dinero que invertirá para adquirir harina e insumos para la preparación de sus delicioso panes. Oihanet espera sensibilizar tu generoso corazón.

loans.use: Injection of capital to increase her production of bread.

loans.name: Maida

texts.es:
Maida is has worked at innumerable jobs in order to earn enough to provide education and a peaceful life for her three beloved children. This mission gives Maida the strength to continue working persistently. A few years ago she sold food and juice from a mobile cart in the city of Cuzco, but since then she has separated from her spouse and decided to move to the city of Juliaca in order to continue living with her children. She hopes to give them the greatest gift of their lives; an education, which will be possible thanks to the income that she earns from her current business. Maida sells a variety of toys in the Rinconda mine, a tough job that is also satisfying. Maida must constantly make long, exhausting journeys to transport her merchandise, but with her earnings she can enjoy peace of mind with her children. Maida would like to increase the amount of capital invested in her business in order to earn more to benefit her beloved children.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

Maida, es una dama que a lo largo de estos años se ha dedicado a innumerables actividades con el fin de ofrecerles educación y tranquilidad a sus 3 amados hijos, quienes le dan fuerzas suficientes para continuar persistiendo en la vida.Hace algunos años vendía comida y jugo en forma ambulatoria en la ciudad Imperial del Cuzco, pero desde que se separó de su esposo decidió radicar en la ciudad de Juliaca y desde entonces trata de mantener unidos a sus queridos hijos a quines desea brindarles el regalo más grande de sus vidas, su educación, todo esto es posible gracias a los beneficios que obtiene con su negocio de venta de una gran variedad de juguetes en la mina Rinconada, este trabajo le resulta esforzado y satisfactorio al mismo tiempo, porque constantemente tiene que emprender largos y exhaustos viajes para trasladar su mercadería y con los beneficios que obtiene puede gozar de tranquilidad junto a los suyos.Su deseo es incrementar su capital de inversión en beneficio de sus amados hijos.

loans.use: Injection of capital to improve the products supplied.

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
Laura Anita is 37 years old, and a teacher by profession. She now sells groceries in her small shop, but sees the lack of jobs as an obstacle to the growth of her business. With help from her beloved spouse, Laura Anita works hard each day to contribute to her son's wellbeing. She hopes to increase the size of her store to convert it into a minimart, and is asking for a loan to do just that.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora, Laura Anita de 37 años de edad, es maestra de profesión y se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en su pequeña bodega debido a que el desarrollo de su labor se ve obstaculizada por la falta de empleos. Con ayuda de su amado esposo se esfuerza a diario para contribuir con el cumplimiento de los objetivos de su querido hijo.Desea incrementar e implementar su espacio de labor para convertirlo dentro de poco en un minimarket y a ese anhelo atiende su petición de un préstamo.

loans.use: An injection of capital to increase her working space.

loans.name: Flor

texts.es:
Establishing and managing her little grocery store has given much satisfaction to Flor, who, after a lot of thought, decided to seek a loan in order to outfit and expand the workspace she had converted into a mini market. The project was undertaken for the benefit of her beloved family and with the collaboration and help of her beloved husband. Your generosity could help make her noble aspiration become a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

Su desempeño y adecuada administración de su pequeña bodeguita le ha otorgado mucha satisfacción a Flor, quien después de mucho meditar a decidido solicitar un préstamo para implementar y ampliar su espacio de labor a fin de convertirlo en un mini mercado, para beneficio de su amada familia y con la importante colaboración y ayuda de su amado esposo.Vuestros generosos corazones podrán contribuir a concretar este noble deseo.

loans.use: To outfit and expand a small grocery store

loans.name: Ysolida

texts.es:
Ysolida is a working mother who, alongside agricultural activities, is dedicated to the sale of delicious meals in a well travelled area in the city. Thanks to her adept seasoning and her colorful presentation, she already enjoys a numerous and faithful clientele. The warm welcome bestowed upon her by her clients leads Ysolida to seek a loan that will enable her to expand and improve her sales space, with the objective of providing adequate attention to each of her customers. Your support will make the fulfillment of this noble mother's desire possible.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

YSOLIDA, es una trabajadora madre que se dedica a demás de las actividades agrícolas a la venta de deliciosos platillos en una zona muy transitada de su ciudad, gracias a su buena sazón y a sus coloridos platillos ya cuenta con un numeroso público fiel a su cocina.La gran acogida de sus clientes la conduce a solicitar un préstamo para ampliar y mejorar su espacio de ventas con el objetivo de otorgarles una adecuada atención a cada uno de sus consumidores.Tu importante colaboración posibilitará el cumplimiento del anhelo de esta noble madre.

loans.use: Construction of a small booth for the sale of meals

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia is the owner of a motor taxi and also works selling meals. She has two small children as a single mother and has a cousin who is in charge of driving her vehicle. Slivia needs a loan in order to invest in the maintenance and repair of her tool of work, her motor taxi, as well as to improve her food sales and to eventually construct a kiosk for selling her meals with greater ease. Let's help this mother who, with strength and dedication, continues working tirelessly to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

Silvia, es propietaria de un mototaxi y al mismo tiempo se dedica a la venta de comida, tiene dos hijos menores. Ella es madre soltera y tiene a su primo quien se encarga de la conducción de su vehículo.Silvia requiere una suma de dinero en préstamo para invertirlos en el mantenimiento y arreglo de su herramienta de trabajo, mejorar su venta de comida y posteriormente construir su kiosco para vender sus platillos cómodamente. Apoyemos a esta madre que con esfuerzo y dedicación sigue trabajando arduamente por progresar.

loans.use: To repair a motor taxi

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana is a young, working mother in a family that is employed in clothing sales. In her free time, she provides domestic cleaning services. Her desire to improve the quality of both her life and the lives of her two beloved children motivated her to seek a loan in order to increase her clothing sales inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

Ana, es una trabajadora y joven madre de familia que se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir, y en sus ratos libres ofrece servicios de limpieza integral a domicilio.El deseo de mejorar la calidad de vida de sus amados hijos y de brindarles bienestar para su pleno desarrollo la motivan a solicitar un préstamo para incrementar la oferta de sus prendas de vestir.

loans.use: Increase product inventory

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria works in the sale of irapay leaves, which are used to cover the roofs of country houses as well as for other uses. She has sold this product for a long time, but a small disadvantage exists in that her product is kept outdoors; she needs to construct an adequate space to protect her inventory from the rain. Gloria is 40 years old and is the mother of five children. She counts on the support of her beloved husband, Geu, who helps her with her business. Gloria wants to continue surpassing her own goals, and for this reason is seeking a loan to achieve her plan. She awaits your kind-hearted assistance.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Gloria se dedica a la venta de hojas de irapay, que sirven para cubrir los techos de las casas de campo y para otros fines de uso. Ella vende este producto desde hace mucho tiempo, pero existe un pequeño inconveniente ya que sus productos se encuentran a la intemperie y necesita construir un espacio adecuado para protegerlos de la lluvia. Gloria de 40 años de edad es madre de 05 hijos, cuenta con el apoyo de su querido esposo el señor Geu, quien la apoya en su negocio. La señora Gloria quiere seguir superándose y para ello estima de un préstamo para cumplir con su propósito. Ella espera la ayuda de tu noble corazón.

loans.use: Immediate construction of a warehouse to better maintain inventory

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es:
Noemi is requesting a loan to invest in the improvement of her house, by plastering the walls. She has worked for at the Rafaela Herrera school in the La Fonseca neighborhood in Nueva Guinea for 10 years. Currently, she is in her fourth year at the University of URACCAN. She fulfills her job duties with much responsibility and honesty and with a lot of desire to improve herself.

She has 3 children, the oldest daughter is 20 years old and is in her third year of university study, her younger son is 14 years old and in his fourth year of secondary school and the youngest son is 10 years old and in the fifth grade. Her husband also works as a teacher, as such they both contribute to covering the household expenses. Her dream is to have job stability, good health and a decent home.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Noemi está solicitando su refinanciamiento para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda como es repellar la casa, labora para la Escuela Rafaela Herrera en colonia la Fonseca en Nueva Guinea desde hace 10 años, actualmente está estudiando su cuarto año en la Universidad URACCAN, desempeña su labor con mucha responsabilidad, honestidad y mucho deseo de superación personal.

Tiene 3 hijos, la hija mayor de 20 años estudia su tercer año en la Universidad, el otro tiene 14 años estudia su 4to año de educación secundaria y su hijo menor de 10 años estudia 5to grado, su esposo también labora como docente y ambos comparten los gastos familiares, su sueño es tener estabilidad laboral, una vivienda digna y salud.

loans.use: Plastering the walls of her house

loans.name: Leyli Del Carmen

texts.es:
Leyli is requesting a loan to invest in the improvement of her house by constructing a kitchen.

She has worked as a teacher at Vigarmy Flores school for 14 years and has two children; the older is 17 years old and is in his fourth year of secondary school and the younger is 14 years old and in her first year at the Rubén Darío Institute.

Leyli has to travel every day to the Río Plata to teach children in that area. Her dream is to have job stability, good health and a decent home with all the basic conditions that any person would want.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

La clienta Leyli está solicitando su refinanciamiento para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda como es la construcción de una cocina.

Labora como docente de la Escuela Vigarmy Flores desde hace 14 años, esta cliente tiene dos hijos, el mayor de 17 años de edad el cual está estudiando su cuarto año de educación secundaria y la hija menor de 14 años estudia su 1er año en el Instituto Rubén Darío.

Leyli todos los dias tiene que viajar a colonia Río Plata a impartir el pan de la enseñanza a niños de esa colonia, su sueño es tener estabilidad laboral, salud y una vivienda digna con todas las condiciones básicas como todo ciudadano aspira.

loans.use: Construction of kitchen

loans.name: Claribel Del Carmen

texts.es:
Claribel is requesting a loan to invest in the improvement of her house, by plastering the walls and putting a floor in the kitchen. She has worked as a teacher at César Augusto Salinas Pinell school for 16 years and has three children. Claribel is a hard worker that, in addition to teaching, works in the mayor's office during the day and at night gives classes secondary students.

Her dream is to have job stability and a decent house with all the basic conditions that any person would want. She is a person known in Nueva Guinea for being a responsible and sociable person.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Claribel está solicitando su refinanciamiento para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda como es repellar y ponerle el piso a la cocina, trabaja como docente de la Escuela César Augusto Salinas Pinell desde hace 16 años, tiene tres hijos, doña Claribel es una mujer luchadora que además de docente trabaja en la Alcaldia de dia, y de noche imparte clase a jóvenes de Secundaria.

Su sueño es tener estabilidad laboral y una vivienda digna con todas las condiciones básicas como todo ciudadana aspira, ella es una persona reconocida en Nueva Guinea por ser responsable y sociable

loans.use: Plastering the walls and putting a floor in her kitchen

loans.name: Amadeo

texts.es:
Amadeo R. is requesting a loan in order to invest in his small business. He lives, together with his wife and two sons, in Almendro. His oldest son, who is 16 years old, is in his third year of secondary education and the other is 11 years old and in the fifth grade.

With effort he has managed to establish his small business in his house, which enables him to offer perishable and non-perishable items. With this he is able to generate income to guarantee the well-being of his family and grow his small business. In addition, Amadeo works selling livestock which helps with the household expenses and improve his income, at the same time improving the family living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Amadeo R. está solicitando su crédito para invertirlo en su pequeño negocio, habita junto a su familia compuesta por su esposa y 2 hijos en su casa ubicada en el Almendro, su hijo mayor de 16 años estudia su tercer año de educación secundaria y el otro de 11 años de edad estudia su 5to grado.

Con esfuerzo propio ha logrado establecer su pequeño negocio en su casa de habitacion, lo que le permite ofrecer productos perecederos y no perecederos el cual le brinda ingresos para garantizar el bienestar familiar y consolidar su pequeño negocio; además don Amadeo se dedica a comercializar ganado el que apoya los gastos del hogar y mejorar su ingreso, al mismo tiempo que mejora las condiciones de vida familiar

loans.use: Buying perishable items for his store

loans.name: Sagrario Guadalupe

texts.es:
Sagrario is requesting a loan which she will use to improve her home by adding a bedroom. She has worked as a teacher at the Rubén Darío Institute for 31 years.

Sagrario has 3 daughters and one son. All of them are grown and are teachers. Sagrario is an exemplary woman in the town of New Guinea. She is known as a responsible, honest and hard-working woman who also has been a good example for her students. Although her children’s father did not support her family, Sagrario always worked hard to make sure her children studied and found gainful employment. Her dreams are to have good health and a decent home.

Translated by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva volunteer

Doña Sagrario está solicitando su crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda como es construcción de una habitación. Trabaja como docente del Instituto Rubén Darío, desde hace 31 años,

La profesora Sagrario tiene 3 hijas y 1 hijo varón, todos son mayores de edad y se desempeñan como docentes. Es una mujer ejemplar en el Municipio de Nueva Guinea por ser responsable, honesta, luchadora y ha sido un buen ejemplo para con sus alumnos. A pesar que nunca tuvo la ayuda del padre de sus hijos ella siempre luchó para que sus hijos estudiaran y consiguieran un trabajo para mantenerse. Su sueño es tener salud y tener una vivienda digna.

loans.use: Bedroom construction

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es:
Natalia is a native of the District of Paucarcolla, but for more than 2 decades she has lived in the city of Puno. When she arrived in this city, she worked with great effort at various activities along with her beloved husband and children. Upon seeing that her children were already approaching the conclusion of their secondary school studies and wanting to pursue a professional career, she saw the need to open a secure business that would bring in good income. In this way, she began travelling sales of API with delicious cheese empanadas, a typical Bolivian dish that Natalia fortunately knows very well how to prepare. Within a short time after establishing her business, she felt great satisfaction because, thanks to the contributions of all of her family, she was able to establish a regular clientele. Her customers expressed a desire for greater comfort; for this reason, Natalia's family rented a space where they now offer their delicious sandwiches. In this venture, Natalia would like to secure a loan in order to expand her sales space.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

Natalia es natural del distrito D. Paucarcolla, pero desD. hace más D. 2 décadas vive en la ciudad D. Puno, cuando llegó a esta ciudad trabajó arduamente en diferentes actividades junto a su querido esposo e hijos y al ver que sus hijos ya venían concluyendo sus estudios secundarios y deseaban seguir una carrera profesional se vio en la necesidad D. abrir un negocio seguro que le brinD. buenos ingresos, es así que inició la venta en forma ambulatoria D. API con deliciosas empanaditas con queso, plato típico Boliviano que para su fortuna doña Natalia sabe preparar muy bien.Este negocio al poco tiempo D. haberse establecido le fue llenando D. satisfacción, porque gracias a la colaboración D. toda su familia lograron captar asiduos clientes que al mismo tiempo le solicitaban mayor comodidad, es por ello que alquilaron un local en donD. ofrecen este delicioso bocadillo.Natalia en esta oportunidad desea obtener un préstamo para ampliar su espacio D. ventas.

loans.use: To expand a sales space

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana left her hometown of Desaguadero, Peru with dreams of forming a home filled with love alongside the father of her son. However, a few months after moving to the city of Juliaca the two decided to separate. While this event caused Juana extreme disappointment at first, she put herself to work in a business selling a variety of products (candles, combs, batteries, etc.) as a walking vendor. Through much hard work and strong will, she was able to grow her business little by little. Thanks to these long years of sacrifice and dedication she currently has the satisfaction of providing a roof and an education for her beloved son Oscar, who is 10 years old. Juana still has many plans for her business and she is certain that with your help she will be able to put her projects into action.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Juana, salió de su ciudad natal, Desaguadero, con muchas ilusiones de formar un hogar lleno de amor al lado del padre de su hijo, pero a pocos meses de radicar en la ciudad de Juliaca decidieron separarse, luego de este hecho que en un principio le causo decepción se dispuso a dedicarse al negocio de venta de chiflerías (velas, peines, pilas, etc) en forma ambulatoria, pero Juana con voluntad y mucho empeño logro poco a poco ampliar su negocio, gracias a estos largos años de sacrificio y dedicación en este negocio actualmente tiene la satisfacción de ofrecerle un techo propio y sobre todo educación a su amado hijo Oscar de 10 años de edad.Juana aún tiene muchos planes con su negocio y está segura que recibiendo tu apoyo podrá encaminar sus proyectos.

loans.use: Injection of capital in order to improve her inventory and sales.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
“El Encuentro” or “The Encounter” is the name that Yolanda chose to christen her restaurant. Yolanda is a diligent and loving mother of three who began her work selling anticuchos (quechua for cut stew meat) as a walking saleswoman. After making her business popular through her charisma, good humor, and above all the great service that she always offers to her clients, she was able to save enough money to open her own small restaurant. Currently she counts on a large number of regular clients that to her satisfaction remain very satisfied by the excellent service that they receive. As time passes Yolanda continues to see considerable growth in the quantity of requests and clients, and she wants to offer them a comfortable experience during their visit. For this reason she plans to expand and furnish her restaurant and to this end she hopes to receive a response soon from your generous hearts.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

“El Encuentro”, es el nombre con el que doña Yolanda decidió bautizar a su restaurante, ésta diligente y amorosa madre de 3 queridos hijos inició su labor vendiendo anticuchos en forma ambulatoria, luego de hacerse popular por su carisma, alegría y sobre todo por la buena atención que siempre ofreció a sus clientes, pudo ahorrar lo suficiente y abrir su pequeño restaurante, actualmente cuenta con gran cantidad de asiduos clientes que para su agrado quedan muy satisfechos por la buena atención que reciben en este espacio.Doña Yolanda con el transcurso de los días va incrementando considerablemente la cantidad de pedidos y clientes a quienes desea ofrecerles una cómoda estadía durante su permanencia, es por ello que planea ampliar e implementar su local y con ese fin espera recibir de vuestros generosos corazones pronta respuesta.

loans.use: To expand and furnish a small restaurant

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.es:
Lucrecia never imagined that she would be able to earn a good income through her wine selling business. It all started a few years ago when this diligent mother decided to travel for a few days to the city of Tacna, Peru. On the way back to her hometown of Juliaca, Peru, she decided to purchase some wines in order to offer them to her family and neighbors. From that day forward this business has allowed her to provide post-secondary education to her two adorable children, for whom she feels very proud and satisfied as a mother. Each weekend she offers her wines in her hometown market. Her clients come regularly to purchase Lucrecia’s pleasant wines. On week days Lucrecia helps her husband in his noble labor as a tailor in order to further assist with family finances. Lucrecia and her husband are no longer responsible economically for their children, but they want to continue to improve their income. For this reason, they need generous hearts that will offer them the opportunity to increase their investment capital

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Lucrecia, nunca imaginó que con su negocio de venta de vino podría obtener buenos ingresos económicos, todo empezó cuando hace algunos años esta diligente madre decidió viajar por algunos días a la ciudad de Tacna, al retornar a su ciudad natal, Juliaca, decidió comprar vinos para ofrecerlos a sus familiares y vecinos, desde entonces hasta la fecha este negocio le ha permitido brindar estudios superiores a sus 2 adorables hijos por quienes se siente muy orgullosa y realizada como madre.Cada fin de semana oferta sus vinos en el mercado dominical de su ciudad natal, lugar a donde sus asiduos clientes se aproximan para adquirir sus agradables vinos, los días laborables para seguir colaborando con los ingresos económicos de la familia doña Lucrecia apoya activamente a su esposo en su noble labor de sastre.Doña Lucrecia y su esposo ya no tienen ninguna responsabilidad económica con sus hijos, pero desean mejorar sus ingresos, para ello requieren de corazones generosos que le brinden la oportunidad de mejorar su capital de inversión.

loans.use: Injection of capital in order to improve her wine-selling business

loans.name: La Paz De Dios (The Peace Of God) Group

texts.en:
Pedro is part of the L. Paz D. Dios Bank of Hope with Esperanza International, which means "The Peace of God." Like the other people of his group, Pedro lives in a rural community just outsiD. of El Seibo in the Dominican Republic. The families in this area live in small houses maD. of scrap tin and wood. The best of the possible living situations is a cement-block house. These houses generally consist of only one room for the whole family to live together. Pedro has two grown children, ages 21 and 23, along with two grandchildren. Some of his children and grandchildren live in a neighboring province of El Seibo, and he loves to visit them.

To support his family, Pedro has a small business buying and selling a variety of staple foods and vegetables. He has already successfully repaid 5 loans to Esperanza International. With this next loan, Pedro hopes to further grow his business and continue improving his living situation. He wants to be able to proviD. the best for his grandchildren, including a good education, so that they will get the most out of life.

loans.use: To grow his little business and better provide for his family

loans.name: Randa

texts.en: Randa, a 36-year-old mother of one child, owns a small clothes shop in Saida South, Lebanon, and this is her first loan request from Al Majmoua. She needs $500 to purchase summer clothes and swimsuits to meet the demand of her clients. Randa prefers to borrow the money from Al Majmoua rather than ask her husband, for she considers that her financial independence is at stake. We believe Randa is a hard worker who will make sure to fully repay her loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase summer clothes and swimsuits for her shop.

loans.name: Salim

texts.en: Salim E. S. is 53 years old and lives in Saida South, Lebanon, where he owns a photography studio, photographs events and is a specialist in picture "montage". This is Salim’s first loan request from Al Majmoua. He needs $1,100 as working capital to purchase cameras, film rolls and photo frames. Salim, a hard worker, devotes very long hours to his livelihood to cover events and increase his revenues, thereby providing good living conditions for his wife and three children.

loans.use: To purchase cameras, film rolls and pictures frames.

loans.name: Fares

texts.en:
Fares, a 46-year-old father of 11 children who lives in Saida South, Lebanon, owns a small shop that sells vegetables and fruits and has been a client of Majmoua since 2006. His first loan from Majmoua’s, in the amount of $1,000, was to improve the decor of his business and diversify the fruits and vegetables he sells in his shop. He then requested a second loan for $1,000 to pay the university fees of his eldest son. These two loans were fully repaid on time and Fares has proven to be a very reliable borrower. He now requests a third loan of $1,000 to again pay the university fees of his son.

Fares is ready to give all he can in order to send all of his children to university as he dreams of a better future for them.

loans.use: To pay his son's university fees.

loans.name: Sabah

texts.en: Sabah is a 40-year-old mother of five children who lives in Saida South, Lebanon. She owns a lingerie shop and has been working in this sector for the past 12 years. This is the first time Sabah has requested a loan from Al Majmoua, having heard about the institution from a friend who is already a Majmoua client. Sabah needs $800 to purchase new lingerie outfits based on the demand from her clients. She is a trustworthy person who will make sure to fully repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase new lingerie outfits to be sold in her shop.

loans.name: Bechir

texts.en:
Bechir, 25 years old, lives and works in Saida South, Lebanon, where he owns a small bakery shop that specializes in selling "Manakish," the famous Lebanese "pizza" that everybody has for breakfast. Previously, Bechir received a $1,000 loan from Al Majmoua which he used to buy a new oven for his business. He now has the opportunity to enlarge his business and is requesting another loan of $1,000 to purchase fixed assets such as a dough mixer, new stands, some tables and chairs.

Bechir is a young but very responsible man who wants to make sure he can provide the best for his wife and his child.

loans.use: To purchase a dough mixer, new stands, tables and chairs.

loans.name: Najib

texts.en: Najib, 37 years old and married with no children, lives in Saida South, Lebanon, where he owns a home appliance shop that sells a variety of accessories and paintings. Najib is a very ambitious entrepreneur and this is the third loan he has requested from Majmoua. With the previous two loans, he bought more products to sell in his shop. This time he needs $1,200 in order to open a new spare parts shop and therefore increase his revenues. Najib is the type of person who knows exactly what he wants and how to reach his goals.

loans.use: To open a new spare parts shop.

loans.name: Irma Campoverde

texts.en:
Irma belongs to the Medalla Milagrosa Village Bank and lives in Pamplona Alta in San Juan D. Miraflores.

She is married and has 5 children and 2 grandchildren. She sells clothes which she gives to her friends at home. She also learned to make pullovers, a business that helped her to educate her children and have another income for the household. One of her daughter's is abroad at the moment and helps her with the business. 

Irma is soliciting a 3000 soles loan so as to purchase more merchandise, pullovers and vests to take advantage of the season. 

Now her children are grown-ups, they help her but Irma still has dreams and aims to achieve, such as setting up a business in her own house. She would like to have a bookstore and proviD. a photocopying service.

loans.use: Irma is soliciting a 3000 soles loan so as to purchase more merchandise, pullovers and vests to take advantage of the season.

loans.name: Rosalina Elizabeth's Group

texts.en:
Rosalina and José belong to the Medalla Milagrosa Village Bank and live in Pamplona Alta in San Juan de Miraflores.

Rosalina lives with her husband and has 4 children. 3 are over 18 and are working and the youngest is 12 and is still in school. Rosalina made lots of activities that gave her the opportunity to pull through. She sells sugar cane, juices and braised sausages. She also has a mototaxi.

José lives with his wife and has a 1-year-old son. He is a mobile peanut and bean man. 

Rosalina and José are soliciting a 1600 soles loan so that they can invest in their microenterprises. 

Rosalina wants to own her own store and José wants to grow his business.

loans.use: Rosalina and José are soliciting a 1600 soles loan so that they can invest in their microenterprises.

loans.name: Basilidesa Hidelisa's Group

texts.en:
Hidelisa, Luisa and Jacqueline belong to the Medalla Milagrosa Village Bank.

Hidelisa is married and has 3 children over 18. She dedicates herself to selling clothes and cakes. She also sells cosmetics. She has several businesses, she never worked in just one business.

Luisa is a single mother and has a 4-year-old daughter. She sells sweet bean biscuits and sweets depending on season. 

Jacqueline lives with her husband and has 2 children. She has a phone booth business she gradually did up in a place owned by her father-in-law. She also does printing and re-transcription.

Hidelisa, Luisa and Jacqueline are asking for a 2600 soles loan to use their capital for purchasing merchandise for their businesses. Jacqueline wants to buy 3 units for her microenterprise.

loans.use: Hidelisa, Luisa and Jacqueline are asking for a 2600 soles loan to use their capital for purchasing merchandise for their businesses. Jacqueline wants to buy 3 units for her microenterprise.

loans.name: Luzmila's Group

texts.en:
Aurelia and Luzmila belong to the Village Bank Lila.

Aurelia is married, 36 years old and has 7 children. Aurelia sells clothing at the different fairs of the region every Saturday and Sunday. During the other days of the week she takes care of her children and makes sure they do their studies.

On the other hand, Luzmila is married, 39 years old and has 4 children. Luzmila, along with her spouse, are artisans and make fabrics and weavings such as tapestries – and they have commercialized their products into an export business.

Aurelia and Luzmila need loans of 600 soles and 1000 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of skirts, blouses, sweaters, and wool of alpaca.

The dreams of Aurelia and Luzmila are that their children become professionals, to grow their business, to produce more and to export directly to the exterior market.

loans.use: Aurelia and Luzmila need loans of 600 soles and 1000 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of skirts, blouses, sweaters, and wool of alpaca.

loans.name: Hilda Lucila's Group

texts.en:
Hilda, Kati and Meyer belong to the Medalla Milagrosa Village Bank in San Juan de Miraflores.

Hilda lives with her husband and has 2 children, 10 and 3 years old. She began in business by selling sweets. Now and for 7 years, she has been selling boiling fowl.

Kati is married and she has a 11-month-old baby. She has been selling clothes for 2 years, granting facilities to her clients. Currently she is implementing a beauty salon that is going to open soon.

Meyer is single. He has been selling peanuts and beans for 5 years. He likes investing in merchandise to have more income.

Hilda, Kati and Meyer are soliciting a 3400 soles loan. Hilda and Meyer want to invest in merchandise for their businesses while Kati wants to invest in accessories for her beauty salon.

Hilda keeps a close eye on her children's education and is thinking about having another microenterprise. Kati’s beauty salon will be ready very soon and Meyer dreams of finishing his house and studying.

loans.use: Hilda, Kati and Meyer are soliciting a 3400 soles loan. Hilda and Meyer want to invest in merchandise for their businesses while Kati wants to invest in accessories for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Jacqueline Gaby's Group

texts.en:
Jacqueline, Silvia and Marlene belong to the Medalla Milagrosa Village Bank and live in San Juan de Miraflores.

Jacqueline lives with her husband. She has 4 children, 2 over 18, one 5-year-old child and a 10-month-old baby. She has an Internet business she has been running with her husband for the last 6 years. She now has 4 machines.

Marlene lives with her husband and has 4 children. She has had a cellar at home for 3 years and her business gradually grew.

Silvia is single and has 2 children. She started 3 years ago with a chifa restaurant and 2 years ago she implemented a poulterer’s as well.

Jacqueline, Silvia and Marlene are soliciting a 2000 soles loan. Jacqueline wants to strengthen her engine's power and purchase printer ink for her printers. Silvia wants to purchase merchandise for her microenterprise and Marlene wants to implement and improve her commercial premises.

Jacqueline aims at finishing building her house and extending space for her business. Silvia wants to have a well stocked shop with lots of products to attract more customers to enable her children to go to university. Marlene wants to have a store of her own and invest for her children studies.

loans.use: Jacqueline, Silvia and Marlene are soliciting a 2000 soles loan. Jacqueline wants to strengthen her engine's power and purchase printer ink for her printers. Silvia wants to purchase merchandise for her microenterprise and Marlene wants to implement and improve her commercial premises.

loans.name: Aref

texts.en: Aref, 27 years old, owns a perfume, accessories and "Faux-Bijoux" shop in Saida South, Lebanon. Specializing in Arabic perfumes, this is Aref's first contact with the lending Institution of Al Majmoua.  He needs a total amount of $2,000 to purchase goods for his shop, but we will be providing him with a $1,200 loan in order for him to first build a credit history with the institution.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for his perfume shop.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a member of the Village Bank Muyurina, which is named after the community which the members are from.
