They have a small mill at their home that generates about $1.50 each day for the family. They work very hard at the mill and need to purchase a small machine to shape the mill. Meav R. is asking for $400 to purchase that machine, which will aid in the work of the mill and increase production. They see this as a profitable venture that will not only increase their income, but also raise their standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase a small machine for the mill

loans.name: Ty

texts.en: Ty P., 41, is married and lives in the Kampong Cham province with her five children. She goes to the market to sell Khmer cake and daily makes around $1.50. Her husband is a farmer who also makes around $1.50 each day, and the family is also supported by three of the children who work in the garment factories. The rise of rice prices in Cambodia has made business difficult for Ty P. and she is asking for a loan of $800. With the loan monies, she would like to purchase a horse and a horse cart to run her business after she is done helping with the farming. She sees the possibility for expanding her business with the addition of a horse and cart and believes that these tools can increase her income. An income increase would be a great benefit to Ty P. and her family, allowing her family to meet its needs and to raise its standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase a horse and horse cart

loans.name: Lun

texts.en: Lun K. L., 26, is married and lives with her one young child in the Kampong Cham province. She works in a garment factory, making $3 each day, while her husband works security and makes $5 each day. The garment factory is not really close to her home, and the transportation costs have begun to accumulate for Lun K. L. and her husband. She is asking for a loan of $1200 to purchase a motorbike for commuting to and from work. The money she will be able to save on transportation costs will allow her to increase her income and possibly raise her standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Em

texts.en: Em L., age 24, has been selling groceries in front of her house since 2007. Each day she can make $8 in revenue. Her husband, Em Vutha, age 43, is a car mechanic, earning $10 per day. This couple has two children and both of them are too young too attend school. Em would like a loan to buy grocery inventory in bulk so that she will be able to fulfill her growing demand.

loans.use: To expand her grocery inventory.

loans.name: Chhin

texts.en:
Chhin S., 26, is married and lives in Kampong Cham province with her husband and two young children. She works as a farmer and is typically able to make $7 a day. The weather has made farming difficult in Cambodia this past year, and inflation has also been very steep. These factors mean difficult economic times for many Cambodians, as food prices have been high.

Chhin S.'s husband works as a taxi driver and typically makes $5 a day. She sees an opportunity to expand her husband’s business and wants to take out a loan to make a few purchases. She is asking for $1,200 to buy a trailer to connect to her husband's motorbike to transport heavy items, such as wood. She feels that expanding her husband’s business will allow him to increase his income and to raise the standard of living for the whole family.

loans.use: To buy a trailer for a motorbike

loans.name: Phann

texts.en: Phann S., 49, is married and lives with her husband and four of their children in Kampong Cham province. She works as a farmer, making $3 a day, while her husband does some farming and works as security guard, also making about $3 a day. The family is also supported by two children who work in local garment factories. During the rainy season, the couple also goes fishing and sells their catch. The weather has been poor for farming in Cambodia over the last year, and inflation has been out of control. These factors mean difficult economic times for many Cambodians. In light of these problems, Phann S. is asking for a loan of $1,000 to buy more farmland on which to grow rice. She sees this new rice field as a good economic investment, and will use it to increase her income and improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy farmland

loans.name: Rong

texts.en: Rong R., 65, is a widowed farmer who lives in Kampong Cham province with several of her ten children. She makes about $3 a day, but that is not enough to support her family, so three of her children send money from their work in garment factories. The weather in Cambodia has not been good for farming over the last year, and inflation has caused food prices to rise rapidly. These factors mean difficult times for many Cambodians, Rong R. included. In light of these economic problems, she is asking for a loan of $650 to buy more farmland to grow rice. She sees this new rice field as a great economic opportunity, because it can help to both increase her income and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy farmland

loans.name: Chhuon

texts.en: Chhuon S., 55, is married and lives in Kampong Cham province with her husband and their five children. She works in the local market, selling regional specialties like Khmer cakes and desserts, and makes about $2.50 a day. Her husband works in construction, and also makes $2.50 a day, but would like to begin fishing as a source of extra income. The family receives support from some of their older children, who work in Phnom Penh or have their own small businesses. Chhuon S. is seeking a loan of $300 to buy some fishing tools for her husband. This move into the fishing industry will increase the income of the family and allow them to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fishing equipment.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam S., 51, is married and lives in Kampong Cham province with her husband and one of her children. She raises fish and pigs and makes approximately $5 a day. Her husband makes $5 a day as well, working in law enforcement. They are also supported by their child, who raises chickens and makes $1 a day.

Inflation has made prices soar lately in Cambodia, and Sam S. knows that she must increase her income by expanding her business. She has applied for a loan of $1,000 to dig a well that will provide water for raising fish, and also to buy fish food. She sees this loan as a great economic opportunity and believes that she can raise her standard of living by making this careful investment.

loans.use: To dig a well and buy fish food

loans.name: Thul

texts.en: Thul S., 24, is married and lives with her husband and two young children in Kampong Cham province. She works in a garment factory, where she makes $3 a day, while her husband drives a motortaxi and makes around $4 a day. They have recently noticed that their motorbike is not holding up well, and they need to purchase a new one to maintain their income. Thul S. has applied to CREDIT for a loan of $500 to do this. They see this as way to increase the amount of money they can use to meet family expenses because they will not need to spend so much on repairs.

loans.use: To replace an old motorbike

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Phạm Thị Hà, 33 years old, joins the TYM Fund in 2004. She has two school aged children. Her family’s activities includes farming rice paddy, raising livestock and fishing. Altogether would earns her about 3,000,000 VND a month in average. She uses the funds of her loans to invest in fishing gears and nets. She is applying for a loan of 6,000,000 VND to invest in fishing gears.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Phạm Thị Hà 33 tuổi, Tham gia Quỹ Tình Thương năm 2004, nguồn thu nhập chính của gia đình chị là làm ruộng, chăn nuôi và đánh cá, ngoài công việc đồng ruộng và chăn nuôi những lúc nhàn dỗi chị lại tham gia đánh cá cùng chồng chị, với nghề đánh cá trong nhiều năm khi tham gia vay vốn của Quỹ, gia đình chị đều đầu tư vào mua sắm lưới và các đồ nghề phục vụ việc đánh bắt cá, công việc đánh bắt cá diễn ra đều đặn hàng ngày, bình quân mỗi ngày gia đình chị thu nhập từ đánh cá 100.000đ. chị có 2 con đang trong độ tuổi đi học. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 6.000.000đ mua sắm đồ nghề đánh cá. Thu nhập bình quân 3.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Agriculture

loans.name: Neang

texts.en:
Neang K. is a widowed garment worker who lives in Kampong Cham province with one of her children. Her sole means of support is a daily wage of $5 and the help she receives from her child, who is also a garment worker.

Inflation has caused prices in Cambodia to rise and times are difficult. Economic struggles have hit the poor hardest, and many are seeking new sources of income. Neang K. has applied to CREDIT for a loan of $1,000 to buy farmland on which to grow rice. She believes that the farm will produce extra income and be a valuable tool to raise her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy farmland

loans.name: Thon

texts.en: Thon V., 25, has one child and lives with her husband in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She works in a garment factory, where she earns $3 a day. Her husband, Chum Sinoeun, is a goldsmith. To help his business expand, she has applied for a loan from Kiva to buy additional tools. If there is money left over after this purchase, the family will use it to buy rice for resale when prices rise. (Mrs. Thon's husband is pictured here because she was not available when the photo was taken.)

loans.use: To buy tools to facilitate her husband's work as a goldsmith.

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Phạm Thị T., 46 years old, joins the TYM Fund in 2003. Her husband is an injured veteran with a pension of 1,400,000 VND a month. They have 3 children. Two are in college and the youngest one is still in high school. She uses the funds of her loans to invest in raising pigs and brewing rice liquor. By product from liquor brewing is used to feed the pigs. The business earns her 4,000,000 VND a month. That is enough for her to raise her children and cover their college expenses. She is applying for a loan of 6,000,000 VND.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Phạm Thị T. 46 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ Tình Thương năm 2003, chồng chị là thương binh lương tháng 1.400.000đ, anh chị có 3 người con hiện đang sống cùng gia đình, 2 con lớn đang học đai học, 1 con đang học cấp III. Tham gia Quỹ gia đình chị vay vốn chăn nuôi lợn và nấu riệu, với mô hình làm kinh tế đó gia đình chị đã tiết kiệm được chi phí trong chăn nuôi, bã rượu đươc gia đình tận dụng làm thức ăn cho lợn đó cũng là nguồn thức ăn rất tốt nhiều dinh dưỡng, chăn nuôi thuận lợi kinh tế gia đình phát triển có điều kiện cho các con được học tập đầy đủ. Vòng vốn này gia đình xin vay 6.000.000đ đầu tư vào chăn nuôi và nấu rựou. Thu nhập bình quân. 4.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Pigs

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. N. Thi Tran, 57 years old, joined the Fund in 2003. Her husband is a government worker in the culture ministry; besides his government work he also has an electronics repair shop at their house. Due to his many years of experience in electronics repair, his shop is the destination of choice for many families. The couple has 6 children, 3 of which are grown and live on their own, the remaining 3 live at home. Joining the Fund gave the family the opportunity to invest more in their livestock business and to buy more electronics repair equipment. The children are all working and have a steady income to contribute to the family, so borrowing from the Fund and repaying on a weekly basis is a good fit for the family. In this round of funding Mrs. Tran is requesting 6,000,000 VND to invest in raising pigs. Their average income is 4,000,000 VND per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Trần Thị N. 57 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ Tình Thương năm 2003, chồng chị là cán bộ văn hóa xã ngoài những công việc tại xã ra anh còn làm nghề sửa chữa điện tử tại nhà, có nhiều năm kinh nghiệm trong nghề nên cửa hàng sửa chữa nhà anh luôn là địa chỉ của các gia đình có nhu cầu sửa chữa, chị có 6 người con, 3 con đã trưởng thành và ra ở riêng, 3 con đang ở cùng gia đình, tham gia vào Quỹ vay vốn gia đình chị đầu tư vào chăn nuôi và mua đồ linh kiện điện tử, các con chị đã đi làm và có thu nhập đều đặn phụ giúp gia đình, vay vốn của Quỹ với phương thức trả theo tuần là phù hợp với gia đình chị. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 6.000.000đ đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn. Thu nhập bình quân. 4.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Raise pigs

loans.name: Long

texts.en:
Long P., 24, is married and lives with her three young children in Kampong Cham province. Her only source of income is her husband, who has a business raising pigs but is unable to make enough money to support their family. She would like to begin to breed ducks to sell them and their eggs for a profit.

Long P. has applied to CREDIT for a loan of $1,000 to buy ducks. If there is money left over, she will purchase pig feed with the balance of the funds. She sees this loan as a good economic decision, and believes it can both increase her income and raise her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy ducks and pigfeed.

loans.name: Sokheng

texts.en: Mrs. Sokheng L. is a vegetable seller in Phsa Leu Village in Kampong Chhnang province. Her husband, Mr. Buthoeurn Top, is a construction worker. They have 4 children, 2 of whom are employed in a garment factory, while the others are enrolled in school. Although the family members have different business activities, they are currently living in poor conditions. Therefore, Mrs. Sokheng L. decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike for her husband to start a motor-taxi business in order to improve their living standards. Her husband is on the left in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to start a motor-taxi business in order to improve their living standards

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. P. Thi Tran, 50 years old, joined the Fund in 2004. She saw that joining the Fund means that her family would have the chance to grow financially. In every round of funding, she put the loan towards the livestock business. Although the family’s livestock venture is not very big, it still brings them a steady annual income. Besides raising livestock, in her free time Mrs. Tran weaves baskets to sell for extra money. She has four children, one of which is grown and has established his own family and three who live at home. All her children have jobs and stable incomes; with these multiple incomes the family’s ability to repay the loans is very good. In this round of funding she and the family is requesting 6,000,000 VND to invest in raising pigs. Their average income is 4,000,000 VND per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Trần Thị Phúc 50 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2004, chị thấy rằng tham gia vào Quỹ là gia đình chị có cơ hội phát triển kinh tế, các vòng vốn chị đều sử dụng vào mục đích chăn nuôi, việc chăn nuôi của gia đình chị tuy không lớn nhưng cũng đem lại thu nhập hàng năm cho gia đình, ngoài việc chăn nuôi những lúc nhàn dỗi chị làm thêm nghề đan thúng cho thu nhập thêm. Chị có 4 người con, 1 con đã xây dựng gia đình, 3 con hiện đang sống cùng gia đình các con chị đều có công ăn việc làm thu nhập ổn định, với nhiều nguồn thu nhâp nên việc hoàn trả của gia đình chị rât tốt. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 6.000.000đ đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn. Thu nhập bình quân. 4.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Invest in raising pigs

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for TYM Fund - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Tha

texts.en: Mrs. Tha N. is a villager in Kbal Domrey Village in Kampong Chhnang province. She is currently a fisherwoman. Mrs. Tha N. is a widow with 3 children, 2 of whom are assisting with her business of catching fish, as well as selling it in the local market. In her business, Mrs. Tha N. faces a small problem because she has insufficient money to buy more fishing equipment. Therefore, Mrs. Tha N. asked for a loan to buy fishing equipment to improve her business. Previously, Mrs. Tha N. obtained a loan to buy fertilizers and hire a laborer to plow her rice field.

loans.use: To buy fishing equipment to improve her business

loans.name: Lach

texts.en:
Lach R., 48, is a widower and rice miller who lives in Kampong Cham province with one of his children. He typically makes $3 a day and is supported in part by his children.

Because his children are the biggest sources of his income, Lach R. wants to help them. With a loan of $1,000 from CREDIT, he wants to buy a motorbike to transport his children to and from work. This will cut down on public transportation costs that are a big part of family expenses. He also wants to buy some gas for the motorbike and some rice. He hopes to make a profit from the rice by buying it with the husk attached and taking it off for resale.

Lach R. has an entrepreneurial mindset and is always seeking ways to diversify his family’s income. In the future, he hopes to replace his old rice mill, because he believes that a new one will increase his income further.

loans.use: To buy rice and a motorbike

loans.name: Bouron

texts.en: Mrs. Bouron H. is a housewife in Thoam Mayuth Village in Kampong Chhnang province. Her husband, Mr. Sroy Kong, is a shoe seller in the local market. Mr. Sroy Kong’s business is currently going very well, so he wants to expand it, but he does not have enough money to purchase more fashion shoes. Therefore his wife, Mrs. Bouron H., requested a loan to buy more shoes for her husband's business. Mrs. Bouron H. is 48 and the mother of 2 children, both of whom are attending school. Her husband is on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase more fashion shoes to re-sell in the market

loans.name: Vien Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. T. Thi Vien, 24 years old, joined the Fund in 2004. Her family lives near the ocean so their primary source of income is from fishing. Although the fishing profession is unpredictable, their income is still high. In the first rounds of funding the family used the loan to invest in fishing equipment, and since it was and is their biggest source of income, the investments have brought many favorable changes to the family. Besides the fishing business, the family also works the fields and participates in livestock raising cooperatives. The couple has one small child. In this round of funding Mrs. Vien is requesting 6,000,000 VND to invest in more fishing equipment. Their average income is 3,500,000 VND a month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Viên Thị Tuấn 24 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ Tình Thương năm 2004, gia đình chị sống gần biển nên nguồn thu nhâp chính của gia đình chị là làm nghề đánh cá, tuy nghề đánh cá vất vả nhưng thu nhập cũng cao, các vòng vốn vay gia đình chị đầu tư vào mua sắm đồ nghề đánh bắt cá, anh chị sinh được 1 con hiện cháu đang còn nhỏ, ngoài công việc đánh cá gia đình chị vẫn làm ruộng và kệt hợp cùng chăn nuôi, khi tham gia vào Quỹ gia đình chị đã đầu tư nhiều vào nghề đánh bắt cá từ đó công việc đánh bắt cá cũng là nguồn thu nhập lớn nhất của gia đình chị, với nguồn thu nhập hàng ngày gia đình chị đã có nhiều thay đổi. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 6.000.000đ đầu tư vào mua sắm dụng cụ đánh bắt cá. Thu nhập bình quân 3.500.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Buy fishing equipment.

loans.name: Chheun

texts.en: Mr. Chheun R. lives in Sras Keo village in Kampong Chhnang province. He is currently in the car repairing business, and he requested a loan to buy more car equipment to fix his customers’ cars. His wife, Mrs. Yoeurn Chuon, is a fish seller in the local market. Mr. Chheun R. is 56 and the father of 4 children, 2 of whom are employed in a garment factory, while another is attending a local school. The remaining one is too young to work or study. Previously, Mr. Chheun R. obtained a loan to buy a spray gun to paint his customers’ cars. His wife is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more car equipment to fix his customers’ cars

loans.name: Uk

texts.en:
Uk R., 67, is a widow who lives with her daughter’s family in Kampong Cham province. She has six children, all of whom are married and live in Kampong Cham or Siem Reap. Three of her children are farmers, one sells coffee, rice and noodles, and two are goldsmiths in Siem Reap.

Uk R. is fully supported by her children and their businesses, but wants to make some investments to increase their success. She has asked CREDIT for a loan of $1,000 to buy goldsmithing tools for her children and to invest in their goldsmithing business. She has seen how successful her children have become, but she and they could use the additional income that a larger business would make possible. She sees this loan as a way to reach their goal.

loans.use: To invest in a goldsmithing business and buy tools.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Vu Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Vu Thi H., 47 years old, joined the TYM Fund since 2005. Her family lives near the river; therefore, it is very convenient for her to invest in river transportation. Her family owns a shop for building materials. Because the materials usually arrive by boats which anchor near her house, she decides to buy boats to carry her materials. She earns 20-30 USD/day. She also helps 10 other local people in finding jobs with a wage of 100 USD/month. She has 3 children who are still going to school. This time, she wants to borrow 800 USD to buy fuel for her boats. Her average income is 625 USD/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Vũ Thị Hiệp 47 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ Tình Thưong năm 2005, gia đình chị sống gần bờ sông rất thuận lợi cho việc đầu tư kinh doanh bến bãi và vận tải đường thủy. Hiện nay gia đình chị có bãi kinh doanh vât liệu xây dựng phục vụ nhu cầu của nhân dân trong khu vực, việc vận chuyển vật liệu về tập kết tại bến thường xuyên vì vậy gia đình chị đã đầu tư mua thuyền chuyên vận chuyển vât liệu, với việc kinh doanh đó gia đình chị thu nhập đều đặn hàng ngày 300.000đ đến 400.000đ, gia đình chị cũng tạo công ăn việc làm cho 10 lao động là người địa phương với thu nhập bình quân 1.500.000đ/ tháng, chị có 3 con hiện đang trong độ tuổi ăn học.Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 13.000.000đ mua nhiên liệu chạy thuyền. Thu nhập bình quân. 10.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: buy fuel for boats that carry building material

loans.name: Savoeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Savoeurn P. is a firewood seller in Kol Kup Village in Kampong Chhnang province. Her husband, Mr. Pheap Chuon, is currently in the palm sugar selling business. They have 2 children, one of whom is attending school, while the youngest one is too young to work or attend school. Even though Mrs. Savoeurn P. and her husband have different business activities, they still do not have enough money to pay for finishing to build their house. Thus, Mrs. Savoeurn P. now asked for a loan to pay for a house construction worker. Mrs. Savoeurn P. and her husband are pictured under their new house.

loans.use: To pay for finishing to build the house

loans.name: Nuon

texts.en: Nuon P., 28, is married and lives in Kampong Cham province with her young child. She works in a grocery store, making around $2.50 a day, while her husband makes around $5 a day as a doctor. Inflation has caused prices to soar in Cambodia, and recent hikes in the price of oil and rice have created economic difficulties for many Cambodians. Looking for ways to increase her income and combat rising expenses, Nuon P. has asked CREDIT for a loan of $1,000 to buy a motorbike to carry her groceries across town. She needs a way to transport goods from market to store so she can resell them, but the cost of public transportation is too high. She sees this loan as an opportunity to increase her income and to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Sokhey

texts.en: Mrs. Sokhey S. lives in Kol Kup Village in Kampong Chhnang province. She currently has a basket selling business. Her husband, Mr. Sokha Keal, is a motor-taxi driver in the local village. Mr. Sokha Keal’s business now cannot generate much money because his motorbike is too old and he uses a lot of petrol to run it. Thus, Mr. Sokha Keal needs to change it. Therefore, Mrs. Sokhey S. decided to ask for a loan to buy a new motorbike for her husband's business. Mrs. Sokhey S. is 30 and the mother of 3 children, 2 of whom are attending a local school, while the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike for her husband's business

loans.name: Sary

texts.en: Mrs. Sary P. is a basket seller in Kol Kup Village in Kampong Chhnang province. Her business can generate a small income. Therefore, Mrs. Sary P. is now requesting a loan to start another business in pig breeding so that she can improve her living conditions. Mrs. Sary P. is 39. She is a widow with 2 children, one of whom is enrolling in school, while the remaining one is too young to work or attend school.

loans.use: To start another business in pig breeding

loans.name: Ear

texts.en: Ear K., 45, is married and lives with her husband and seven children in Cham province. She and her husband work as farmers, making about $1.50 a day. They are also supported by their older children, several of whom work in garment factories and one of whom is a motorbike mechanic. Weather has been difficult for farming in Cambodia this last year, and inflation has forced food prices to skyrocket. These factors have made for difficult times for many Cambodians. To help cope with these conditions, Ear K. has applied to CREDIT for a loan of $1,200 to aid her son’s business. He works as a motorbike mechanic, and could make a lot more money if he opened up his own shop. She sees this loan as a way to increase her income and is confident that the business venture will succeed.

loans.use: To establish mechanic shop

loans.name: Sophath

texts.en: Mrs. Sophath N. is a villager in Kraing Leav Village in Kampong Chhnang province. She currently owns a small restaurant, where she sells rice soup as breakfast food. Besides this business activity, Mrs. Sophath N. is a subsistence farmer. Her plantation business now has insufficient draft animals. Thus, Mrs. Sophath N. decided to ask for a loan to buy one more cow to add to her previous one to use as a draft animal. Mrs. Sophath N. is 48 and the mother of 3 children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while another is attending school. The youngest one is staying at home. Her husband, Mr. Sreng Chay, is a policeman in the province. Previously, Mrs. Sophath N. obtained a loan from AMK to buy a cow cart. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy one more cow to add to her previous one to use as a draft animal

loans.name: Seang

texts.en: Seang S. is 31 years old, married and lives in Kampong Cham province with her husband and their three young children. Each day, she goes to the market and sells Khmer noodles, making about $3.30. Her husband works in recycling and makes around $10 a day, but his business has room for expansion. Seang S. has applied to CREDIT for a loan of $700 to buy more items to resell at the local recycling plant. She sees this loan as a good investment in her husband’s business, and a way to increase her family’s income. She is very confident that the business venture will succeed and allow her family to raise its standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more materials to resell at a local recycling plant.

loans.name: Samrit

texts.en:
Samrit M. is 49 years old, married and lives in Kampong Cham province with her husband and four children. She and her husband are farmers, and make about $2 a day. They are supported by two of their children, who work in garment factories. The weather has been difficult for farming in Cambodia over the last year, and inflation has caused prices to soar. These factors have have made life difficult for many Cambodians.

Samrit M. has applied for a $700 loan to buy a new tractor to replace her old one, which breaks down frequently and uses a lot of gas. A new tractor will mean lower expenses and a higher standard of living for her and her family.

loans.use: To buy a new tractor.

loans.name: Chanra

texts.en: Mrs. Chanra P. and her husband, Mr. Min Thai, are in the recycling business. They collect the waste such as glass bottles, plastics, and cans. They live in Kbal Domrey Village in Kampong Chhnang province. In order to make Mrs. Chanra P. and her husband's business easier, Mrs. Chanra P. needs to access a loan to afford to buy a motorbike to transport her waste to re-sell for a profit. Mrs. Chanra P. is 27 and the mother of a child who is too young to work or study. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To afford to buy a motorbike to transport her waste to re-sell for a profit

loans.name: Thon

texts.en:
Thon R. is 26 years old, married and has one child. He works as a mechanic in a small garage not far from his house. About 80 percent of the people of Cambodia drive or travel in second-hand vehicles, most of which have to be repaired before they can be used. That is why car mechanics are thought to have good jobs. Thon's wife stays at home to look after their child and cook food for the whole family. She also has a job renting out a pool table to villagers, earning a small commission from each rental.

Thon has applied for a loan from Kiva to buy painting tools and a small motor to help him do his work.

loans.use: To buy  painting tools and a small motor.

loans.name: Sharifa Bakari's Maisha Zakhem Group

texts.en:
Sharifa B. (pictured first on the right at the back), age 32, is married with one son, 10 years old. She has a business of selling clothes which she began six years ago. She works from 8am to 8pm daily and is able to make a monthly profit of about $85.

In the past Sharifa has taken out three previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to increase her capital. She hopes for a new loan to buy more clothes of different types for sale. Sharifa will share this loan with her sub-group members, who sell furniture, charcoal, drinks and have shops. These members hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To increase stock of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Thean

texts.en: Mrs. Thean S. lives in Andoung Russey Village in Kampong Chhnang province. She is currently in the business of pot selling. She is a widow with a child who is a firewood seller. Mrs. Thean S. is now living in poor conditions. In order to improve her standard of living, Mrs. Thean S. needs to start a cow breeding business. Thus, Mrs. Thean S. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. Previously, Mrs. Thean S. obtained a loan from AMK to build a new house.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Mahmudov

texts.ru:
A. Mahmudov is 48 years old and has 3 children. He has been in business for long time now. He sells women's shoes. After repaying his previous loan, he decided to borrow again in order to purchase more shoes. He is extremely thankful to KIVA for the support and understanding. He is certain that he will be able to repay the second loan in the same way as he did the first.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Махмудов Азиз,мужчина в возросте 48 лет имеет 3 детей, бизнесмен со стажем.Имеет оборот по торговле женской обуви.Окончив займ он решил увеличить сумму займа для приобретения женской обуви. Он искренне благодарен KIVA за поддержку и понимание. Он уверен что сможет повторно без проблем погасить второй займ.

loans.use: Shoe sales

loans.name: Theopista

texts.en:
Theodosia Bwire, age 40, is married with two children ages 22 and 15. She owns a shop of various items which she started six years ago. She works from 8am to midnight daily and is able to make a monthly profit of about $423.

In the past, Theodosia has taken out two previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to expand her shop. She hopes for a new loan to buy extra stock for her shop.

loans.use: To increase her general shop stock.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Tujijenge Tanzania Ltd - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Saroeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Saroeurn T. is a villager in Kol Kup Village in Kampong Chhnang province. She is a pig breeder. Her business now faces a small problem because she does not have enough money to buy more pig feed. Therefore, Mrs. Saroeurn T. requested a loan for this purpose. Her husband, Mr. Pha Srey, is a woodman and firewood seller. Mrs. Saroeurn T. has 4 children, all of whom are attending a local school. Previously, Mrs. Saroeurn T. obtained a loan to buy pig feed. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more pig feed

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.ru:
Mavjuda Z. is 39 with three children. She has a secondary school education. When she finished school, she began trading fruits at the market. After she got married, he husband gave her money to expand his small business and she would regulary make sales trips to different districts of Sughd Region. For 10 years now, she sells food products (macaroni, sugar, rice, flour, etc.) at the markets in Spitamen, Djabbor, Rasulov, Gonchi. Mavjuda has regular clients.

She applied to MicroInvest for a loan to expand her assortment of products.

Translation from the Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

Зикруллаева Мавджуда женщина в возросте 39 лет имеет троих детей, сама имеет среднее оразование .После окончания средней школы она торговала фруктами на рынке, после замужества муж ей дал деньги на расширение своего маленького бизнеса и она стала разъезжать по районам Сугдской области . Уже 10 лет как она продаёт продукты питания (макаронные изделия, сахар ,рис,мука и.т.п) на рынках регионов Спитамен, Джаббор Расулов, Гончи . Мавчуда имеет своих постоянных клиентов.

Она обратилась в Микроинвест для получения кредита чтоб расширить свой ассортимент товаров.

loans.use: Food sales

loans.name: Suhrob

texts.ru:
Suhrob M. lives in the town of Yavan with his family. He works as a master at the hydro-power plant. He also breeds animals just like a large portion of the rural community. He buys calves and sheep, feeds them and grows them, and then resells them at the same markets. He's been doing this for the last five years. His neighbors offered to sell him a calf at a very low price, that's why he decided to take out a loan and buy the calf, so that the neighbors wouldn't sell it to someone else. This deal will be very profitable for his business and will bring in the necessary income. He will repay the loan in ten months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Ezhevskaya, Kiva volunteer.

Мухторов Сухроб проживает в городе Яван. Живет со своей семьей. Работает мастером на ГЭС. Кроме того дополнительно занимается животноводством, как и большая часть населения сельской местности. Покупает молодых бычков и овечек ,откармливает и перепродает на тех же рынках.Занимается этим бизнесом уже 5 лет. Его соседи предложили бычка по очень низкой цене и по этой причине он решил получить кредит и купить бычка , чтобы соседи не продали его другим. Это сделка была бы очень выгодна для его бизнеса и дала бы неплохой доход. Погасить кредит он сможет в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of a calf

loans.name: Kurbonali

texts.ru:
Kurbonali H. lives in the town of Yavan and works as an engineer at a Daewoo plant. He is also a farmer who grows vegetables and grain varieties. In order to sow he needs to purchase additional fertilizer and seeds. That is why he wants to take out a six-month loan. Kurbonali is married and has four children. They all live happily together, despite the difficulties and challenges of life today.

Translated from Russian by Anya Ezhevskaya, Kiva volunteer.

Хочаев Курбонали житель города Яван . Работает в ДЭУ инженером. Кроме работы он занимается земледелием , где выращивает овощи и злаковые культуры. Для повторгного посева Курбонали должен закупить удобрения и семена. Поэтому он хочет получить кредит со сроком в 6 месяцев. Курбонали женат и имеет четверых детей. Живут все они дружно и весело , несмотря на трудности и невзгоды сегодняшней жизни.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer.

loans.name: Habilova

texts.ru:
D. is 25 years old, with two children. Her husband works abroad in Russia to support the family. After finishing middle school, D. matriculated in a medical course for her certification. For the last five years since then, she has been renting a space where she runs a pharmacy and successfully sells medication.

D. has a license for distributing medicine and has many regular customers, since she's very communicative and is known for giving reliable advice on the use of various medicines. She is applying for a loan to expand her business.

Translation from the Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

Дилафруз девушка в возрасте 25 лет, имеет двоих детей , муж на заработках в России. Дилафруз окончив среднюю школу поступила на медицинские курсы, окончив получила сертификат и уже 5 лет как она арендовав помещение под свою аптеку успешно торгует лекарствами.

У Дилафруз имеется лицензия на розничную реализацию лекарственных средст. У нее много постоянных клиентов и так как она коммуникабельная женщина она многим дает хорошие рекомендации по использованию того или иного лекарства. Сейчас она собирается получить займ для расширения своего бизнеса.

loans.use: Sale of pharmaceuticals

loans.name: Hilvat

texts.ru:
Hilvat A. lives in the town of Yavan with her family. She is married and has four children. Hilvat graduated from a medical college and works as a nurse in the local clinic. She also has a small business at home, where she breeds calves. That is why she wants to buy another calf. With that she's turned to us for help. Once she receives the $600 USD loan, she will buy the calf and repay the loan within ten months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Ezhevskaya, Kiva translator.

Азимова Хилват жительница города Яван. Проживает со своей семьей. Она замужем и имеет четверых детей. Хилват закончила медицинское училище и работает медсестрой в поликлинике ее кишлака.Кроме того дома имеет небольшое хозяйство, где разводит телят. Поэтому хочет еще купить одного бычка. Для этого она обратилась к нам за помощью. Получив кредит в размере 600 долларов США она купит бычка и погасить кредит сможет в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of a calf.

loans.name: Lonh

texts.en:
Mr. Lonh L., 31, earns approximately $6.50 per day as a motorcycle-taxi driver. His wife, Mrs. Orm Ponh, 26, earns approximately $3.30 per day farming. They have one child, who is not yet old enough to attend school. The family lives in Samrong Village, Siem Reap Province.

Mr. L. is requesting a loan in the amount of $800 to purchase a new motorcycle for his taxi business. He hopes that a new moto-taxi will allow him to increase his income as a driver for foreign guests around the Temple of Angkor.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle for his taxi business

loans.name: Juma Omary's Mt Udzungwa Group

texts.en:
Juma O., age 40, is married with six children (ages 16,14,12,10, 8, and 6). He has been a carpenter for 10 years. He works from 7:00 am to 6:00 pm daily and is able to make a monthly profit of around $169.

Previously, Juma has taken out one loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to increase his capital. He hopes for a new loan to buy more wood for his furniture mart and to buy a passenger truck for transporting goods. Juma will share this loan with his group members dealing in poultry, animal keeping, and selling food, fruits, vegetables, and cold drinks and beers. These members hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Juma is second from the left in the back row.

loans.use: To buy more wood for his furniture business and to buy a passenger truck

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Tujijenge Tanzania Ltd - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Zaragul

texts.ru:
Zaragul G. lives in the area of Shahrinav. She is 27 and is married with two children. She is engaged in the trade of fruits and vegetables. However she wishes to buy one bull, which will live at her house. She plans to do this to fatten it up during the summer, when there is a lot of grass, and then sell it in the fall. This way she makes a profit. Therefore Zaragul has asked Kiva if they can help her solve this problem. If she receives the loan, she plans to extinguish it in the current 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Maria Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Гулова Зарагуль проживает в районе Шахринау. Возраст 27 лет , замужем и имеет двоих детей. Занимается торговлей овощей и фруктов. Но хочет купить одного бычка домой, так как пока лето и есть трава , его можно было бы откормить и к осени продать. Таким образом можно заработать.Поэтому Зарагуль обратилась к нам , чтобы мы помогли ей решить эту проблему. Получив кредит , она сможет погасить его в течении 12 месяцев

loans.use: Purchase of bull

loans.name: Gaibullo

texts.ru:
Gaibullo S. lives in the area of Shahrinav. He has a high school degree with a special focus on driving. He works as the driver of a fixed-route taxi. He rents the taxi which is a "Gazelle". A repair of the running part of the vehicle is necessary. By receiving the loan he can make a major repair on the vehicle. Therefore he has asked Kiva to help. He plans to extinguish the credit within 12 months. Gaibullo has a great family, and is married with four children.

Translated from Russian by Maria Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Сангинов Гайбулло житель района Шахринау. Имеет средне специальное образование. По профессии водитель. Так и работает шофером маршрутного такси. Арендует маршрутку марки «Газель». Необходим ремонт ходовой части автомашины . Получив кредит он сможет сделать капитальный ремонт. Поэтому он к нам и обратился. Погасить кредит он планирует в течении 12 месяцев. Гайбулло имеет большую семью. Он женат и имеет четверых детей.

loans.use: Purchase of auto parts for vehicle repair

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru:
Mavluda T. is 21, is not married, and lives with her parents. For 2 years she has been working and helping her family. She is engaged in tailoring of the national lady clothes. Having consulted her parents she has decided to receive a loan to purchase fabric. By buying fabric she will be able to provide for herself trouble-free work, which will help her earn more money. She plans to extinguish the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Maria Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Тошева Мавлюда -21 год. Незамужем . Живет с родителями. Уже 2 года как она начала работать и помогать своим родителям. Занимается пошивом национальной женской одежды. Посоветовавшись с родителями решила получить кредит для закупки ткани. Закупив ткань она смошет обеспечить себе бесперебойную работу. Это поможет заработать больше. Погасить кредит он планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of fabric

loans.name: Sharafjon

texts.ru:
Sharafjon N., 28, is married and has two children. To provide for his family Sharafjon has to work frequently. Six years ago he opened up a small shop and sells spare parts for cars. There is work, but at the present time Sharafjon has decided to develop the business and to increase commodity circulation. Therefore he has addressed Kiva for help. He wishes to receive the loan and extinguish it within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Maria Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Назаров Шарафджон -28 лет, женат и имеет двоих детей. Для того , чтобы обеспечить свою семью Шарафджону приходится много работать. Шесть лет назад он открыл небольшой магазин по продаже запасных частей для автомобилей.Работа идет , но в данный момент Шарафджон решил развивать свой бизнес и увеличить товарооборот. Поэтому он обратился к нам за помощью. Хочет получить кредит со сроком в 12 месяцев

loans.use: Increase commodity circulation

loans.name: Hurmat

texts.ru:
Hurmat A. lives in the Gissar area. She works as a teacher at the high school number 8 of the Gissar region. Other than teaching, Hurmat has been engaged in the trade of fruits and vegetables for 25 years. She brings the goods, buying them from wholesale traders, and then she sells them at the Gissar market. To increase profit, Hurmat has decided to raise the commodity circulation by receiving a loan. She plans to extinguish the loan within 12 months. Hurmat is married and has five children. Since her husband does not work anywhere, it is necessary for Hurmat to work a lot to provide food for her children.

Translated from Russian by Maria Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Абирова Хурмат проживает в районе Гиссар. Работает учителем в средней школе № 8 гиссарского района. Кроме того уже 25 лет как она занимается торговлей овощей и фруктов. Привозит товар , покупая у оптовых реализаторов и продает на рынке «Гиссар». Для того , чтобы увеличить прибыльность Хурмат решила увеличить товарооборот путем получения кредита. Погасить его она планирует в течении 12 месяцев.Хурмат замужем и имеет пятерых детей. Муж нигде не работает поэтому ей приходится много работать для того , чтобы дети всегда были сытыми.

loans.use: Increase commodity circulation

loans.name: Nilufar

texts.ru:
Nilufar R. lives in the Gissar area. She is 22 years old, and is not married. For three years she has been engaged in the trade of vegetables and fruit. She has a shop at the Gissar market. She wishes to increase her assortment of goods, but she does not have the money to do so. Therefore Nilufar wishes to receive a loan, and to extinguish it within 12 months. She lives with her parents and is the main supporter of the family. Not looking at the difficulties of Nilufar's life, she is a very cheerful and friendly person.

Translated from Russian by Maria Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Рахматова Нилуфар жительница гиссарского района. Возраст 22 года , не замужем. Уже три года занимается торговлей овощей и фруктов. Имеет торговую точку на Гиссарском рынке. Хочет увеличить ассортимент товара, но для этого у нее не хватает денег. Поэтому Нилуфар хочет получить кредит и выплатить его в течении 12 месяцев. Живет с родителями и является основным кормильцем семьи. Но не смотря на трудности Нилуфар очень веселая и дружелюбная .

loans.use: Increase assortment of goods.

loans.name: Zaynab

texts.ru:
Zaynab S. lives in the Gissar area. For eight years she has been engaged in the trading of clothes. Except for clothing trade, Zaynab is engaged in the tailoring of bed-clothes and sells them from her shop. Currently she is experiencing financial difficulties. Therefore she wishes to receive a loan to buy fabric for tailoring bed-clothes. She plans to extinguish the loan within 12 months. Zaynab lives with her family and is married with four children.

Translated from Russian by Maria Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Сафарова Зайнаб проживает в Гиссарском районе. Уже восемь лет как занимается торговлей одежды. Кроме того занимается пошивом постельного белья и продает со своей торговой точки. Сейчас возникли финансовые проблемы . Поэтому она хочет получить кредит и закупить ситец для пошива постельного белья. Погасить кредит она планирует в течении 12 месяцев. Живет со своей семьей. Зайнаб замужем и имеет четверых детей.

loans.use: Purchase of fabric

loans.name: Savrinisso

texts.ru:
Savrnisso K. lives in the Gissar region. She is divorced and has one child. She lives with her parents. Her parents are retired and Savrnisso is the only breadwinner in the family. She has a souvenir store where she sells flowers and souvenirs. She has been in this business for ten years. Her business runs pretty well but she would like to have more money for its expansion. Therefore she decided to request a loan which she plans to repay in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva volunteer.

Курбонова Саврниссо жительница Гиссарского района. Разведена и имеет одного ребенка. Живут с ее родителями. Они пенсионеры, поэтому она является единственным кормильцем семьи. Имеет подарочный магазин, где продает цветы и разные сувениры. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 10 лет. Прибыль неплохая, но для развития бизнеса нужны деньги. Поэтому она решила получить кредит со сроком в 12 месяцев.

loans.use: to increase sales

loans.name: Kumri

texts.ru:
Kumri S. lives with her son in the city of Vahdat. She is divorced. She works in a store where she sells goods. She has been in this business for the past five years. In order to attract new customers, Kumri would like to renovate her store. Therefore she plans to get a loan of 450 USD that she would repay in the next 12 months. Kumri and her son are friends who share all joys and always try to help each other.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva volunteer.

Шокирова Кумри проживает в городе Вахдат. Разведена . Живет с сыном. Работает в магазине. Торгует промышленными товарами. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 5 лет. Для того , чтьобы привлечь новых клиентов Кумри хочет сделать ремонт своего магазина. Поэтолмиу она запланировала получить кредит в размере 450 долларов США и начать ремонт. Срок за который она сможет расплатиться с кредитом 12 месяцев. Живут с сыном дружно и весело , и стараются помогать друг другу.

loans.use: store renovation

loans.name: Latofat

texts.ru:
Latofat J. lives in the city of Qurgan-Tube. She is 41 years old. She works as a journalist for the Hatlon newspaper. She is a university graduate with ten years of work experience. In order to improve her living conditions, she would like to receive a loan for the renovation of her apartment. She plans to repay the loan in the next 6 months from her salary.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva volunteer.

Джориева Латофат жительница города Курган-Тюбе. Возраст 41 год. Работает журналистом в редакции газеты «Хатлон». Имеет высшее образование. Работает уже 10 лет. Для того , чтобы улучшить условия жизни она решила получить кредит и сделать ремонт в квартире. Погасить кредит ей позволит ее заработная плата в течении 6 месяцев.

loans.use: apartment renovation

loans.name: Bibijamilya

texts.ru:
Jamilya R. lives in the city of Vahdat. She is 30 years old. She is single and has no children. She lives with her parents and is the sole breadwinner of her family. She works at the Bahor market in Vahdat. She has a vending lot where she sells fruit and vegetables. She buys goods wholesale and sells them retail. Se has already been in this business for ten years. To increase sales, she would like to get a loan. She plans to repay the loan in the next 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva volunteer.

Рашидова Джамиля жительница города Вахдат. Джамиле 30 лет . Она не замужем и детей не имеет. Живет с родителями и сама полностью обеспечивает свою семью. Работает на рынке «Бахор» города Вахдат.Имеет торговую точку где продает овощи и фрукты. Скупает товар у оптовых торговцев и продает в розницу. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 10 лет. В данный момент хочет увеличить товарооборот , поэтому решила обратиться к нам за получением кредита. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: to increase sales

loans.name: Solihahon

texts.ru:
Solihahon started in business nearly 10 years ago. She's 36 now and is a single mother with a child. She started out selling various small things and then decided to buy and sell men's clothes.

A year and a half ago, Solihahon applied to MicroInvest and got her first loan to update her autumn collection of clothes. Since then, she has considerably increased her capital. One of the major events in her life was that with her business profits and personal savings she was able to purchase a Daewoo-Tico car. The car has been helping her with business.

At this time, the season for selling summer clothes has begun,and Solihahon has applied to MicroInvest for a new loan.

Translated from the Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer.

Солихахон начала заниматься бизнесом около 10 лет назад. Ей 36 лет, она незамужем и воспитывает 1 ребенка. Начинала с продажи разной мелочевки, затем решила перейти на куплю-продажу мужской одежды.

Солихахон 1.5 года назад обратилась в Микроинвест и получила свой первый займ на обновление ассортимента осенней одежды. С тех пор она значительно увеличила свой оборотный капитал. Одним из знаменательных событий в ее жизни стало то, что она на полученную прибыль и сэкономленные собственные сбережения сумела приобрести автомобиль Daewoo-Tico. Этот маленький автомобиль стал хорошим подспорьем в ее бизнесе.

Сейчас начинается сезон продаж летней одежды и Солихахон обратилась в МикроИнвест за новым займом.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Dilmurod

texts.ru:
Despite his young age (he's 30), Dilmurod is already married and has three children. Besides his main work buying and selling dried fruits, he himself, with his family, dry apricots.

To purchase fresh apricots, he uses his own reserves. To procure more apricots, Dilmurod has applied to MicroInvest for a loan.

Translated from the Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer.

Несмотря на свой молодой возраст (30 лет) Дилмурод уже женат и воспитывает 3 детей. Кроме своей основной деятельности – купли продажи сухофруктов, Дилмурод каждый год вместе со своей семьей занимается сушкой абрикосов.

Для закупки свежих абрикосов он использует свои сбережения. Чтобы приобрести больше абрикосов Дилмурод обратился в Микроинвест за займом.

loans.use: To purchase apricots

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr:
Kossi A., 29, is married and the father of two children. He is a mechanic and auto body repairman in Avetonou, a little village situated about 100 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. The loan will allow him to purchase some tools and to make improvements on his garage so as to attract more clients. In this way, Kossi will earn more money and be able to improve living conditions for his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Kossi A. est âgé de 29 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. Il est mécanicien soudeur à Avetonou, un petit village situé à environ 100 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Le crédit lui permettra d’acheter des outils de travail et d’aménager son garage pour attirer plus de clients. Ce faisant, monsieur Kossi gagnera plus d’argent pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use:
purchase tools and upgrade his garage

Acheter des outils de travail et aménager son garage

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 30 year-old Rehema A.. She is married, and has two children aged 11 and 17. In 2004, Rehema established her grocery business. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about US $340 every month from this business. She is assisted by her husband.

Rehema requires a loan to purchase additional stocks of rice, beans and vegeteble in bulk. In the future, Rehema plans to increase the quantity and range of her stock. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of rice, beans, fruits and vegetables in bulk.

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr:
Kossi A., 41, is married and the father of four children, all of whom are enrolled in school. He does fish-farming in Adéta, a village located about 150 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. With this first loan through FECECAV, he hopes to have a dam built so that he can raise fish, since importation does not cover the needs of the population. Kossi will make a profit on this business and will be able to support his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Kossi A. est âgé de 41 ans, marié et père de 4 enfants tous à l’école. Il pratique la pisciculture à Adéta, un village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Il espère avec ce premier crédit à FECECAV se faire construire un barrage pour pratiquer l’élevage des poissons étant donné que les importations ne couvrent pas les demandes de la population. Monsieur Kossi tirera profit de cette activité et arrivera à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use:
To have a dam built for fish-farming

Se faire construire un barrage pour pratiquer l’élevage des poissons

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FECECAV - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 28 year-old Jackline B.. She is married and has two children aged 4 and 9. In 2006, Jackline established her grocery business. She opens her business 7 days a week, 11 hours a day. She is assisted by her hursband and one employee. Jackline has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase additional stocks of rice, beans and vegeteble in bulk. In the future, Jackline plans to increase the quantity and range of her stock. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of rice, beans, fruits and vegetables in bulk.

loans.name: Makbuliddin

texts.ru:
Makbuliddin is 31 years old, married and had three children. He lives in the picturesque mountain region of Isfara, in the Vorukh district.

Every year, from June to July, is the season for drying apricots. At this time, Makbuliddin and his family go to orchards to gather aprictos for drying.

To obtain additional fresh apricots for his gardens, Makbuliddin is applying to MicroInvest for a loan.

Translated from the Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva volunteer.

Макбулиддину 31 год, он женат и воспитывает 3 детей. Живет он в живописном горном районе Исфары – джамоате Ворух. Каждый год в июне-июле наступает пора сушки абрикосов. В это время Макбулиддин и его семья выезжают в поле под фруктовые сады и сушат абрикосы. Для приобретения свежих абрикосов дополнительно к своим садам Макбулиддин обратился в МикроИнвест за займом.

loans.use: to purchase apricots

loans.name: Albertine

texts.fr:
Albertine A., 28, is married and the mother of three children. She works as a seamstress in Adéta, a village located about 150 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. Albertine wants to use this loan to purchase a sewing machine, cloth, and some lengths of wax print fabric so that she will be able to expand her business activity. The profit that her business will make will allow her to support her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Albertine A. est âgée de 28 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle exerce l’activité de couture à Adéta, un village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Albertine désire, avec ce crédit, acheter une machine à coudre, des tissus et des pagnes pour accroître la capacité de son métier. Les profits qu’engendrera son activité lui permettront de satisfaire les besoins de sa famille.

loans.use:
Purchase a sewing machine, cloth, and lengths of wax print fabric

Acheter une machine à coudre, des tissus et des pagnes

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FECECAV - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima Seifu, aged 32, is single with two children, ages 12 and 5. She has been selling food since last year. She works from 6am to 4pm daily and is able to make a monthly profit of about $123.

In the past, Halima has taken out one previous loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to improve on her business. She requests a new loan to buy more food products for a big sale of food.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of food products.

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 37 year-old Violet Ndunguru. She is married and has two children aged 8 and 12. She has two dependents who live with her because they are orphans. In 1999, Violet established her seamstress business. She opens her business 6 days a week, 7 hours a day. She is assisted by her hursband and one employee.

Violet requires a loan in order to purchase 30 pieces of material, as well as dye, which she will use to make a new range of cloth. Violet will also sew new dresses using this cloth. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profit by approximately US $90. In the future, Violet plans to open another business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase 30 new pieces of plain cloth, as well as a range of dyes and fabric paint, which she will use to make a new range of traditional African cloth.

loans.name: Odette

texts.fr:
Odette D., 32, is married and the mother of three children, all of whom are enrolled in school. She runs a general store in Avetonou, a little village situated about 100 kilometers from the city of Lomé, the capital of Togo. Odette hopes, with this loan, to expand the capacity of her store and to satisfy the demands of her clientele which is continually growing. She hopes to buy 15 sacks of rice, 5 sacks of granulated sugar, 10 cartons of milk, some soap and some tinned foods. This will permit her to increase her sales volume, make more profit, and thus improve living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Odette D. est âgée de 32 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants tous à l’école. Elle est commerçante à Avetonou, un petit village situé à environ 100 kilomètres de la ville de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Odette espère, avec ce crédit, augmenter la capacité de son commerce et de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle qui ne cesse de croître. Elle, souhaite acheter 15 sacs de riz, 5 sacs de sucres en poudre, 10 cartons de laits, des savons et des boîtes de conserves. Ceci lui permettra d’augmenter ses ventes, de réaliser plus de bénéfices et par conséquent d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use:
Purchase 15 sacks of rice, 5 sacks of granulated sugar, 10 cartons of milk, some soap and some tinned foods

Acheter 15 sacs de riz, 5 sacs de sucres en poudre, 10 cartons de laits, des savons et des boîtes de conserves

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 43 year-old Filomena A.. She is married and has four children aged between 4 and 21. She also has two dependents who live with her because one is an orphan whose parents have passed away with HIV/AIDS, and the other has parents who live in a remote area, where it is difficult to attend school.

In 2007, Filomena established her traditional African cloth business. Working seven days a week and 9 to 12 hours a day, she earns about US $230 every month from this business. She is assisted by her husband. Filomena requires a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of cloth, dye and other chemicals, which she will use to make a new range of colourful cloth. In the future, Filomena plans to open another business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of plain cloth, dyes and fabric paint, which she will use to make a new range of colourful batik cloth, as shown in the photo. Filomena is standing on the far right of the photo, which has been shot with her two friends.

loans.name: Faeziddin

texts.ru:
Faeziddin B. is continuing to bake the Tajik national flatbread. Faeziddin used his first KIVA loan to purchase flour and a bicycle with a trailer. He paid back his loan on time and showed himself to be an exemplary client. Recently his daughter got married. Today, Faeziddin would like to take out a loan to purchase flour at wholesale.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Фаезиддин продолжает заниматься выпечкой национальных лепешек. Свой первый займ от КИВА Фаезиддин направил покупку муки и основных средств - велосипеда с тележкой. Все погашения предыдущего займа произвел вовремя и показал себя образцовым клиентом. Недавно он также выдал свою дочь замуж. Сейчас Фаезиддин хочет получить новый для оптового закупа муки.

loans.use: Purchase flour

loans.name: Mawuena

texts.fr:
Mawuena A., 35, is married and the father of four children. In the photo, Mawuena is the first person on the left and the others are his apprentices. He lives in Avetonou, a little village situated about 100 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. He is a mechanic and hopes, with this loan, to purchase some tools so as to better meet the needs of his clientele. He also wishes to set up a workshop for his younger brother who has just finished his training as a tailor. In this way, Mawuena will participate in improving living conditions for his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Mawuena A. est âgé de 35 ans, marié et père de 4 enfants. Dans la photo monsieur Mawuena est la première personne à gauche et les autres sont ses apprentis. Il habite à Avetonou, un petit village situé à environ 100 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Il est mécanicien et, souhaite avec ce crédit, acheter des outils de travail pour mieux répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle et aussi ouvrir un atelier à son petit frère qui vient de terminer sa formation en couture. Ce faisant Mawuena participe à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use:
Purchase tools and also open a workshop for his younger brother

Acheter des outils de travail et aussi ouvrir un atelier à son petit frère

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FECECAV - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 50 year-old Lucy S.. She is married and has six children aged between 12 and 22. In 2004, Lucy established her grocery and snacks business. Lucy has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase additional stocks of rice, oil, fruits, vegetables, and ingredients to make samosas. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of rice, cooking oil, fruit and vegetables as well as ingredients for samosas.

loans.name: Epi

texts.fr:
Epi A., 29, a bachelor with no children, sells gasoline in Avetonou, a little village situated about 100 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. Epi hopes with this loan to be able to buy more gasoline for re-sale so as to satisfy the demand of his clientele. This will allow him to earn more profit to support his parents and siblings.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Epi A. est âgé de 29 ans célibataire sans enfant il est revendeur d’essence à Avetonou, un petit village situé à environ 100 kilomètre de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Epi désire avec ce crédit, payer plus d’essence pour la revente afin de satisfaire la demande de la clientèle. Ce qui lui permettra de gagner plus de profits pour supporter sa famille maternelle.

loans.use:
Purchase gasoline for re-sale

Payer plus d’essence pour la revente

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr:
Komi A., 36, is married and the father of four children. For more than 7 years, he has been a shopkeeper in Avetonou, a little village situated about 100 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. He hopes, with this loan, to increase the capacity of his business, buying some sacks of rice, cartons of sugar, cartons of milk, tinned foods, and soap for resale. This will allow him to satisfy the demands of his customers and make more profit in order to improve living conditions for his family.

Komi A. est âgé de 36 ans, marié et père de 4 enfants. Il tient, depuis plus de 7 ans, une boutique à Avetonou, un petit village situé à environ 100 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Il désire, avec ce crédit, augmenter la capacité de son commerce en achetant des sacs de riz, des cartons de sucres, des cartons de lait, des boîtes de conserves et des savons pour la revente. Ce qui lui permettra de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle et de tirer plus de profits pour l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille

loans.use:

Acheter des sacs de riz, des cartons de sucres, des cartons de lait, des boîtes de conserves et des savons pour la revente

Kodjo A. is 30 years old, married, and the father or two. loans.name: Subira

Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 36 year-old Subira M.. She is married and has three children aged 5, 8 and 10. In 2005, Subira established her tailoring business. loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr:

She has been a retail seller of ready-to-wear clothing for over ten years, and her merchandise is set up in the marketplace of Avetonou, a small village located about 100 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. She wishes to use this loan to grow the capacity of her business by buying a lot more clothing for resale. The profit from her business will help her to better support her children.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Akouvi S. est âgée de 34 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Dans la photo, elle est la personne située à gauche. Elle revendeuse des habits prêts-à-porter depuis plus de 10 ans et installe ses marchandises au marché d’Avetonou, un petit village situé à environ 100 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Elle souhaite, avec ce crédit accroître la capacité de son activité en achetant beaucoup plus d’habits pour la revente. Les profits de son activité l’aideront à mieux supporter ses enfants.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 20 year-old Hadija H.. She is married and has no children. In 2006, Hadija established her café business. She opens her business six days a week, 5 to 8 hours a day. She is assisted by her mother, husband, and one employee.

Hadija requires a loan in order to purchase additional ingredients in bulk, to make rice, ugali, chapati, tea, and juice. In the future, Hadija plans to open another business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients in bulk, such as rice, flour, sugar, fruits and vegetables, to make a range of dishes such as pilau, ugali, chapatis, tea and juice.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 32 year-old Beatrice M.. She is married and has four children aged between 5 and 15. She has two dependents who live with her because they are orphans. In 2002, Beatrice established her auto parts business. Working seven days a week, 13 to 16 hours a day, she earns about US $260 every month from this business. She is assisted by her husband.

Beatrice requires a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of auto spare parts in bulk. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately US $50. In the future, Beatrice plans to increase the quantity and range of her stock. She thanks you for your support.

loans.name: Essi

texts.fr:
Essi A. is 39 years old, married, and the mother of four. She has been running a pub for more than five years in Avetonou, a small village located about 100 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. To better satisfy her customers and to help cover household needs, Essi wishes to use this credit to outfit her restaurant and to buy sacks of rice, drums of oil, and the ingredients necessary for the proper operation of her business.

loans.name: Nargis

texts.ru:
Nargis B. has been a MicroInvest client since 2006. She got her first loan to expand her business which was still small. She has shown herself to be an exemplary client.

Nargis is 41 years old, she is married and has 3 children. The profits from her business add to her family’s budget. In addition to selling women’s clothing Nargis sews women’s dresses in her house which brings in additional profits. Nargis has turned to MicroInvest for her next loan to purchase summer clothing and other new products for sale.

Бабаева Наргис является клиентом МикроИнвест с августа 2006 года. Тогда она впервые получила займ для расширения своего тогда еще маленького бизнеса. За время кредитования в Микроинвест показала себя образцовым клиентом. Наргис 41 год, она замужем и у нее 3 детей. Прибыль от бизнеса вносит хорошую прибавку в ее семейный бюджет. Кроме продажи женской одежды она еще шьет дома женские платья. это приносит дополнительную прибыль. One year ago Husrav turned to MicroInvest for a loan to purchase necessary materials for his work, such as videocassettes. Now he would like to expand his business and needs a new loan.

Получаемой зарплаты не хватает на полноценное содержание семьи и поэтому Хусрав дополнительно занимается видеосъемкой торжественных мероприятий у различных частных лиц. Полученное вознаграждение является его дополнительным заработком. Еще он занимается видеомонтажом. loans.name: Las Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.en:
Panilus E. is a mother of two young boys (ages 2 and 9).  She moved to the small community of Momjor, just outside of Puerto Plata just several months ago, where she lives alone selling clothing on the streets.  She made the move, leaving behind her two children to live with their grandmother, so that she would be able to find a way to pay for their education.  When asked if she would like them to come and join her here in the Dominican Republic, she quickly responded, “No”.  While not many complete the education system in Haiti (for lack of funds), it is a far superior education to that of the public schools in the Dominican Republic.  Panilus has left everything she knows to fulfill her dream of putting her children through school in Haiti.  The money from this loan will be used to buy more pants, shirts, and shoes to sell on the streets of Momjor.  Panilus hopes that someday she will be able to afford the rent of a small store to sell her clothes from.

Panilus E. is just one member of the 10 person micro-bank, Las Mujeres Unidas.  Each of these unique Dominican entrepreneurs unite in solidarity, allowing them to access funding that they would otherwise never be able to receive on their own.  The concept of this group bank paying their loan together is to reduce the risk of one person defaulting, as the others members gladly help cover one another’s payments in order to receive their next loan together.

On behalf of Panilus, Las Mujeres Unidas, and the entire team here at Esperanza International, we thank you for your support and awareness of the global issue of poverty, in which your efforts are helping to make a difference.

loans.use: To buy more skirts, pants, t-shirts to sell in the street.

loans.name: Ayékinam

texts.fr:

This first loan she is seeking will allow her to purchase five cartons of lotions, two cartons of soap, and one carton of shampoo.
