En 2005, elle a ouvert son salon de coiffure « SANDRINE COIFFURE » dans le quartier d’Agoè à Lomé et vend aussi des produits de beauté. Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 5 cartons de laits, 2 cartons de savons et 1 carton de shampoon.

loans.use: Purchase cosmetic products

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for WAGES - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Bear Bozzu Group

texts.en: Abdul T. is very grateful to Kiva for his previous $175 loan. With the loan, Abdul purchased dozens of dried fish using cash and thus increased his income. The profit enabled him to begin building his own business capital and family income. Abdul is the group leader, 45 years old, married and with four children. He organized and encouraged the group members to save to mitigate late payment. The group members also assist each other to purchase the fish in turns. All the members sell fish in Magburaka town and surrounding villages, and are requesting a loan of Le.3,200,000 ($US1,100) to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To increase stock of fish in order to earn more income.

loans.name: Kossiwa Thérèse

texts.fr:
Born November 10th, 1968 in Lomé, Mrs. Kossiwa Thérèse S. is a very energetic woman married to Mr. Yao SOADJEDE who is a master upholsterer. She has three children and sells mattresses and fabric in Agoè neighborhood. She began doing business in 2000 and has already benefitted from one loan from WAGES. She promptly repaid her first loan and is now seeking a second to purchase 20 mattresses in order to be able to offer her customers the latest designs.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer

Née la 10 novembre 1968 à Lomé, Madame S. Kossiwa Thérèse est une femme très dynamique qui s’est mariée à monsieur SOADJEDE Yao qui est un maître tapissier. Elle a trois enfants et exerce le commerce de matelas et de tissus dans le quartier d’Agoè. Elle a commencé cette activité depuis l’an 2000 et a une fois bénéficié du crédit auprès de WAGES. Elle a promptement remboursé son premier crédit et sollicite ce second prêt pour acheter 20 matelas afin de pouvoir mettre ses clients au parfum des nouveautés.

loans.use: Purchase of 20 mattresses

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for WAGES - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr:
Originally from Ghana, Mrs. Abla W. was born on August 22, 1972 in Hohoè, a town located in Ghana. She is divorced and has one child. In the year 2000, in order to support herself and her child, she opened a little store selling staple foodstuffs in Agoè district in Lomé. The store is conveniently located in a place where there is a lot of going and coming which allows her to do a brisk business.

This is her third loan and the amount she is presently requesting will allow her to purchase 10 sacks of rice, 5 tins of peanut oil, 10 cases of spaghetti and 16 cases of peas.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Originaire du Ghana, Madame W. Abla est née le 22 août 1972 à Hohoè ville situé au Ghana. Elle est une femme divorcée avec un enfant. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et celui de son enfant, elle a ouvert au cours de l’année 2000, un magasin de vente des produits de premières nécessités dans le quartier d’Agoè à Lomé. L’emplacement de sa boutique située dans un milieu animé lui permet de bien vendre.

Elle est à son troisième cycle de prêt et le crédit actuel qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 10 sacs de riz, 5 bidons d’huile végétale à base d’arachide, 10 cartons de spaghetti et 16 cartons de petits pois.

loans.use:
Purchase of 10 sacks of rice and other staples for re-sale

Achat de 10 sacs de riz et autres produits de premières nécessités

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for WAGES - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Ablavi A. was born on April 8, 1980 in Abidjan, the capital of the Republic of Côte d’Ivoire. She is married to Mr. Kossi Dzivon who is an auto mechanic in the village of Adétikopé. She has three children and works as a hair-braider in the same village. She began this trade in 2002. She has already received one loan and is now requesting this loan to purchase 5 cases of hair extensions. Her business doesn’t demand a lot of financial input but just know-how in order to earn an acceptable income. She would like to stock up on hair extensions so as to avoid having to deal with frequent price rises for articles whose prices are likely to flare up from one day to the other.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame A. Ablavi est née le 8 avril 1980 à Abidjan, la capitale de la République de la Côte d’Ivoire. Elle s’est mariée à monsieur DZIVON Kossi qui est un mécanicien auto dans le village d’Adétikopé. Elle a trois enfants et est une tresseuse dans ledit village. Elle a commencé par exercer ce métier depuis 2002. Elle a une fois bénéficié du crédit et sollicite actuellement ce prêt pour acheter 5 cartons de fil à tresser. Son activité ne demande pas trop de moyens financiers mais du savoir faire et procure assez de revenus. Elle désire faire le stock de fil à tresser pour éviter de faire face à l’augmentation fréquente du prix des articles qui flambe de jour en jour.

loans.use:
Purchase of 5 cases of hair extensions

Achat de 5 cartons d fil à tresser

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr:
Mr. Kossi A. was born on November 30, 1975 in Gamé-séva in Zio Prefecture. He is a shoemaker and lives in Anome district in Lomé, where he has set up his business making and selling shoes. ETS THE BETTER SHOES came into being in 2003 but has actually been around for more than 10 years. His business is buying and selling shoes, but also repairing shoes and creating new models.

This first credit that he is requesting will allow him to buy 40 pairs of shoes so as to expand his stock and be able to have a good turnover.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur A. Kossi est né le 30 novembre 1975 à Gamé-séva dans la préfecture de Zio. Il est cordonnier et réside dans le quartier d’Anome à Lomé ou il a crée son établissement de fabrication et de vente de chaussures. ETS THE BETTER SHOES est crée en 2003 mais reconnu comme un établissement à plus de 10ans d’existence. Son activité consiste à acheter et revendre chaussures. Il répare également les chaussures et crée aussi de nouveaux modèles.

Ce premier crédit qu’il sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 40 paires de chaussures afin d’augmenter son stock et de pouvoir bien vendre.

loans.use:
Purchase of 40 pairs of shoes

Achat de 40 paires de chaussures

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for WAGES - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Mousse-Tafa

texts.fr:
Married and the father of three children, Mr. Mousse-Tafa A. was born on September 18, 1970 in Lomé. He is a barber in the Agbalépédo neighborhood not far from that district’s open-air market. He opened a barbershop he calls ABISCO COIFFURE in 2006.

He presently lacks certain necessary equipment and is requesting this first loan to buy 4 clippers, 3 mirrors, and two packs of razor blades. With this credit he would also like to redecorate his barbershop so as to attract as many clients as possible.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Marié et père de trois enfants, Monsieur A. Mousse-Tafa est né le 18 septembre 1970 à Lomé. Il est coiffeur dans le quartier d’Agbalépédo, non loin du marché dudit quartier. Il a ouvert cet atelier dénommé ABISCO COIFFURE en 2006.

Actuellement il manque de certains outils de travail et sollicite à cet effet ce premier crédit pour acheter 4 tondeuses, 3 miroirs et 2 paquets de lames. Avec ce crédit, il désire également réaménager son atelier afin d’attirer plus de clients possible.

loans.use:
Purchase of barber's tools

Achat d'outils de travail

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for WAGES - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Aïcha

texts.fr:
Born in 1977 in Bafilo, Mrs. Aïcha A. is married to Mr. Laminou Seydou who is a driver. She has one child, and she sells African print cloth as an ambulant retailer, going through the streets in the Agoè neighborhood. She began this business during 2007.

Having a problem due to insufficient stock, she is requesting a first loan to buy 27 lengths of African print cloth of middle quality and 9 lengths of average quality so that she can attract more customers.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née en 1977 à Bafilo, Madame A. Aïcha s’est mariée à monsieur SEYDOU Laminou qui est chauffeur. Elle a un enfant et est revendeuse ambulant de pagne dans le quartier d’Agoè. Elle a commencé cette activité au cours de l’année 2007.

Mais étant confronté au problème d’insuffisance de stock, elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter 27 pièces de pagnes de qualité intermédiaire et 9 pièces de qualité moyenne afin de pouvoir attirer plus de clients.

loans.use:
Purchase of 36 lengths of African print cloth

Achat 36 pièces de pagnes

loans.name: Maria José

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria is 39 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Villa Reconciliación. She's married and has a small child who attends school. Her husband is a security guard and supports the family with daily expenses.

Mrs. Maria sells tortillas and has five years experinece. She got this business going with her own money. With the loan requested she hopes to purchase more corn and store it. This way she will always have corn in reserve.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Maria tiene 39 años de edad, habita en el bario Villa Reconciliación, es casada y tiene un hijo menor de edad que está estudiando, su esposo trabaja como vigilante y aporta a los gastos de la familia. La Sra. Maria vende tortilla y tiene cinco años de experiencia, ella inició con fondos propios. Con el préstamo que le otorguen es para capital de trabajo en la compra de maíz y tener almacenado el producto para que no falte sus venta a sus clientes. A futuro es captar clientes en los restaurantes y otros, mejorar el nivel de vida y educar a su hijo.

loans.use: Purchase of corn to make tortillas.

loans.name: Jerobia

texts.es:
Jerobia is small business owner who sells clothes and cosmetics. She also does sewing jobs at the same time. She started her business 8 years ago and would like to increase her customer base and also improve the merchandise that she offers.

Jerobia is 45 years old and lives in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood of Managua. She's married and her husband is self-employed as an electrician. She has 4 children - 3 of them school-aged and the oldest son lives on his own.

Her greatest goal is to be able to provide an education to her three sons so that the family can continue to get ahead and improve their standard of living and also so they can develop into good men and good members of society.

The loan that she is asking for will be used to purchase construction materials to begin construction on a porch for her home and to be able to provide her family better security and a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Jerobia es una pequeña comerciante que se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosméticos a la misma vez que realiza trabajos de costura, desde hace 8 años inició este negocio del que espera poder aumentar su clientela y mejorar también la oferta que ofrece. Doña Jerobia tiene 45 años, habita en el barrio Villa reconciliación de Managua, es casada, su esposo es electricista y trabaja por cuenta propia. Tiene 4 hijos, 3 de ellos están en edad escolar y su hijo mayor es independiente a ella. Su mayor meta es poder darle educación a sus tres hijos para que cómo familia puedan salir adelante, y ellos mismos puedan desarrollarse como hombes de bien para la sociedad. El préstamo lo está solicitando para compra de materiales de construcción para empezar a construir el porche de su casa de habitación y poder darle a su familia mayor seguridad y mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to build a porch for her home.

loans.name: Eliseo Ramón

texts.es:
Eliseo P. is 40 years old and lives in the Memorial Sandio neighborhood. He's married and his wife works as a street vendor selling clothes and shoes. Together he and his wife have 3 boys. His youngest son is 12 years old and is in grade school, while his other two sons are 16 and 14 and are in high school.

Eliseo has a delivery business and he has a van that he uses for this job. Also in his free time, he works as a mechanic. He began his delivery business 15 years ago and prior to that, he worked as a mechanic.

He has plans to acquire a new vehicle for his deliveries, although his current priority is to take care of the well-being of his family. He will use the loan to build a porch for his home to provide better security to his family.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer,

Don Eliseo P. tiene 40 años de edad, habita en el barrio Memorial Sandino. Es casado, su esposa es comerciante y se dedica a la venta ambulante de ropa y zapatos. Juntos procrearon 3 hijos varones, su hijo menor de 12 años está estudiando la educación primaria y sus otros dos hijos de 16 y 14 años estudian la educación secundaria. El negocio de don Eliseo es Acarreo, posee una camioneta con la que realiza este trabajo, también en los tiempos que tiene libre se dedica a la mcánica.Empezó este negocio del acarreo desde hace 15 años, anteriormente se dedicaba solo a mecánica. Entre sus planes está la adquisición de un nuevo vehículo para sus acarreos, aunque su prioridad en estosmomentos es velar por el bienestar de su familia, por lo que usará el préstamo para construir el porche de su casa de habitación, para darle mayor seguridad a su familia.

loans.use: To purchase materials to build a porch

loans.name: José Andrés

texts.es:
José Andrés is a businessman that works buying and selling recycled products such as iron, copper, bronze and aluminum. This business has grown since he started it three years ago, and he has been able to increase the variety of materials that he works with.

José Andrés is 36 years old and is married. His wife works taking care of the home and family.

In the winter when it rains, his house gets flooded with water and this is why he needs this loan. He wants to buy construction materials to build a wall to prevent the water from coming into the home and flooding it.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

José Andrés es un comerciante que se dedica a la compra y venta de productos de reciclaje como hierro, cobre, bronce y aluminio, desde hace tres años empezó este negocio, el cual con el pasar de los años ha ido creciendo y ha podido aumentar la variedad de materiales con los que trabaja. José Andrés tiene 36 años de edad, es casado, su esposa se dedica al cuido de la casa y de la familia. Con el invierno su casa presenta muchas necesidades, cuando llueve el agua se le mete a su casa por la parte de abajo, es por eso que necesita el préstamo porque quiere comprar materiales de construcción para construir un muro y evitar que el agua se le siga metiendo.

loans.use: Purchase iron, cement and sand to build a wall in his home.

loans.name: Fanny Del Socorro

texts.es:
Fanny is 46 years old and lives in the Hialeah neighborhood. She's married and her husband works in an office which helps with household expenses. She has 2 daughters - 19 and 11 years old.

4 years ago, Fanny decided to set up a business - computer rentals and services for making international phone calls. The idea of this business came from a suggestion of her husband, who was looking for a way to increase the income for his family. Through these years, this business has been able to support the family and allow them to get ahead in life. The plans for the business include acquiring more computers to be able to make the internet cafe bigger.

She needs this loan so that she can change the ceiling in her living room to protect it from the winter.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Fanny tiene 46 años de edad, habita en el barrio Hialeah, es casada, su esposo es oficinista y le apoya en los gastos familiares. Tiene 2 hijas de 19 y 11 años de edad. Hace 4 años Doña Fanny decidió poner un negocio de alquiler de computadoras y servicios de llamadas internacionales, este negocio salió como sugerencia desu esposo, buscando la manera de generar mayores ingresos para su familia, y a través de estos años se ha podido mantener y salir adelante, los planes para su negocio son adquirir más computadoras para poder agrandar el cyber cafe. El préstamo lo necesita para cambiar el techo de la sala de su vivienda y protegerse del invierno

loans.use: To purchase materials such as zinc to change the ceiling in the living room of her home.

loans.name: Mauricia's Group

texts.es:
Mauricia, Juana and Julia are members of the Sumacc Huayta communal bank, which means beautiful flower in Quechua.

Mauricia is a single mother, 40 years old and has 1 daughter. She is an ambulatory vendor who sells food in the Santa Clara market, which she does every morning, and she also sells stockings in the same market.

Juana is a single mother, 35 years old and has 2 children, while Julia lives with her partner, is 21 years old and has 1 son. Juana and Julia shine shoes in the Luis Carranza park, which is an activity they do every day from 7 in the morning till 7 at night.

Mauricia, Juana and Julia need loans of 300 soles each, which will be used to buy stockings, shoe polish, dyes, chamois cloth and brushes.

Mauricia, Juan and Julia dream of making improvements to their homes, providing a good education for their children, and that their businesses improve.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Mauricia, Juana y Julia son socias del Banco Comunal Sumacc Huayta que significa BelL. Flor en quechua.

Mauricia es madre soltera, tiene 40 años y 1 hija, Mauricia venD. comida D. manera ambulatoria en el mercado Santa Clara, actividad que realiza por las mañanas, además venD. medias D. manera ambulatoria en el mismo mercado.

Por otro lado Juana es madre soltera, tiene 35 años y 2 hijos, mientras que Julia es conviviente, tiene 21 años y 1 hijo, Juana y Julia se dedican a lustrar zapatos en el parque D. Luis Carranza, actividad que realizan todos los días desD. las 7 D. mañana a 7 D. L. noche.

Mauricia, Juana y Julia necesitan prestamos D. 300 soles cada una, dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. medias, betún, tintes, gamuza y escobilL..

Los sueños D. Mauricia, Juana y Julia son mejorar sus viviendas, brindar una buena educación a sus hijos y que sus negocios mejoren.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for their businesses: stockings, shoe polish, dyes, chamois cloth and brushes.

loans.name: Mayra

texts.es:
"The business I have is a small snack stand. I need more supplies but at the moment I don´t have the capital I need to investment in the business. This is why I am requesting a loan for $1,000 dollars, in order to buy supplies for this business, which is the source of income for my family."

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

El negocio que tengo es de un pequeño snack. Pero me esta haciendo falta mas mercancía pero por el momento no tengo el capital necesario para invertirle al negocio es. Por eso que solicito un préstamo de $ 1,000.00 dlls. Para la compra de mercancía ya que este negocio es la fuente de ingresos de mi familia.

loans.use: Purchase supplies.

loans.name: Faindu Group

texts.en:
Mye B. is the group leader of Faindu. He is 41 years old, married and with five children. He sells stones and sand to builders and has been running the stone mining for three years. With his first loan from SMT, he hired three laborers and was able to break more stones. The loan also enabled him to hire transport to take the stones and sand to the market and this has increased his income greatly. He would like to expand his business by hiring more laborers.

Other group members are Abibatu who sells bread and who would like a loan to purchase wheat flour and yeast on wholesale; Idrisa who owns small grocery shop; and Mariatu who sells clothes. The group is requesting a loan of Le.2,600,000 ($US900) to expand their businesses.

loans.use: Hire labor and to purchase wheat flour, clothes and grocery stock.

loans.name: Saturnina's Group

texts.es:
Saturnina, Dina and Nicolaza are members of the Sumacc Huayta communal bank, which means "beautiful flower" in Quechua.

Saturnina is single and 26 years old and studied tailoring. Saturnina sells CDs from a stand in the Nery García market; she buys her products in Lima.

Dina is a single mother, 27 years old and has 1 son. Dina sells a variety of clothing on credit to friends and family.

Nicolaza is a widow, 77 years old and has 10 children, 5 of whom live with her. Nicolaza does beautiful handiwork, such as weavings and embroidery and has a few women who help her with this. She sells her work to intermediaries.

Saturnina, Dina and Nicolaza need loans for 1000, 600 and 750 soles respectively, money which will be invested in purchasing CDs, stockings, lingerie, corsets and a variety of wool.

Saturnina, Dina and Nicolaza dreams include: producing greater quantities, having a dressmaking workshop, and having their own store.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Saturnina, Dina y Nicolaza son socias D. Banco Comunal Sumacc Huayta que significa Bella Flor en quechua.

Saturnina es soltera y tiene 26 años, estudio corte y confección, Saturnina vende CDS en un puesto D. mercado Nery García, sus productos los compra en la ciudad de Lima.

Por otro lado Dina es madre soltera, tiene 27 años y 1 hijo, Dina vende ropa variada, sus ventas los realiza al crédito a amigos y familiares.

Mientras que Nicolaza es viuda, tiene 77 años y 10 hijos de los cuales solo 5 viven con ella, Nicolaza realiza bellos trabajos artesanales, como tejidos y bordados, para lo cual cuenta con mujeres que le ayudan, sus productos los vende a intermediarios.

Saturnina, Dina y Nicolaza necesitan un préstamo de 1000 soles, 600 soles, 750 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de discos, medias, ropas interiores, fajas y lanas variadas.

Los sueños de Saturnina, Dina y Nicolaza son producir en mayor cantidad, tener un taller de confección de prendas de vestir, una tienda propia y estable.

loans.use: Invest in CDs, stockings, lingerie, corsets and a variety of wool.

loans.name: Olga Marina

texts.es:
Olga is 40 years old and lives an a neighborhood next to Villa Venezuela. She is married and has three children, 11, 13, and 15 years old. Her husband is abroad and supports her financially.

Doña Olga works in a school and is the director there. The loan she is requesting is for construction on her home to build a porch. In the future, she would like to keep making improvements to her home and improve her standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Olga tiene 40 años de edad, habita en el barrio anexo de Villa Venezuela, es casada y tiene tres hijos de 11,13 y 15 años de edad. Su esposo está en el extranjero y le apoya económicamente.

Doña Olga trabaja en centro educativo y es la directora de dicho centro, con este préstamo que esta solicitando es para infraestructura de su vivienda en la construcción de un porche. A futuro es seguir haciendo mejoras a su vivienda, y mejorar el nivel de vida.

loans.use: Build a porch onto her home.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
"My business is selling tacos and lunches. I have been doing this for more than a year, but I need better quality equipment so that I can offer more variety to my customers. At the moment I don´t have the necessary capital and I don´t want to take equity from the business, as this is my family´s source of income. For this reason, I am requesting a loan of $1,000 dollars to buy equipment for the snack stand."

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

El negocio que tengo es de venta de tacos y lonches. Tengo ya con el mas de un año pero me esta haciendo falta un equipo de mejor calidad y que pueda tener mas variedad de comida para ofrecerla a mis clientes. Pero por el momento no tengo el capital que necesito y no quiero descapitalizar el negocio ya que es la fuente de ingresos de mi familia. Es por eso que solicito un préstamo de $1,000.00 dlls. Para la comprar de equipo para un snack.

loans.use: Buy equipment for a snack stand.

loans.name: Dominga Geronima's Group

texts.es:
Dominga, Maribel and Marisol are members of the Musuq Rumi communal bank, which means "new stone" in Quechua.

Dominga is single and 25 years old. Dominga sells breakfasts at the entrance to the interprovincial bus company; she has a cart and works from 5 in the morning till 8 in the morning. Sometimes she sells candy outside of one of the schools.

Maribel lives with her partner, is 19 years old and is pregnant with her first child. Maribel sells candy as an ambulatory vendor, using a tricycle to get around the central streets of the city.

Marisol is married, 29 years old and has 2 children. Marisol is an ambulatory vendor in the Magdalena market and sells an anti-inflamatory topical rub; she works both mornings and nights.

Dominga, Maribel and Marisol need loans for 600, 400 and 1000 soles, respectively. Dominga will invest in purchasing bricks for building her house; Maribel will buy cookies, gum and candies; while Marisol will start a new business selling groceries.

Dominga, Maribel and Marisol dreams are to: have their own home, land, progress with their family and have a stable business.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Dominga, Maribel y Marisol son socias del Banco Comunal Musuq Rumi que significa Nueva Piedra en quechua.

Dominga es soltera y tiene 25 años, Dominga vende desayunos en la puerta de una empresa de transporte interprovincial de manera ambulatoria, tiene una carreta, actividad que realiza desde las 5 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la mañana. En algunas oportunidades vende golosinas en una academia.

Por otro lado Maribel es conviviente, tiene 19 años y esta embarazada de su primer hijo, Maribel vende golosinas de manera ambulatoria en un triciclo, se ubica en una calle céntrica de la ciudad.

Mientras que Marisol es casada, tiene 29 años y 2 hijos, Marisol vende emoliente de manera ambulatoria en el mercado Magdalena, actividad que realiza por las mañanas y las noches.

Dominga, Maribel y Marisol necesitan préstamos de 600 soles, 400 soles, 1000 soles, Dominga invertirá en la compra de adobes para la construcción de su casa, por otro lado Maribel en la compra de galletas, chicles, caramelos, mientras que Marisol iniciará un nuevo negocio de venta de abarrotes.

Los sueños de Dominga, Maribel y Marisol son tener casa propia, un terreno, salir adelante con su familia y tener un negocio seguro.

loans.use: Dominga will buy bricks for building a home; Maribel will buy merchandise for her business; Marisol will invest in a new business selling groceries.

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
"I have been making cakes for a little more than one year. My business is making cakes for different occasions, such as 15th birthday parties, weddings, baptisms, birthdays, etc. However, I need equipment so I can make the cakes more quickly and easily and to be able to deliver on time. For this reason, I am asking for a loan of $500 dollars to purchase equipment such as an oven and a more powerful mixer."
Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Tengo aproximadamente más de 1 año con el negocio de repostería. En el negocio me dedico a ser pasteles de diferente ocasión con Quince años, bodas, bautizos, cumpleaños etcétera. Pero me esta haciendo falta algo de maquinaria para poder hacer los pasteles mas rápido y sin tanto trabajo y entregarlos  a tiempo. Es por eso que solicito un préstamo de $500.00 dlls para la compra de maquinaria como un horno y batidora más potentes.

loans.use: Buy an oven and mixer for making cakes.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
"For more than 30 years I have been in the business of making and selling tamales along the streets of Nuevo Laredo. This business is the source of income for my family, as I am a single mother and have 3 children who need attention and need me to spend more time with them. For this reason I am asking for a loan of $1,200 dollars, to build a fixed stand at my home, and in this way I can take care of my business and my children."

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Tengo ya más de 30 años que me dedico a la elaboración y venta de tamales por las calles de la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo. Este negocio es la fuente de ingresos de mi familia ya que soy madre soltera y tengo 3 hijo los cuales necesitan atención y que esta mas tiempos con ellos. Es por eso que solicito un préstamo de $ 1,200.00 Dlls. Para la construcción de un puesto fijo en la casa y así estar atendiendo mi negocio y cuidando a mis hijos.

loans.use: Build a stand for her business.

loans.name: Ishmanayamba Group

texts.en:
Finna T. is the group leader of Ishmanayamba and one of the first Kiva clients in Sierra Leone. She is thirty-eight years old, married and with four children. Her business is the main source of income for the family. Finna sells palm oil and other food items. She would like to purchase 60 gallons of palm oil to increase her inventory and income.

Mohamed and Tury both own kiosks in the same town and would like to expand their businesses, too. The group is therefore requesting a loan of Le.1,800,000 ($US625).

loans.use: Purchase palm oil and inventory for general store.

loans.name: Francisco Oscar

texts.es:
"For more than a year, my wife and I have been working in this business. The business is selling women's and men's shoes. But we also want to sell shoes for children and we do not have enough money stock our business without using equity. For this reason we are requesting a loan for $1,200 dollars, in order to buy children´s shoes."

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Tenemos ya mas de 1 años con el negocio en el trabajamos mi esposa y yo. El negocio es venta de calzado para dama y caballero. Pero también queremos vender calzado para niños y nos esta haciendo falta capital para surtir el negocio sin descapitalizarlo. Es por eso que solicitamos un préstamo de $ 1,200.00 Dlls. Para la comprar de Calzado para niños.

loans.use: Buy merchandise.
